loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es: Martha de 40 años es madre de una niña de 9 años y dos jóvenes de 14 y 18 años de edad, es una ama de casa  que además de cumplir con las labores del hogar, aporta a la economía familiar con los ingresos que genera su actividad de consultora de una empresa distribuidora de productos por catálogo. Ella vende prendas de vestir, artículos para el hogar y cosméticos, productos que promociona diariamente mediante visitas a sus clientes.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en perfumes, ropa, y artículos de tocador.  Con esta inversión planea incrementar el inventario de productos y el número de clientes, así mismo aumentar su nivel de ventas y generar mayores utilidades.  Su sueño es mejorar su calidad de vida y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Martha, 40 years old, is the mother of a 9 year-old girl and two teenagers, 14 and 18 years old. She is a housewife who, in addition to completing the housework, contributes to the household income with the profits generated by her work as a consultant in a company that distributes products by catalog. She sells clothing, household goods and cosmetics, products that she promotes daily by visiting her customers. 

Currently, she is applying for her first Kiva credit funding from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to invest in perfumes, clothing and toiletries. With this investment, she plans on increasing her inventory of products and number of customers, and therefore to increase her level of sales and earn more profits. Her dream is to improve her quality of life and and provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to invest in perfumes, clothing and toiletries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereals from farmers to resell.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Lolita requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more boxes of fish to sell.

Lolita has been in this business for 16 years now.

Lolita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Shareena

texts.en:
Shareena is a 48-year-old married woman. She, along with her son (who is also shown in the photo), has been doing a business of animal sales and purchase for many years. They make a sufficient amount of income to bear their household expenses.

Now, she has requested for a Murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle to resell in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to resell in the market.

loans.name: Pascoa

texts.pt:
A senhora Pascoa, tem 34 anos de idade, viúva e mãe de dois filhos que frequentam o ensino secundário. Para além dos seus filhos, cuida do irmão. Com o empréstimo de 15.000,00mts vai comprar roupa usada, vulgo calamidade para revender.
É estudante e seu sonho é concluir seus estudos e suas dificuldades neste momento financeiros. Seu desafio é reembolsar o empréstimo dentro de prazo acordado para solicitar outro empréstimo.
texts.en:
Pascoa is 34 years old and a widow. She has two children who are in secondary school. Aside form her children she takes care of her brother.
With the loan for 15,000mts she will purchase used clothing, informally known as "calamidade", for re-selling.
She's a student and her dream is to finish her studies. Her struggles right now are of the financial kind. Her challenge is repaying the loan within the agreed-upon timeframe so she can apply for another loan.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing for re-selling.

loans.name: Regilio

texts.pt:
O senhor Regilio tem 32 anos de idade, casado e pai de 02 filhos menores de idade.
É trabalha como Fiel de Armazém. Com o empréstimo de 20.000,00mts vai comprar material de construção, nomeadamente: cimento blocos, varrões, estribos para construção da sua casa.
O  seu sonho é melhorar as condições de casa e sua dieta alimentar, tem como dificuldades as financeiras e seu desafio é reembolsar o empréstimo dentro de prazo acordado para solicitar outro empréstimo. .
texts.en:
Regilio is 32 years old. He's married and has two underage children.
He works as a warehouse supervisor. With the loan for 20,000mts he will purchase construction supplies, namely cement, bricks, rods and stirrups, so that he can build his house.
His dream is to improve his living conditions and his diet. His struggles are of the financial kind. His challenge is repaying the loan within the greed-upon timeframe so he can apply for another loan.

loans.use: to purchase cement, bricks, rods, and stirrups so he can build his house.

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en:
Jumwa is a married woman with 5 children. She describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal which she has been involved in for 3 years. Her business is located in a nice place. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more stocks of charcoal. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. 

This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Selestino

texts.en:
Selestino is 60 years old married with 10 children, 3 attending school, living in Kasese Uganda.  He is a businessman owning a hardware shop and has been in business for 20 years. He works hard for 12 hours a day and earns his side income from rental houses. 

He needs money to buy hardware materials like nails and iron sheets to sell, as he has a dream of expanding his business but faces a challenge of limited capital to sustain his business.

loans.use: to buy hardware materials like nails and iron sheets to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase ATM machines for offering M-Pesa bank transactions to meet client need in money transaction services.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a very hard working woman. She is married and she, with husband, makes a living by working in agriculture. She does tailoring to earn additional income. They have two children, one who attends high school and one who is in university.

Joyce primarily takes care of the domestic positions at home. When she was young, her mother taught her how to care for the household. She also sells fruits and vegetables. She purchases the products from people in the area who grow the products. She sells them at the place where she does the tailoring from. 

She will use this loan to purchase bags of manure, fertilizer, and seeds, and to pay laborers to prepare the land. Thanks to this loan, they will be able to cultivate and have their own grains.

Joyce's dreams for the future include her children graduating from university and having a good house for her family which they are working together with the husband to attain.

She appreciates Kiva support in making their dreams to come true.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers, manure and to pay workers to prepare the land

loans.name: Fakhar

texts.en: Fakhar is a 55-year-old widow. Her son, the man shown with her in the above photo, operates a construction business, which is the primary source of their income. Fakhar's son is responsible for building the roofs of houses during their construction. In this way, he is able to earn a sufficient income to provide for their family. However, in order to meet the everyday household expenditures, more income is required. For the growth of her son's business, Fakhar has requested a Murabaha-type loan of 20,000 PKR. This will allow him to purchase good quality timber, metal, and slate so he can meet his customers’ demands without any delays.

loans.use: to purchase good quality timber, metal, and slate so her son can meet his customers’ demands without any delays

loans.name: Silvano

texts.en:
Silvano lives in Hoima Uganda. He is aged 45, married with 4 children and all attend school. He deals in a retail shop mainly selling general merchandise like bread, salt, sugar among other items in order to raise get income. He gets additional incomes by carrying out farming mainly growing cassava and maize. 

He has hopes of growing and developing his business the more only to be limited by inadequate capital and high rental fees. He will use the loan facility to buy more stock like plastics and salt for sell.

loans.use: to buy more stock like plastics and salt for selling.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a male aged 52 years with 12 children, of which 5 are attending school. He deals in second hand shoes and he has no additional source of income. He started up the business so as to look after his children. 

He describes himself as a hardworking person determined to expand his business and educate his children. He is requesting a loan to buy more shoes for selling.

loans.use: to buy more second hand shoes for selling, which is his only business

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a hardworking farmer from Kamothoi village, Kenya, who is involved in dairy farming. Her work brings home an important source of income. Since she is raising 3 children, she is continually exploring new ways to grow her business and generate more income to take care of her family's growing needs. 
 
Most rural smallholder farmers are excluded from formal markets because they lack transportation means and the quality of their produce only meets local market standards. 

Jane is seeking a loan to purchase a motorcycle. With the motorcycle, Jane will overcome her transportation challenges and take part in the formal market process where prices are better. 
This investment will have several positive impacts on her life which include; access to formal market, better prices for her produce, better income for her family and improved living standards.

loans.use: to buy a farm transportation motorcycle for fast transportation of her goods to market

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is businesswoman running a general store selling dry foods like maize four, baking flour, rice, beans. She is in this business for three years now, working from 7.am to 9:30.pm per working day with the ability to make a nice return per month. She is late 30's old, married and has four daughters who are at school. 

Christina dreams to improve her shop, being able to sell varieties of items as other shops do. To reach this, she has applied for a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which she will invest in her shop, to have new stocks for her shop. She will so very thankful with everyone who will support her business with credit. 
Christina will hold herself accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new stocks of foodstuffs for her shop

loans.name: Armenuhi

texts.en:
Armenuhi is dentist from Vanadzor town. She lives with her husband, two children and parents-in-law. Armenuhi's husband is also dentist by profession. 
To purchase special tools needed for her work, Armenuhi asks lenders to support her. 

She has been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Armenuhi hopes to receive lenders' support ensuring responsible monthly payments.

loans.use: to pay for special tools for her dental clinic, needed for providing service

loans.name: Gloria Mery

texts.es:
Gloria junto a su esposo son un pareja humilde, trabajadora y servicial que atiende un negocio de tienda general, el cual heredo de su familia y que trabaja desde el año 2000.
La tienda ha significado progreso, esperanza, sueños, lágrimas de alegría pues gracias a estas 4 paredes la vida de gloria ha tenido un cambio radical ya que tienen un vida digna y siguen creciendo y su meta es llegar a tener un supermercado que es el sueño y a lo que apuntan diariamente Gloria junto con su esposo.
Ahora esta mujer quiere solicitar un préstamo para abastecer y aumentar la cantidad de inventario en su negocio, el dinero serpa destinado en compras en cantidades de granos, refrescos, cervezas y abarrotes principalmente.
texts.en:
Gloria and her husband are a humble, hardworking, and helpful couple who run a general store, which Gloria inherited from her family and where she has worked since 2000. 

The store has meant a lot to them--progress, hope, dreams, and tears of joy. Thanks to these four walls, Gloria has seen radical changes in her life. She and her family now have a decent life and continue moving forward. Her goal is to have a supermarket, and this dream is what she and her husband aim for every day.  

Now, she wants to request a loan in order to stock her store and increase the quantity of her inventory. The money will be used to purchase grains, drinks, beer, and grocery items in bulk.

loans.use: to purchase grains, drinks, beer, and grocery items in bulk.

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es:
Rosaura es una joven de 25 años de edad que día a día trabaja para salir adelante y buscar unas mejores condiciones de vida para su familia, su meta es consolidar un negocio que perdure en el tiempo y que sea el sostenimiento para ella y sus padres por un largo tiempo, permitiéndole inclusive estudiar para proyectar su venta de variedades en un plano  global.

Empezó hace algunos años y gracias a los préstamos a sus buenas decisiones, su perseverancia, su humildad y cordialidad ha visto como su empresa crece y se adentra en la menta y corazón del consumidor.

Para mejorar su negocio y que este sea más atractivo Rosaura necesita un capital y por ello busca solicitar un préstamo para la compra de accesorios, alimentos, Snaks y materiales para realizar adecuaciones locativas.

Este préstamo ayudara a mejorar y aumentar el surtido que tiene Rosaura en la tienda.
texts.en:
Rosaura is a young 25 year old woman who works day to day to get ahead as well as searching for better living conditions for her family, her goal is to fund a business that would persist through time and that would be the sustenance for her and her parents for a long time, including permitting her to study in order to project her sale of items onto a global plane.


She began a few years ago and thanks to the the loans and her good decisions, perseverance, humility, and cordiality she has seen how her business grows and enters the minds and hearts of the consumer.


In order to improve her business and make it more attractive Rosaura needs capital and for that reason she is looking to apply for a loan for the purchase of accessories, snacks, and materials in order to make local improvements.


This loan will help to improve and grow the supply that Rosaura has in the store.

loans.use: Purchase of accessories, food, snacks, and materials in order to make local improvements.

loans.name: Gia

texts.en:
Gia, 37 years old is a married man and lives in the village of Nichbisi. He has a wife, who is a private cleaner and gets a small income. The family lives under poverty as having no source of significant income. 

Sadly, for lack of economic resources, Gia was unable to study a professional career. To get his own small income Gia works on family-owned agricultural land, growing beans. To increase his family's living condition and tackle with the financial difficulties, Gia wants to expand the agribusiness and start dairy farming. 

He will purchase a milk-cow and start producing dairy-products for local trading. All the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions and lack of experience.  After several unsuccessful attempts, Gia applied for the credit to MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of Start Up program, which is joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. 


He is a very enthusiastic and hard working person with a great desire to provide his family with good style of  life.  This credit will be a great support for the family. Gia is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: To expand his small agricultural activity and purchase a cow

loans.name: Asia

texts.en: Asia is a 44-year-old married woman. The man shown in the photo is her husband, who is a taxi driver by profession. He drives in the main city and makes enough income to cover all the expenses of his family. He wants to change the taxi's engine, as it is causing a lot of pollution and is consuming too much oil for its work. That is why Asia has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR for her husband to buy a new engine for the taxi to provide better facilities for his customers. Asia is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for the taxi to provide better facilities for his customers.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.pt:
A senhora Isabel tem 46 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 4 filhos dos quais 3 são independentes, uma é menor, é negociante e vive em casa própria com a sua família.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de cerveja, refrescos, e outros produtos para revender.
No futuro pretende construir mercearia visto que agora deixa os produtos dentro da casa e vende ao relento, melhorar a sua casa e construir mais dependências para arrendar visto que é uma das fontes de rendimento mensal.
O seu maior desafio é liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora de modo a garantir o bom nome na instituição e consequentemente beneficiar se de empréstimos subsequentes.
texts.en:
Isabel is 46 years old and single. She has four children, three of whom are independent and one is an underage daughter. She's a vendor and lives with her family in a house that she owns.
The amount of the loan will be used to purchase beer, refreshments, and other products for re-selling.
In the future she intends to build a grocery store, since she currently stores her merchandise inside her house and sells it out in the open. She also intends to improve her home and build more rooms for renting out as a source of income.
Her biggest challenge is repaying the loan without delinquency. That way she'll guarantee a good reputation with the institution and therefore benefit from ensuing loans.

loans.use: to purchase beer, refreshments, and other products for re-selling.

loans.name: Maria Elda

texts.en:
Maria Elda is lucky that their residence in Tondo, Manila is located near a school. It’s prolific for her “sari-sari” (variety) store business with added school supplies. But the summer season and the past school vacation was not favorable for her business. Her usual customers, the students, were not there to patronize her store. But she continued despite few customers.

Now that the school has already opened, she wishes to regain some loss. She will buy more grocery items, beverages, snacks and school supplies to cater to students. A PHP 20,000 loan will be of great help to boost her income. With this, she can assist her husband, Reuben, with their everyday needs and save for their children’s education. Maria Elda would like to ensure that their children will finish their college education so as to have a brighter future.

She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items, beverages, snacks and school supplies for her variety store

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Good day to you lenders! Liza extends her grateful appreciation to you for your previous assistance worth PHP 25,000. It has been utilized to purchase groceries, toiletries, and other products for her variety store, which consequently gave additional income for her family.

Now she still longs to continue improving her business. That is why she is appealing for a PHP 30,000 loan this time. Again, she will buy additional supplies of dry goods, grocery items, and beverages to add to her inventory. Wide selections in her store will surely make it more enticing to customers. She has been consistent in repaying her previous loan and she has the integrity to maintain it.

She is working towards her dream of enjoying better living conditions and good health for her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy dry goods, grocery items, and beverages to add to her inventory

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is aged 52 years, and she supports six children. She has been a farmer for the last two years, and the business earns her KES 12,000 per month.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops, so as to get a better harvest for family use and the surplus for sale to clients.

She plans to use the gained profits to repay the loan and expand her business sector. Her hope is to be financially stable and start a grocery shop.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops, so as to get a better harvest for family use and the surplus for sale to clients.

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is 56 years old. She lives alone in Gori district and works as a baker at a local bakery. Manana wants to start her own business and requested a loan. 
The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan. With the received credit she will open a small food shop on the first floor of her house and will work there as a saleslady. She will be able to generate stable income. 

Manana is very hardworking woman and hopes that the business will be profitable. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a small food market at her home for extra income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry feeds to increase her output so as to pay school fees

loans.name: Rev.fr.peter

texts.en:
Rev. Fr. Peter lives in Hoima Uganda. He is a very hard working Catholic priest who started his business of a retail shop, selling sugar, salt and soap among others. He intends to expand and develop his business more and trade in wholesale, however, inadequate capital hinders his business plan. 

Rev.Fr.Peter is seeking a loan facility to buy more salt, sugar and soap for sell.

loans.use: to buy more salt, sugar and soap for sale.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is aged 52, a hardworking married man father of 2.  He ventured into selling of sugar, salt, soap and general merchandise supplemented by incomes from owning rentals plus mobile money in Hoima Uganda. 

He dreams of developing and expanding his business. He will use the loan facility to buy more stock items like sugar, salt and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to buy more stock items like sugar, salt and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Olinda

texts.en: Olinda is a businesswoman from Mudzi District, Zimbabwe. She is also a Camfed Learner Guide who volunteers at the local secondary school. She used the first loan to increase her clothing stock and she finished repaying the loan within the stipulated time. With the second loan, Olinda would like to purchase more clothes to sell, in bulk, so that her sales and profits will increase. With the additional profits, she would like to expand her business so that she will be able help more vulnerable children in her community.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Gladys Aracely

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito El Esfuerzo Nos Lleva Al Éxito se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por su gastronomía y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Gladys, tiene 34 años de edad, es madre solera y tiene dos hijos de 17 y 13 años de edad, los mismos  que estudian en colegio.
Doña Gladys es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos como granos, detergentes, carnes, legumbres, entre productos de primera necesidad, así como también artículos de bazar y ropa de todo tipo, ella  trabaja todos los días y en ocasiones  sus  hijos le ayudan cuando ella sale a vender ropa en un carro que  tiene, lleva más de 3 años con este negocio el cual que le da lo necesario para salir adelante,.
Este crédito lo va a invertir en comprar víveres para surtir su tienda y ropa de todo tipo.  Lleva 4 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con  los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The credit group El Esfuerzo Nos Lleva Al Éxito meets every 15 days in the city of Manta. Manta is known for its beautiful beaches. It is well visited in all seasons of the year for its food and for being a city of unequalled beauty with many tourist attractions.
Gladys lives in this city. She is 34 years old and is a single mother of 2 children, ages 17 and 13. They are both students in high school. 
Gladys is a woman who enjoys working in order to provide for her children. She has a general store in her house where she sells all manner of products such as grains, detergents, meats, and vegetables, among other products for basic needs. She also has bazaar type items and all kinds of clothing. She works everyday and sometimes her children help her when she goes out to sell clothing from a cart that she has. She has had this business for 3 years and she has done what has been necessary to be successful.  
This loan will be used to buy supplies and all kinds of clothing to stock her store. 
She has been in the credit group for 4 years and she enjoys it because the loans allowed her to start her business. 
Her dream is to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy supplies and clothing.

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es:
En el año 1998 inicio como emprendedor el señor Luis un humilde pero trabajador fabricador de calzado que decidió lanzarse al emprendimiento buscando una mejor estabilidad económica para su familia la cual es conformada por 4 hijos ya mayores de edad y a todos los sostuvo y alimento gracias a su lindo trabajo.

Luis piensa ahora enfocarse en su vivienda y en su señora quiere trabajar para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y tener capital para la vejez que esta algo próxima, su meta es tener dinero para no pasar necesidades, por ello Luis quiere solicitar un préstamo para continuar e impulsar su actividad el cual invertirá en los materiales principales que son cuero, suelas y pegamento, un préstamo que le brindara la materia prima que procesara y venderá para generar el dinero para el sustento y mejora de su hogar.
texts.en:
Luis started his business in the year 1998. He is a humble and hard-working man who works as a shoe-maker. 

Luis decided to set up his own business in order to create financial stability for his family. He has four grown-up children and was able to support and care for all of them thanks to his business. 

Luis would now like to focus on his wife and his home and dedicate himself to improving their living conditions and to have money put away as they get ever closer to old age and retirement. Luis's goal is to have enough money that they need not go without.  

Luis is seeking a loan to continue with and grow his business, he will use the money to buy materials such as leather, soles and glue. The loan will give Luis the raw materials he needs to be able to generate money to sustain and improve his home.

loans.use: to buy leather, soles and glue.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be loyal.

He operates a motor vehicle repair business. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in an area with potential. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy motor vehicle spare parts.

His business goal is to have many shops within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his living standards. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy motor vehicle spare parts.

loans.name: Manuel Alejandro

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito El Esfuerzo Nos Lleva Al Éxito se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por su gastronomía y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive don Manuel, tiene 26 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 4 años de edad, el cual este año empezó a estudiar en un jardín d e infantes de la localidad. Su mujer es ama de casa.
El señor Manuel es hombre muy trabajador que realiza cualquier actividad para darles lo necesario a su familia, el se dedica  a la venta de pescado y queso, todos los días el se desplaza hasta las playas de la ciudad lugar donde compra el mejor pescado, vende por libras por toda la ciudad en un triciclo que él tiene, por las mañanas vende pescado y por la tarde vende queso de la misma a forma recorriendo la ciudad, él hace esto por el bien de su familia y  lleva 3 años en este negocio el cual empezó con el crédito que recibió del grupo.
Este crédito es para comprar pescado y queso. Lleva más de 3 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ellos salen adelante. Sus sueños son tener un carro para salir a realizar sus ventas.
En la foto esta el socio con su hijo.
texts.en:
The credit group "El Esfuerzo Nos Lleva al Éxito" meets every 15 days in the city of Manta. Manta is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited by many throughout the different seasons of the year, as well as for its cuisine, its unequaled beauty, and its many touristic attractions. 

In this city lives Manuel, who is 26 years old and lives in a common-law marriage through which he has a four-year-old son, who started attending a local preschool this year. His partner is a housewife. 

Manuel is a very hardworking man who will do any kind of work to provide for his family. He currently works selling fish and cheese. Every day, he travels to the city's beaches, where he purchases the best fish. He sells it by the pound throughout the city, riding his tricycle. In the mornings, he sells fish, and in the afternoons he sells cheese in the same way, traveling throughout the city. 

He does this for the well-being of his family. He has been working in this business for three years, which he was able to start through a loan he received from the group. This loan is for the purchase of fish and cheese. He has been in the credit group for three years and likes it because the loans allow him to help his family move forward. His dream is to have a car in order to go out and sell his goods. In the photo, he appears with his son.

loans.use: to purchase fish and cheese.

loans.name: Nafer Antonio

texts.es:
Nafer es un hombre solitario de 55 años de edad, una persona trabajadora, responsable y comprometida que lucha diariamente por sobrevivir.

Su antiguo trabajo y su buena costumbre para ahorrar le permitieron comprar una vivienda propia que es su más brillante logro y del que se siente muy orgullo y ahora para seguir generando recursos que le permitan sostenerse Nafer tiene una venta de carne de cerdo y ahora pide tu ayuda para ir estandarizando y adecuando su futura y deseada carnicería.

Con el ánimo de aumentar sus ventas, tener mayor inventario, Nafer quiere solicitarte un préstamo para la compra de carne de cerdo.

Con tu ayuda este hombre solitario que se rebusca su sustento diario tendrá una oportunidad para mejorar su forma de trabajar e ir transformando su espacio poco a poco hasta transfórmalo en un carnicería.
texts.en:
Nafer is a single  55 year old man, a hard-working person, responsible and dedicated to fight daily to survive.

His old job and his good habit of saving permitted him to buy his own home which is his brightest accomplishment and of which he is very proud and now in order to continue generating resources which permit him to sustain himself Nafer has a business selling pork and now is asking your help to standardize and equipping his future and hoped butcher shop. 

With the desire to grow his sales and to have a greater inventory, Nafer wishes to apply for a loan for the purchase of pork.

With your help this single man who seeks his daily sustenance will have the opportunity to improve his manner of working and go on transforming his space little by little until he transforms it into a butchery.

loans.use: Purchase of pork

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a poly tank to store water for her water vending business

loans.name: Ohoud Group

texts.en:
Basema is the featured borrower for Ohoud Group. She joined with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Basema is a 48-year-old married mother of two children. Fifteen years ago, she started preparing and selling "Mouneh" (traditional pickles) to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. She is well-known among her region for her professional skills in preparing delicious "Mouneh". 

Today, Basema is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary foodstuff in order to increase her production and satisfy her customers' requests in the holy month Ramadan. Basema is the first lady on the left of the photo, Ibtissam is the first lady on the right, and Fadia is the lady sitting in the middle of the photo.

loans.use: to buy necessary foodstuff to increase her production and satisfy her customers in the holy month of Ramadan

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops, so as to enable her to get a better harvest for family use and surplus produce for sale in the market to clients.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 58 years old and married with eight children. 

Conchita is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Conchita requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Conchita has been in pig fattening for 6 years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Conchita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 26000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers for her fish vending business.

Leonora has been in this business for 3 years. Leonora earns more income from general store.

Leonora has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ma. Leah

texts.en:
Ma. Leah is 47 years old, married with four children.

Ma. Leah works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Ma. Leah has borrowed and paid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 1 year and also earns an income from electronic mobile load retailing.

Ma. Leah aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Artavazd

texts.en:
Artavazd is involved auto repair service in Vanadzor town.  He maintains different type of cars  working in the yard of his own house, where he created very good conditions for his work. Artavazd mostly serves his local clients. He lives with his wife and two children and is the only worker and breadwinner of the family. 

He wants to be able to purchase tools and materials for car renovation works and purchase newly damaged car for renovating it and reselling.
 
Artavazd has been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.
This is Artavazd's first deal with Kiva and hopes to receive lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials for car renovation works, and purchase a newly damaged car

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a 31-year-old businesswoman, single, and residing in Chikomba West, a district in Zimbabwe. . Eunice’s business is doing very well. She was able to make her loan repayments on time, provide for herself and family as well as pay her exam fees. 

With the second loan that she is requesting, she wishes to diversify into the cattle fattening business. She will use the loan to purchase heifers and stock feeds for her new project.

Eunice volunteers as a community health trainer within the local schools, spreading health information to children and helping her community fight against HIV/AIDS, as well as poverty.

Thank you for supporting Eunice’s business!

loans.use: To purchase heifer and stock feeds to diversify into this business and pay her exam fees

loans.name: Jacqueline Mariela

texts.es: Mariela es una joven mujer emprendedora de 21 años, ella se dedica a la agricultura como lo hacían sus padres pero ocasionalmente cuando sus vecinas le solicitan trajes típicos artesanales, ella los confecciona ganando dinero extra. Actualmente ella es el único sustento económico en su familia dado que sus padres ya están ancianos. Ella con mucho esfuerzo logro limpiar y preparar el terreno agrícola con abono orgánico y solicita el préstamo para poder comprar semilla orgánica de habas y los fertilizantes orgánicos necesarios para poder tener un buen cultivo que lo espera vender a un buen precio. En el futuro espera poder mejor su casa para darle a sus padres una mejora calidad de vida, y sobre todo Mariela buscara la estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Mariela, age 21, is an enterprising young woman.  She devotes herself to agriculture as her parents did.  However, she sometimes makes traditional clothing when her neighbors ask her to do so.  She earns extra money by making the clothes.

She is currently the only financial support in her family given that her parents are now elderly.  With great effort she managed to clear and prepare the agricultural land with organic fertilizer.  She is requesting the loan in order to be able to buy organic bean seeds and the organic fertilizers needed to be able to have a good crop, which she hopes to sell for a good price.

In the future she hopes to be able to improve her house in order to give her parents a better quality of life.  Above all, Mariela is seeking financial stability.

loans.use: to buy organic bean seeds and organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Bweranyangi School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Jennifer. She is the head teacher of Bweranyangi Girls Secondary School, a 1550-student girls school in the urban Bushenyi area. 

Bweranyangi School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system in order to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent, clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Bweranyangi School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Jennifer ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system in order to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: José Alcides

texts.es: Para José de 69 años su madurez no representa una angustia, sino una fortaleza para emprender nuevos retos. Es así como hace 3 años decidió atender la sugerencia de un amigo de instalar un punto frio que es un negocio de venta al por mayor y al detal de refrescos y cervezas. José, muestra mucho entusiasmo y energía para brindar una excelente atención a sus clientes; afirma que no ha sido fácil posicionar su negocio, como para cualquier emprendedor, pero las ganas y la experiencia de vida le han permitido fidelizar a un buen número de clientes  en el sector donde reside en el municipio de Barranquilla. Los recursos de su primer credikiva que tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo domingo, los planea invertir en la compra de cervezas y refrescos al por mayor, con el fin de competir con buenos precios, adicional al buen servicio que lo caracteriza. Su visión para el futuro es ampliar su local y remodelar su vivienda.
texts.en:
For 69-year-old José, his age is not a cause for distress, but instead it is a strength to strive for new goals. This is how he decided to listen to a friend's suggestion 3 years ago and start a "punto frío," which is a business that sells soft drinks and beer both wholesale and in small amounts.

José shows a lot of enthusiasm and energy to provide excellent customer service. He declares that it has not been easy to establish his business, as with any entrepreneur, but his enthusiasm and life experience have allowed him to earn a good number of faithful clients from the area of Barranquilla where he lives.

He plans to use the resources from his first CrediKiva through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation to invest in the wholesale purchase of beer and soft drinks. His goal is to compete with good prices, in addition to the good service he is known for. His vision for the future is to enlarge his shop and remodel his home.

loans.use: to buy beer and soft drinks wholesale

loans.name: Fabio Nelson

texts.es:
Fabio es un hombre de 33 años de edad que puede que le falte trabajo, pero le sobran ideas y ganas de salir adelante, por ello se encuentra solicitando tu ayuda, tu apoyo él quiere iniciar un negocio quiere generar ingresos muy necesarios y necesitados para su familia, tiene una pareja y una hija de 7 años de edad que cree que es una princesa, el trata por todos los medios posibles de comprar cosas, darles gustos y al quedarse sin empleo no le queda otra opción que buscar una manera de ganar dinero.
Fabio quiere solicitar formalmente un crédito para la compra de una maquinara embutidora y molino para iniciar la fabricación de chorizos y embutidos que es algo que sabe hacer perfectamente ya que era su trabajo anterior.
El sueño de Fabio es tener una distribuidora, un negocio firme y en constante crecimiento para que un día pueda darse y darle un hogar propio a él y su madre.
texts.en:
Fabio is a 33 year old man who may lack work, but he has a lot of ideas and the desire to get ahead.  That is why he is requesting your help and your support.  He wants to start a business.  He wants to generate much needed income that his family needs.  He has a life partner and a seven year old daughter, who he thinks is a princess.  He tries by all possible means to buy things and give them things they like.  As he is without employment, he has no other option than to look for a way to earn money.

Fabio wants to formally request a loan to buy a sausage stuffing machine and a grinder in order to start making different types of sausages.  This is something he knows how to do perfectly because it was his previous job.

Fabio’s dream is to have a distributorship, a firm business in continual growth so that he is one day able to give himself and his mother their own home.

loans.use: to buy a sausage stuffing machine and a grinder in order to start making different types of sausages.

loans.name: Fortunate

texts.en:
Fortunate is 28 years old and married with two children. She resides in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. Fortunate is both a volunteer and a businesswoman. She is a Camfed Learner Guide teaching life skills education at a local school and also works at a grocery shop.

Fortunate rents a store and sells products such as sugar, flour, rice, salt, cooking oil, and drinks. She has been running this business for the past two years and successfully paid back her first Kiva loan earlier this year. She would now like to take a larger loan, which she will use to increase her inventory. "The loan I received before helped me a lot. I am now presentable in the society. Also I am now able to buy groceries for my family, my husband adores me and I have gained respect in the community." Fortunate will use her profits to pay fees for her husband and niece who are studying math and English, and to support her family. Fortunate intends to grow her business and open her own store one day.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to resell.

loans.name: Lazaro

texts.pt:
Senhor Lázaro tem 34 anos de idade, solteiro, não tem filhos, trabalha como gestor de um sistema de abastecimento de água, é agricultor e avicultor, vive em casa dos pais com os seus irmãos.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de pintos, rações, vacinas para a criação de frangos, para a posterior vender aos vizinhos.
 No futuro pretende construir mais aviários para aumentar a produção de frangos e iniciar a produção de poedeiras e construir dependências para arrendar como forma de aumentar o seu rendimento mensal.
Liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora é o seu maior desafio de modo a garantir futuros financiamentos.
texts.en:
Lázaro is 34 years old. He's single and doesn't have children. He works as the manager of a water supply system. He's also a farmer and raises poultry. He lives with his siblings in his parents' house.
The amount of the loan will be used to purchase chicks, feed and vaccines in order to raise chickens and then sell them to his neighbors.
In the future he intends to build more bird coops so he can expand his chicken farm and start raising laying hens. He also intends to build rooms for renting out as a way to increase his monthly income.
His biggest challenge is repaying the loan without delinquency so that he will be guaranteed future loans.

loans.use: to purchase chicks, feed and vaccines for raising chickens.

loans.name: La Hermita Group

texts.es:
El grupo ¨La Hermita¨, están nuevamente solicitando a ADIM y a los socios de Kiva, crédito para impulsar sus micro empresas. La líder del grupo es Mayra de 27 años, casada, tiene  a su responsabilidad dos hijos, de 10 años, quien acude a la escuela primaria y su hija de 9 meses. Tiene una microempresa que se dedica a la fabricación y venta de calzados de variados estilos. Su esposo la ayuda en el negocio y es parte fundamental del taller ya que el alistador de los calzados. El crédito lo ocuparan para la compra de pega blanca, pega amarilla, suelas, fibras, royal y eva. Con esto están garantizando tener la materia prima que les proporcionara mayor cantidad de producción. Con el crédito anterior pudieron comprar hormas y eso les permitió crear mas calzado a la medida de los clientes. 
Los otros integrantes lo conforman, Maria, 44 años, prepara y vende nacatamales. Nelson, 27 años se dedica a la venta de condimentos desde hace 10 años.
texts.en:
The group "La Hermita" is again applying to ADIM and to the Kiva partners for a loan to energize their micro-businesses. The leader of the group is Mayra, who is 27 years old. She is married and is responsible for two children, one who is 10 years old and goes to primary school and her 9-month-old daughter. She has a micro-business in which she makes and sells footwear of various styles. Her husband helps her in the business and is a fundamental part of the workshop, since he straightens the shoes. They will use the loan for the purchase of white glue, yellow glue, soles, insole material, Royal fabric, and EVA rubber. With this they will be guaranteed to have the basic materials that will give them a greater quantity of production. With the previous loan, they were able to buy lasts, and this allowed them to make more shoes to the measure of the customers.

The other members who form the group are Maria, age 44, who prepares and sells nacatamales [Nicaraguan-style tamales], and Nelson, age 27, who has been selling condiments for 10 years.

loans.use: to buy white glue, yellow glue, soles, insole material, Royal fabric, and EVA rubber

loans.name: Fernando

texts.pt:
O senhor Fernando tem 36 anos de idade, casado e pai de 03 filhos dos quais 02 frenquentam o ensino primário e secundário, respectivamente e o último é menor de idade, isto é, não estuda. Para além dos seus filhos, sustenta a sua mãe.
 Trabalha na Função Pública. Está a construir a sua casa, com o empréstimo de 15.000,00mts, pretende comprar material de construção como: cimento, pó de pedras, carrada de area, estribos e varrðões para reforçar o material que já tem em casa e para poder dar a continuidade da conclusão da sua casa e  acomodar a sua familia.
Para além de sonhar em concluir a sua casa, sonha também em aumentar o seu nível académico e profissional para poder melhorar as condições salariais, pois, o seu salário não chega para sustentar a familia durante o mês e para superar essas dificuldades, tem recorrido ao trabalho de pedreiro aos finais de semana e nos dias de folga
texts.en:
Fernando is 36 years old and married. He has three children, two of whom are in primary and secondary school respectively. The other child is underage, that is to say, he doesn't study. Aside from his children he also supports his mother.
He works as a civil servant. He's building his house and with the loan for 15,000mts he intends to purchase construction supplies such as cement, stone dust, a truckload of sand, stirrups and rods. That way he'll increase the amount of material he already has at his house. Also, he'll be able to continue finishing his home and providing comfort for his family.
Aside from his dream of finishing his house, he also dreams of advancing his academic and professional level so that he can improve his salary status. His salary isn't enough to support his family throughout the month. In order to overcome these struggles he has been working as a mason on weekends and on his days off from work.

loans.use: to purchase cement, stone dust, a truckload of sand, stirrups and rods.

loans.name: Alvaro Javier

texts.es:
Álvaro es un joven de 25 años, una persona humilde, servicial, que goza de la música y busca un mejor futuro para su hogar, no tiene hijos y actualmente se encuentra sin empleo. 

A su edad Álvaro no puede permitirse esta situación es por ello que gracias a que interactuar toco su puerta ofreciéndole una salida a sus dificultades hoy tiene el atrevimiento y la energías para iniciar un negocio de venta de comidas rápidas, una idea que siempre había querido ejecutar pero por no tener historial crediticio ninguna entidad confiaba en él, hasta llegar el día que interactuar le dijo si te presto, si te apoyamos.

Ahora muy feliz y emotivo con sueños como lo es comprar una vivienda para regalársela a su madre Álvaro solicita el préstamo para la compra de mesas, sillas, un carro de comidas rápidas e insumos para iniciar su labor.
texts.en:
Álvaro is a 25 year old young man. He is a humble and helpful person and he enjoys music. He is searching for a better future for his home. He does not have any children and is currently unemployed.
At his age Álvaro cannot allow this situation to continue. It is thanks to Interactuar knocking on his door and offering him a way out of his difficulties that today he has the boldness and energy to begin a business selling fast food. This is an idea he has always wanted to carry out but because he did not have a credit history no organization would trust him, until the day when Interactuar told him that if he joined, they would support him. 
Today he is very happy and excited, with dreams such as buying a house as a gift for his mother. Álvaro is requesting the loan to buy tables, chairs, a fast food cart and supplies to begin working.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, a fast food cart and supplies to begin working.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis Alberto es una persona de 57 años de edad, un hombre solitario que debido a unos inconvenientes con su familia se separó de su esposa con la que llego a tener 4 hijos,  se dedica a la venta ambulante de bebidas y alimentos un negocio que le ha servido para mantenerse ya que tuvo partió de su hogar y está residiendo en un casa arrendada.

Conforme va pasando el tiempo Luis Alberto va  evidenciando falencias y puntos críticos en su negocio pero la falta de capital no le permite operar en su negocio, por ello con la ayuda de interactuar quien no solo está dispuesto a confiar en él, sino que también le quiere brindar apoyo con asesorías para que mejore su negocio,  solicita un préstamo para comprar surtido y reparar su puesto de ventas que son los problemas que requieren una rápida intervención.

El préstamo ayudara a que una persona persiga su sueño de mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto is 57 years old, he is a solitary man.  Due to some family problems he has separated from his wife, with whom he has 4 children.

Luis makes a living as a vendor of drinks and food. This work has been keeping him going now that he has had to leave his home and live in a rented property. 

As time has gone by, Luis has seen that there are problems and critical flaws with his business but he lacks the capital to fix these problems and operate his business. 

Luis thus sought help from someone that not only trusts him, but also can offer him advice on how to fix his business. Luis is seeking a loan to buy stock and repair his food stall as quickly as possible. 

This loan will help a person follow their dreams to have a better life.

loans.use: to buy stock and repair his food stall which is in need of rapid intervention.

loans.name: Hector Fabio

texts.es:
Héctor es un hombre de 32 años de edad es una persona humilde y trabajadora, inicio un negocio de venta de frutas que poco a poco ha ido creciendo y consolidándose en el mercado, no tiene hijos ni pareja, solo se preocupa por tener una buena calidad de vida y ayudar incondicionalmente a sus padres, enviándoles dinero, comprándole medicamentos y todo lo que necesiten para que tengan una vida digna y sin preocupaciones.
Gracias al recorrido que ha tenido Héctor ha logrado fidelizar un mayor número de clientes y con este crecimiento su inventario no da abasto para cubrir la demanda actual que tiene, por ello solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de frutas y verduras principalmente frutas cítricas como naranjas y mandarinas.
Tu apoyo le ayudara a Oscar a abastecer y crecer su inventario pudiendo soportar la demanda de productos que presenta en la actualidad.
texts.en:
Héctor is a 32-year-old man. He is a humble and hard-working person. He began a business of selling fruits, and little by little it has been growing and establishing itself in the market. He doesn't have any children or a partner. He is only concerned about having a good quality of life and helping his parents unconditionally, sending them money and buying them medicine and everything that they need so that they can have a dignified life without worries.

Thanks to the trajectory that Héctor has had, he has been able to build loyalty in a great number of customers, and with this growth his inventory has not been able to meet the present demand that he has. For this reason, he is applying for a loan for the purchase of a stock of fruits and vegetables, principally citrus fruits such as oranges and tangerines

Your support will help Hector to stock up and increase his inventory to meet the demand for products that now exists.

loans.use: to buy a stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Toshhon

texts.ru: Тошхон, 57 лет, замужем, дети взрослые, уже есть 3 внуков. У Тошхон среднее образование, уже 30 лет она занимается сельским хозяйством. У Тошхон есть 2 коровы, 5 овец и 0,67 ГА земельной доли, где Тошхон выращивает хлопок для реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Тошхон обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS), полученные средства она направит на покупку удобрений для выращивания органического хлопка и на оплату наемным работникам по сбору хлопка. Доходы от кредита помогут Тошхон в будущем развить ее бизнес  отложить на высшее образование внуков.
texts.en:
Toshhon is 57 years old and married. Her children are grown, and she already has three grandchildren. Toshhon has received secondary education. For over 30 years she has been doing farm work. Toshhon has two cows,five sheep and a field of 0.67 ha [1.67 acres], where she grows cotton for sale. 

In order to develop her farm further, Toshkon has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 30,000 soms (KGS). She will use her loan to buy fertilizers to grow organic cotton and pay the wages of hired laborers to harvest cotton. The revenues from her loan will allow Toshhon to keep developing her business and eventually save up for college education of her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for growing organic cotton and to pay workers for harvesting cotton.

loans.name: Fernando Alonso

texts.es:
21 años de experiencia le dan el aval al señor Alonso para decir que tiene un negocio estable, firme y en constante crecimiento, inicio hace mucho tiempo era un imple empleado pero con ambición, ganas de superarse y de generar un mejor futuro para su familia aprovecho sus conocimientos en cerrajera e inicio con su propio negocio.
Hoy después de 21 años de edad Alonso se siente muy contento de lograr varios objetivos como lo son generar empleo, su familia está estable, compro vivienda propia y sus dos hijos se formaron y son personas de bien para la sociedad.
Alonso ahora trabaja por él y su señora sus hijos son mayores de edad y velan cada uno por su familia. Alonso quiere solicitar un préstamo para completar el dinero que necesita para comprar un compresor con el cual pintara rápidamente las rejas, puertas, ventanas y demás acabados
texts.en:
Twenty-one years of experience has given Señor Alonso the endorsement to say that he has a solid, stable business that is in constant growth. He began a long time ago. He was an employee, but had ambition and the will to achieve and generate a better future for his family. Taking advantage of his knowledge of metal-working, he began his own business.

Now, after 21 years, Alonso feels very happy to have achieved a number of goals such as generating employment, having a stable family, and buying his own house. His two children have matured and are people who are good for society.

Alonso now works for himself and his wife. His children are adults and they each look out for their own family. Alonso wants to apply for a loan to complete the money that he needs to buy a compressor with which he can rapidly paint the grills, doors, windows, and other finished items [that he makes].

loans.use: to buy a compressor for painting

loans.name: Isabelle

texts.fr:
Isabelle est une femme âgée de 41 ans. Elle vit avec son mari et ses trois enfants, tous encore à l’école. Elle vit dans son quartier depuis sa naissance. Elle tient une poissonnerie où elle est reconnue en tant que femme entreprenante et courageuse du quartier. 
Cela fait 15 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité de poissonnerie qui lui permet de nourrir sa famille et d’assurer la scolarisation de ses enfants. Pour son 9ème prêt, elle compte augmenter son stock et diversifier les poissons à vendre en achetant 400 kilos de poissons différents.  Elle est connue dans le quartier et n’aura pas de problèmes à vendre ses poissons. De plus, elle a une bonne place où les gens des quartiers voisins peuvent passer. 
Elle travaille dure aujourd’hui pour que ses enfants puissent suivre de grandes études universitaires et avoir un meilleur avenir.
texts.en:
Isabelle is a 41-year old woman. She lives with her husband and three children. All her children attend school. She has been living in her neighborhood since birth. She keeps a fish store and is known in her community as an energetic and determined woman.

She has been selling fish for 15 years. This business allows her to support her family and pay for the schooling of her children. For her ninth loan, she plans to expand her stock and diversify the types of fish offered for sale by purchasing 400 kg [880 lbs] of various fish. Her store is in a good location and is frequented by customers from nearby neighborhoods.

Isabelle works very hard to ensure that her children will be able to receive a college education and have a better future.

loans.use: to buy 400 kg of fish for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 29 years old and married with two children, who are currently in school. Michelle works very hard to provide for them.

Michelle runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items like canned goods, soft drinks, beer, noodles, snack foods, and candies to sell. She has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, soft drinks, beer, noodles, snack foods, and candies. 

In the future, Michelle would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, soft drinks, beer, noodles, snack foods, and candies to sell

loans.name: Mayra Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito El Esfuerzo Nos Lleva Al Éxito se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por su gastronomía y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Mayra, tiene 22 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos gemelos de 1 año de edad. Su esposo es pintor.
Doña Mayra es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para salir adelante, ella dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale ya sea en las mañanas o noches ofreciendo sus productos, aprovecha estas horas ya que a estas horas su mamá le ayuda cuidando a sus pequeños,  ella también vende en sus casa, lleva más de 1 año  que se dedica a esta actividad  la cual comenzó con los créditos y que ahora le permiten ganarse la vida.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas y otras prendas. Lleva tres ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
The El Esfuerzo Nos Lleva Al Éxito (Effort brings us to success) credit group meets every 15 days in the city of Manta. This city is known for its beautiful beaches which are well visited during all seasons of the year, for its cuisine and for being a city with unparalleled beauty and many tourist attractions. 
Mayra lives in this place. She is 22 years old, married and from this relationship has two twin boys aged 1. Her husband is a painter. 

Mayra is a woman who likes to work to get ahead. She works as a merchant. She sells all types of clothing and her sales method is door to door. She goes out in the mornings and evenings to offer her products. She takes advantage of these hours because at these times her mother helps her to take care of her little ones. She also sells out of her home. For more than 1 year she has been doing this work which she began with a loan and which now allows her to earn a living. 

This loan is to buy pants, shirts, blouses and other garments. He has been with the credit group for three cycles and likes it for the help which the loans provide her. Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses and other garments.

loans.name: Nyasha

texts.en:
Nyasha resides in the Mudzi District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully operating a grocery store for over a year. Nyasha started her business by selling door-to-door, but her business expanded with the proceeds from her first loan. She sells sugar, cooking oil, soft drinks, biscuits, powdered milk, and bath soap. 

Nyasha volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide at the local school and provides students sessions on life and study skills. With the requested loan from Kiva, Nyasha intends to make bulk purchases of sugar, cooking oil, soap, and salt to reduce transportation costs and to receive bulk discounts. With the increased profits, Nyasha would like to assist orphans and vulnerable children in her community.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 45 years old and married with four children.

Myrna is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Myrna requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Myrna has been raising pigs for 15 years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Myrna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Sobohon

texts.ru: Собохон, 58 лет,  она замужем, воспитала 5 детей, двое младших живут с родителями. Собохон на пенсии, и занимается сельским хозяйством вот уже 30 лет. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Собохон есть корова, на 0,93 Га собственной земли она выращивает картофель, кукурузу, хлопок. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 12,500 сом (KGS). Собохон обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений для выращивания экологически-чистых продуктов. Доходы от проекта Собохон будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и ремонт дома.
texts.en: Sobohon is 58 years old and married.  She has raised five children (her youngest two still live at home).  Sobohon receives a pension and has been involved in agriculture for the past 30 years.  Today, she has a cow on her farm, and she also grows potatoes, corn and cotton on 0.93 hectares of her own land.  She makes a monthly income of about 12,500 som (KGS).  She has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 20,000 som (KGS) to buy some fertilizers in order to grow organic produce.  She will use the earnings from her loan to further develop her business and to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy some fertilizers in order to grow organic produce.

loans.name: Tuungane Grp Group

texts.en:
Mery is a good woman aiming at supporting her people around her by being able to serve them with all the required medicine. This is due to poor medical services provided by most of the government centers. There is no center with all of the most-wanted medicines for patients. She decided to start a pharmacy selling human medicines, and this is her 12th year in this business. She is doing great, wishing to open a big shop where she could serve more people. Mery serves people from 8am until 10pm per day and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

Mery is 55 years old, widowed and takes care of five children, three of them not being her own kids. A few of the children are still in school. She is applying for a second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to be apportioned among Tuungane, the two-member group who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. She used the previous loan to buy medicines missing from the pharmacy.

Mery has paid back successfully her previous loan and is now applying for a new one which she will invest in buying medicines for her pharmacy to service people around her.

loans.use: to buy medicines for her pharmacy to service people around her.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops for a better harvest.

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel is a married man with six children who operates a wholesale shop in Hoima, Uganda. For extra income Abel carries out farming of mainly cassava and beans. On realizing the need for complementing his wife’s earnings, he ventured into business in 2012 to generate more income. 

His business is exposed to high rental fees, yet he desires to have a well-stocked business in town that will increase his capital base. 

Abel is requesting a loan to buy stock like books, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy stock like books, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en:
Rafael is a business management student at the Maharishi Institute and was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute: This is his story:

1. What do you study at the Maharishi Institute? Which classes do you enjoy the most?

I am doing a business management degree. I enjoy working with numbers; my favorite classes are from courses or subjects that involve numbers, e.g., mathematics, financial management and accounting.

2. What are your goals after graduating from the Maharishi Institute? Please be specific: In which sector do you expect to work? In which city would you like to work? Would you like to travel?

My goal is to work for a couple of years to gain necessary skills and experiences. Thereafter, I would love to travel abroad to countries like the United States of America, Australia, Canada, Qatar and UK. I would really love to see myself working in the business, consulting and management sector. The best cities and most ideal cities I would love to be working in are New York City and Sydney (Australia).

3.Tell us about your background. Where were you born? Do you have brothers and sisters? What do your parents do for work? Are you married; do you have children?

I was born in DR Congo and I moved to South Africa at a very young age of 5 years old. My parents divorced back in 1999; my older brother Oliver and I were the only two kids my parents had. After the divorce my father remarried his new wife, and they had three kids together, all females. My mom remarried too and had four kids, two females and two males. All in all, I have eight siblings and I am the only child from both my parents' children who finished matric and is currently studying at a tertiary institute.

4. What do you like to do in your spare time?

In my spare time I like reading books or catching a movie with my friends. When I have enough spare time I love doing community work in my community. I found so much joy in helping others; this is the main reason I love doing the community work that I do.

5. How will a Kiva loan change your life? Describe how the loan will affect your studies and your lifestyle: Will there be significant changes?

The loan will definitely help me in so many ways which will bring a whole lot of changes to my life. My primary problem has always been transportation. This loan will help me cover my transport cost and increase my attendance rate. Part of the money I will be using to print out my assignments and cover up other little expenses that may rise or come up during the month.

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
Mariano tiene 41 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico, con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos menores de edad en su poder, de los cuales la mayor se encuentran cursando estudios en el colegio del Caserío El Limon,del distrito de Querocotillo, Provincia de Cutervo, Región Cajamarca, Sierra Norte de Perú.

La actividad a la que se dedica Mariano es la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de maíz amarillo duro, con una experiencia en el rubro de 20 años,tiene muy buena referencias tanto personales como laborales en su comunidad. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarias, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para deshierbo de sus parcelas del cultivo de maíz amarillo duro. De esta manera lo ayudara a la mejora tanto fisiológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto y generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Mariano is 41 years old and lives in his own rustic-style house with his wife and their 3 young children, the oldest of which is studying at the Caserío El Limon high school in the Querocotillo district, Cutervo province, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Perú. 

Mariano works in agriculture, specifically growing hard yellow maize (feed corn). With around 20 years of experience, he has very good personal as well as work references in his community.

He will put the loan towards agricultural labor, application and incorporation of plant sanitizing products, fertilizers, and to pay for labor to weed his hard yellow maize farm. The loan will help with improving the physiology and productivity of his farm, and also to have a good harvest. For that matter, he will have better production, a better quality product, with which he will not have any problem selling his product and generating a better income.

loans.use: to apply plant sanitizing products, fertilizers, and to pay for labor to weed his hard yellow maize farm

loans.name: Raquil

texts.en:
Raquil is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Raquil is 38 years old and two of her children are currently in school.

Raquil has a general store business in the Philippines. Raquil requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Raquil has been in this business for two years. In the future, Raquil would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Forget

texts.en: Forget is a 23-year-old married businesswoman from Mudzi District, Zimbabwe. She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide. Each week she assists young students to overcome obstacles at school and at home. Forget is also a vibrant entrepreneur who operates a grocery tuck shop from her home. She sells food items such as cooking oil, sugar, salt, cornmeal, biscuits, snacks, and she even sells some clothing. Forget inspires young women in her community as an entrepreneur. Forget is very pleased with how much she has achieved, but she knows that she can accomplish more.  This was achieved through the first loan that she received and repaid successfully. With the second Kiva loan that she is requesting, Forget intends to increase her stock to improve sales and profits. An increase in profits would mean that she will be in a better position to provide for her family.

loans.use: to expand her grocery business.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is 52 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Mary Jean has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from pig fattening and food vending.

Mary Jean aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Edecia

texts.en:
Edecia is 55 years old and is married with six children, one of whom is still in school.

Edecia is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been farming rice for 6 years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Edecia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan is 43 years old. He lives in Kobuleti district with his wife and 3 children. 

The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have a plot of agricultural land where they grow mandarin trees. Levan is a very hardworking man and does his best to ensure a good harvest. He sells the harvest locally at a good price. 

Levan wants to open a car diagnostic center. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan. With the  credit received, he will purchase diagnostic equipment for cars and will serve people by diagnosing their cars.

Levan hopes that the business will be profitable and that he will have a stable income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase diagnostic equipment for cars

loans.name: Baleseng

texts.en:
Baleseng is a Business Management student at the Maharishi Institute and was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute: This is his story:

1. What do you study at the Maharishi Institute? Which classes do you enjoy the most?

I am studying for a BBA degree. I enjoy mathematics classes the most.

2. What are your goals after graduating from the Maharishi Institute? Please be specific: in which sector do you expect to work? In which city would you like to work? Would you like to travel?

I want to start my own business; I want to be in the consulting business in Johannesburg. I would like to travel.

Tell us about your background. Where were you born? Do you have brothers and sisters? What do your parents do for work? Are you married; do you have children?

I was born in a small town called Wolmaranstad in the northwest. We are five on my mother’s side. I am the last born and I have two older brothers and two older sisters. My mother used to be a domestic worker but she is currently not working. I am single and have no children.

3. What do you like to do in your spare time?

In my spare time I like to read novels, play soccer or watch television.

4. How will Kiva loan change your life? Describe how the loan will affect your studies and your lifestyle: will there be significant changes?
