Yes there will be a lot of changes; it would make it easier for me to learn as I would be able to attend classes every day. It would also give me great confidence knowing that my fees are taken care of.

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Anara

texts.ru: Анара, 28 лет, замужем, есть 3 детей, самому младшему сыну 3 года. Анара, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 2005 году с 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Анары, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется корова, 10 овец. Также на участке 1,0 Га она выращивает ячмень для реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Анара обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 5 овец для отгона и откорма на пастбище с последующей реализацией. Доходы от кредита Анара планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса, так как хочет накопить средства на постройку сарая.
texts.en: Anara is 28 years old and married.  She has three children, the youngest of whom is three years old.  Anara works in animal husbandry and agriculture, two activities which constitute her family's main source of income.  She started in this field in 2005 with an initial capital of 5,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her very hard work, she now has one cow and ten sheep on her farm.  She also grows barley for resale on one hectare of land.  In order to further grow her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 25,000 som (KGS) to buy five sheep for fattening in the fields and for further resale.  Anara is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further expand her business as she would like to save enough money to build a barn.

loans.use: to buy five sheep for fattening in the fields and for further resale.

loans.name: Shirleychita

texts.en:
Shirleychita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruit vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell to her customers for her fruit vending business.

Shirleychita has been in this business for 30 years. She earns more income from her general store.

Shirleychita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Kizlarhon

texts.ru: Кизлархон, 47 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей, самому младшему 9 лет. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, она 21 год назад начала заниматься животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве Кизлархон на сегодняшний день имеется корова, также 1,0 Га арендованной и 0,40 Га собственно земли, где она выращивает картофель, лук, хлопок для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 6,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кизлархон обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян, удобрений и обработку почвы для выращивания органических овощей, оставшиеся средства направит на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства и благоустройство дома.
texts.en:
Kizlarhon is 47 years old, married, and the mother of four children.  Her youngest child is nine years old.  For the past 21 years, she has been involved in animal husbandry and agriculture, two activities which constitute her family's main source of income.  She started her own business with an initial capital of 10,000 som (KGS).  She now has one cow on her farm, and she also grows potatoes, onions and cotton for resale on one hectare of leased land and 0.4 hectares of her own land.  She makes a monthly income of about 6,000 som (KGS).  

In order to further grow her business, Kizlarhon has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy some seeds and fertilizers to prepare her land and grow organic vegetables.  She will use the extra money to buy some sheep.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further expand her farming business and to make some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy some seeds and fertilizers to prepare her land and grow organic vegetables, and to buy a few sheep.

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik is from the Mayisyan village of Shirak region where she lives with her husband and 29-year-old son. Her family has been occupied in agriculture for many years. Hasmik also works in the local library as a part-time worker. Their family farm include cows, calves and hens as well as arable land where wheat and potato is cultivated.

Hasmik's time after work in the library is devoted to farming. Because her salary is too small to cover even basic living costs, the agricultural income helps to support the family's living. This loan is important for Hasmik to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer so her agribusiness will be enlarged.

Because the region where Hasmik's village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate here is very high; people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. Hasmik's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region to help them to access the market and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds and fertilizer to enlarge her agribusiness.

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada is 54 years old and has five children. She is married and one of her children is still in school.

Diosdada is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her business.

Diosdada has been in pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

Diosdada would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her business.

loans.name: Onai

texts.en:
Onai is 28 years old; she is married and has two children. She resides in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. Onai rents a small grocery shop at the local town center where she sells products such as sugar, rice, flour, salt, milk, and cooking oil. With a Kiva loan last year, Onai grew  the business . Using the profits, she bought herself kitchen utensils, clothes, farm equipment and maize for the planting season. 

She wishes to now take a second loan, to continue and grow business wise, to build her own shop and stop renting. Also her dream is to build a house at her rural home, and send her children to further education. Onai said ‘’I am now consulted for family decisions and also many people want to be associated with me because I am a prosperous young woman. Because of this loan my life, family’s standard of living and diet has improved. ’’

She has been volunteering as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education at her local secondary school on a weekly basis.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries, in order to grow her business

loans.name: Nyabange Grp Group

texts.en:
Suzana is mid 40's old, not married and has three sons and a daughter who are at school. For a period of 26 years now, she has been taking care of her family by managing a business selling cereals(corns and beans). She starts working from 7.am to 6:30.pm per working and is able to make a small profit each month.

This is her fourth credit request from Tujijenge Tanzania to be apportioned among NYABANGE, two members group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. With her previous credits, paid back successful, she used to buy sacks of corns,beans and millet for her business. Suzana earned some extra income which she used to plow back to her business to grow. She dreams to manage a big shop of foods. 
She will use this loan to buy sacks of cereals(maize and millet) to resell.

loans.use: to buy sacks of cereals(maize,millets) to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stock of cereals such as maize,beans and millet for sell and make more income to support her family.

loans.name: Morina

texts.en:
Morina works hard to support her family. Morina is married and has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines.

Morina requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice grains to sell.

Morina has been in this business for 11 years now.

Morina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Pepita

texts.en:
Pepita is 61 years old and married with two children. 

Pepita is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Pepita requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Pepita has been farming rice for 2 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Pepita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ruthina

texts.en:
Jonifer is 23 years old and is 8th of eight children in the family. His mother Ruthina a member of NWTF, supports the family through her raising ducks business in the Philippines.

Jonifer is studying Hotel and Restaurant Management and is currently in the 4th of this 4-year course.

Ruthina is borrowing 4220 to pay for tuition fees of her son Jonifer for the first semester of the school year 2015-2016.

Jonifer plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay 4th year college tuition fees in Hotel and Restaurant Management

loans.name: Asya

texts.en:
Asya is farmer living in Getq village of Shirak region with her husband. Currently her husband works and lives abroad, as a migrant laborer. After staying alone, Asya started take care of the family farm. She currently keeps livestock of cows, calves, pigs, piglets and hens, and also cultivate potato and cabbage. Despite of many difficulties in agribusiness, Asya manages to sustain her farm and gather stable income during the month. 

She asks lenders to support her with this loan and enable to purchase fertilizer, natural pesticides needed for land cultivation works. Because the region where Asya's village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate here is very high; people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. Asya's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region to help them to access the market and earn a living.

Asya hopes to receive your support and make her farm successful enough, so her husband will not have to work abroad for family's living.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, natural pesticides for land cultivation so that her husband may return home from abroad

loans.name: Yeukai

texts.en:
Yeukai lives in the Mudzi District of Zimbabwe. As a Camfed Learner Guide. To help support her family, Yeukai rents a table at a flea market and sells products such as bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, tracksuits, and t-shirts.  She got a first loan that she repaid successfully. 

With the second loan that she is requesting, Yeukai will purchase more clothing items in order to grow her business and eventually open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and will help her to provide for her younger sisters, who are still in school.

As a Camfed Learner Guide, Yeukai works as a volunteer with a class of students at a local secondary school teaching life skills and study skills.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothes for her expanding sales

loans.name: Letween

texts.en:
Letween is a 23-year-old business woman living in Mbire, a district in Zimbabwe. She provides counselling services to young people facing challenges at a local community centre. Letween also inspires young women in her community as an entrepreneur. 

As an entrepreneur, Letween operates flea market stall where she sells dresses, jackets and shoes. From the first loan she has managed to increase the sales through bulk buying. She requests this loan to further expand the business. An increase in profits will help her to register and further her education.

loans.use: To purchase clothing items in bulk for her stall. Profits will pay for her own further education

loans.name: Gloria Patricia

texts.es:
Ella es Gloria es una mujer que quiere superarse que tiene metas y ambiciones que busca ser grande, tener vivienda, carro, comodidades alcanzar la cima con humildad y trabajo, ella nacida en barrios populares pero con una determinación inquebrantable.
Gloria se dedica a la venta de mercancía principalmente ropa juvenil para hombre y dama, en un negocio improvisado que ubica en el centro de Medellín y que gracias a esta actividad ha visto la mejoras en las condiciones de su vivienda donde anteriormente solo había una entrada de dinero, la de su esposo
Gloria buscando mejorar sus ventas atraer nuevo público y acercarse a ese sueño de tener un local comercial quiere solicitar un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de surtido de camisas, jeans, blusas, ropa interior entre otros.
texts.en:
Gloria is a woman who wants to improve herself, who has goals and ambitions. She wants to grow, have a house, a car, live in comfort and reach the top with humility and hard work. She was born in a poor neighborhood, but with an unwavering determination.

Gloria sells clothes, mainly for young men and women, in a makeshift stall located in the center of Medellín. Thanks to this business, she has seen an improvement in the living conditions in her house. Previously, there was only one source of income - that of her husband. Gloria, looking to improve her sales, attract new customers and move closer to her dream of owning her own premises, wants to request a loan, which she will invest in a selection of shirts, jeans, blouses, underwear, and other items.

loans.use: to buy a selection of shirts, jeans, blouses, underwear, and other items.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a 31-year-old business woman. She is married with three children, living in the Chikomba West District of Zimbabwe. As a Camfed Learner Guide, Emily has the opportunity to work with schools in her community, helping students gain studying and life skills. 

Over the last year, she has grown her poultry business to its current capacity – producing about 150 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to local residents. The support from Kiva has made it possible for Emily to increase her poultry from 25 to 50 chicks, which has broadened her profit margin. She has gained respect from her husband and in-laws and she is financially independent. She successfully made her loan repayments and also managed to pay school fees for her children. She is also providing food and clothing for herself and her family. With the second loan that she is requesting she wishes to expand her poultry project to from 50 to 100 chicks as well as to become a supplier to bigger markets whereby she will be able to sell her chicks in bulk.

Thank you for supporting Emily’s loan!!

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and chick feeds

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda is farmer, living in the village of Tolors of the Syunik region with her husband and three children (8-year-old son and two daughters). 
Nadezhda and her husband have been involved in farming for 10 years already. They keep 13 colonies of bees as well as hens and also cultivate wheat, emmer wheat, potato, cabbage and tomato. Nadezhda manages to help her husband with gathering good harvest from their farm and also taking care of their children. 

She has now applied for this loan to purchase 10 colonies of bees, seeds of cabbage and tomato, and cover watering costs. 

As this is her first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The First-Chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative, almost 500 borrowers, like Nadezhda, get a chance to have their first loans and develop their businesses.

loans.use: to pay for 10 colonies of bees, seeds of cabbage and tomato, and cover watering costs

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is 49 years old. She lives with her 21-year-old son in the Batumi district. Both of them are unemployed at the moment. Marine is very motivated to start a family business and requested a loan. 

She requested a loan from MFO Credo and the application was approved within the framework of a startup program that enables inexperienced borrowers to begin new businesses. 

Marine owns a commercial space, and with the loan received, she will purchase essential equipment such as a vacuum cleaner, hoses, and power washers. Her son will work there and will provide services to local community members. The new business initiative will significantly improve the living conditions of their family and give them finance stability.

loans.use: to open a car wash

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Christine Mary is 17 years old and is the 4th of four children in the family. Her mother Marilyn a member of NWTF; she supports the family through her buy and sell firewood business in the Philippines.

Christine Mary is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Elementary Education and is currently in the 2nd of this 4-year course.

Marilyn is borrowing 9,450 PHP to pay for tuition fees for her daughter Christine Mary for the first semester of the school year 2015-2016.

Christine Mary plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Ana Matilde

texts.es: Ana  es una joven de 23 años que por recomendación de su madre está dedicada al comercio, su madre que en tiempos pasados fue comerciante le enseño estrategias para mercadear y obtener éxito.  Ella es residente en la ciudad de Barranquilla y cuenta con un gran espíritu emprendedor, gracias a su habilidad para socializar aprovecha cualquier oportunidad para vender ropa, calzado, bolsos y perfumes a sus compañeros de estudio, amigos, vecinos y referidos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en perfumes, ropa, y artículos de tocador.  Con esta inversión planea duplicar sus ventas y por supuesto obtener una mayor utilidad.  Su meta a corto plazo es terminar su carrera universitaria y para su negocio tiene como  desafío  fidelizar a sus clientes con buenos precios y un excelente servicio.
texts.en:
Ana is a young woman of 23 years, who, based on her mother's advice, is working in retail. In the past, her mother was a businesswoman. She taught Ana marketing strategies and how to be successful. Ana is a resident of the city of Barranquilla and has a great entrepreneurial spirit. Thanks to her ability to socialize, she seizes any opportunity to sell clothes, footwear, bags and perfume to her fellow students, friends, neighbors and acquaintances.

Currently, she is applying for a Kiva loan through the Foundation Mario Santo Domingo in order to invest in perfume, clothes and cosmetics. With this investment, she plans to duplicate her sales and of course obtain better profits. Her short term goal is to finish her university studies. The challenge for her business is to foster loyalty among her clients with good prices and excellent service.

loans.use: to invest in perfume, clothes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Luz Eliana

texts.es:
Ella es Luz Eliana es una mujer talentosa, emprendedora, soñadora se dedica a la venta ambulante de comidas, un negocio que inicio por necesidad económica y con el cual logro mejorar las condiciones de vivienda en su hogar en donde habitan 3 hijos que gozan de buena alimentación, de un estudio y una vivienda digna todo gracias a esa gran mujer que tiene como madre.

Luz Eliana siempre ha querido mejorar sus ventas, tiene buenas ideas y una sazón increíble para preparar alimentos, su idea es iniciar a vender alimentos mejor preparados y ofrecer domicilios pero necesitaba una moto que ninguna entidad pro falta de historial crediticio le quería financiar, un día común llego a su hogar Interactuar, ella hablo su caso y obtuvo como respuesta un si te ayudamos, por eso se siente muy motivada de incluso llevar el caso a la comunidad Kiva buscando un apoyo económico para la compra de un motocicleta con la que planea iniciar a vender alimentos a domicilios.
texts.en:
This is Luz Eliana, a gifted, enterprising dreamer who sells food as a street vendor. 

She started this business out of economic need, and in doing so has been able to improve the living conditions in her home, where her three children live. They have a healthy diet, education and decent housing, all thanks to this great woman they have for a mother.

Luz Eliana has always wanted to improve her sales; she has good ideas and an incredible gift for cooking. Her idea is to sell well prepared food
and offer a delivery service, but she needs a motorcycle that no one will finance for her, due to a lack of credit report. 

One ordinary day, Interactuar arrived at her home. She told them about her position, and the response she received was 'yes, we will help you'. Because of this she is very motivated to bring her story to the Kiva community, looking for economic help to buy a motorcycle with which she plans to sell meals to people at home.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to start selling meals to people at home.

loans.name: María Betty

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito El Esfuerzo Nos Lleva Al Éxito se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por su gastronomía y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 60 años de edad, hace varios años su marido falleció y quedo viuda pero de esta relación tuvo cinco hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven con ella. 
Doña María con la finalidad de ganarse el sustento diario  y así salir adelante se dedica a la preparación y venta de postres, bocaditos y dulces para fiestas, ella también prepara comida para fiestas y recepciones, por lo general casi todas las semanas tiene un compromiso social y ella se encarga de la comida y los dulces, también todos los días ella prepara empanadas de verde las mismas que vende en su casa ya sea por unidades o por docenas para llevar, de esa forma ella logar sus recursos que le dan lo necesario para vivir.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho en su negocio y su vida. Sus sueños es tener buena salud para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The loan group "El Esfuerzo Nos Lleva Al Éxito" ("Effort Leads Us To Success") comes together every 15 days in Manta. The city is known for its beautiful beaches, which are visited throughout the year, for its gastronomy and for its unparalleled beauty and many tourist attractions. Here is where Maria, 60 years old, lives. A couple of years ago, her husband passed away and she became a widow, but the relationship graced her with five children, all of who are adults, two of who still live with her.

In order to earn her daily sustenance and to get by, Doña María prepares and sells desserts, sandwiches and sweets for parties. She also prepares food for parties and receptions. Usually, she has a social engagement every week, for which she provides the food and sweets. Every day, she also prepares plantain empanadas, which she sells from her house to take away, be it individually or by the dozen. With this, she earns the necessary income to live.

She will use this loan to buy rice, meat, fish and other types of food to prepare her dishes. She has been part of this loan group since its inception and she likes it because the loans help her a lot with her business and her life in general. Her goal is to maintain good health to continue moving forward.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, fish and other types of food.

loans.name: Pirayu Poty Group

texts.es:
El grupo Pirayu Poty está en su ciclo número 5º del programa de comité de mujeres, son 18 mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras que están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder ayudar a sus familias y a sus seres queridos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Nancy quien tiene una heladería y ventas de confites donde ella trabaja día a día con  mucho esfuerzo para lograr el crecimiento y bienestar de su familia. Ella quiere poder seguir creciendo en su microemprendimiento, es por ello que está poniendo todo lo mejor de sí para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de helados y productos para confites, como harina, manteca y otros. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
The group Pirayu Poty is in it's fifth cycle of the program 'comité de mujeres' (committee of women), consisting of 18 hardworking and enterprising women who are working hard to help their families and loved ones.  

One of the members is Nancy, who has an ice-cream and candy store where she works every day, putting in a lot of effort for the growth and wellbeing of her family.  She wants to continue growing her small business, for this reason she is putting in her best effort to be able to grow and move forward.  

She is requesting a loan to buy ice creams and products for candies, such as flour, butter and other items.  She is thankful for the opportunity she receives to be able to improve every day.

loans.use: to buy icecreams and products for candies, such as flour, butter and other items.

loans.name: Sr De Coyllority Cachimayo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SR DE COYLLORITY CACHIMAYO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cachimayo, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Carmen ella es casada, la socia sigue dedicándose a la  crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, la socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido, la socia continua criando a sus animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solictan,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de chompas, negocio de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, crianza de animales menores, ganadería y venta de comida.
Las socias  que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank Sr. de Coyllority Cachimayo,  situated in the Cachimayo district of the Anta province, department of Cusco.

Carmen is married, and she continues with her business of raising small animals, such as guinea pigs and hens, which she sells to her customers on demand. She would like to continue with this work so that she can continue supporting her family.

She is applying for this loan to buy guinea pigs, among other animals.

The other group members work selling sweaters, selling clothing, in a grocery store, raising small animals, in livestock farming, and selling food.

Carmen is grateful to everyone who makes this dream possible through the loan, and  she is committed to making her payments on schedule.

The members whose pictures are attached to the group picture received permission to arrive late at the meeting due to work commitments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs among other animals.

loans.name: Marcia Magaly

texts.es:
Marcia Magaly tiene 41 años de edad, conviviente, vive en una zona rural del distrito de Zaña que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Marcia se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores conocida sobretodo por la cría y venta de chivos,cabritos, cabrillonas, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 13 años de experiencia en el negocio con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para mejorar la infraestructura de su casa incluyendo el corral de sus animales. Con esto Marcia espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Marcia Magaly is aged 41, and lives with her partner. Se lives in a rural part of the Zaña district, which is situated in the Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru. The population here principally work in agriculture, farming and commerce. 

Marcia works raising and selling small animals, she is known in particular for raising and selling both young and full-grown goats, and her business is located at her home. She has 13 years experience working in this business and has very good personal and professional references in the area. 

This loan she is requesting will be used to improve the infrastructure of her home, including the animals' pen. With this, Marcia hopes to offer a better product to her customers which will allow her to generate a higher income, and will in turn improve her quality of life, and that of her family.

loans.use: to improve the infrastructure of her home, including the animals' pen.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Luchadoras es un grupo nuevo, que forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, todas están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder dar a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida.
Entre las integrantes se destaca la Sra. María, quien es una excelente vendedora de prendas de todo tipo, quien comenta que por medio de su sacrificio del día a día trata de dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y sacrificada.
Ella quiere mejorar su negocio, es por eso que pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas para la venta, como ser remeras, camisas, pantalones, blusas y otros y de esa forma poder seguir mejorando.
texts.en:
The group "Mujeres Luchadoras" is a new group which forms part of the program 'eliminacion de la pobreza' (elimination of poverty).  All are putting their best efforts in to be able to give their families a better quality of life. 

Amongst the members is Maria, who is an excellent seller of all types of clothing.  Maria says that through her day to day sacrifice she tries to give her family all the things she was never able to have.  She is a very hardworking and selfless woman.  

She wants to improve her business, and for that reason is requesting a loan to be able to buy various items of clothing for sale, such as t-shirts, shirts, pants, blouses and others.  In this way she will be able to continue improving.

loans.use: to buy items of clothing such as t-shirts, shirts, pants, blouses & others

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Kuña Guapa forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, cada una tiene como meta poder seguir con sus emprendimientos y poder ayudar a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. María quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, lo que quiere decir que ha mejorado mucho. Ella es modista, y comenta que por medio de su trabajo se ha hecho ya de muy buena clientela que siempre les hace muchos pedidos, y de esa forma se gana la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, gomas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus confecciones como lo viene haciendo y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar.
texts.en:
Kuña Guapa is part of the poverty elimination program where each one has as a goal to be able to continue with her business ventures and be able to help her family.

One of the members is María who, in her last questionnaire, showed a poverty level within level three, which is to say that it has improved a lot. She is a tailor and says that through her work she has created a good customer base which always makes a lot of orders, and in this way she earns her living.

She asks for this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of fabric, thread, elastic and more, in such a way as to be able to continue with making clothing as she has been doing and meet her customers' demand. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is getting to be able to improve.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, elastic, and more.

loans.name: Conavi Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Conavi está mejorando su situación de vida gracias al programa de eliminación que les ha sido de mucha ayuda, cada una pone su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Yolanda, quien se dedica al humilde trabajo de venta de cosméticos y lencería, hace sus ventas sobre pedidos, y comenta que gracias a sus buenos precios ya se ha hecho de muy buena clientela que siempre les hace muchos pedidos. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que está luchando para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de lencerías varias, y de esta forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo está haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
The group called Conavi is improving its life situation thanks to the poverty elimination program. It has been a big help to them. Each person outs her best effort into being able to grow and improve her living conditions. 

One of the members is Yolanda. She works at the humble job of selling underwear and cosmetics. She sells by orders and she says that thanks to her good prices she has established a good clientele and she always has a lot of orders. She is a very hardworking person  who is fighting to be able to grow and get ahead. 

She is asking for this loan to buy various types of underwear and continue with her sales as she has been doing. She is thankful for the opportunity she is getting to be able to continue growing in her business.

loans.use: to buy various types of underwear to sell.

loans.name: El Divino Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado El Divino se formó en la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, tiene 17 miembros donde todas y cada una se pusieron como meta el crecimiento, no solo en lo económico, sino también como persona.
Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde se destaca la Sra. Margarita, quien tiene una despensa bien surtida en la que todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas horas del día. Comenta que empezó con pequeño negocio, pero que poco a poco se fue abriendo camino hasta tener ya una muy buena clientela.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar productos varios para surtir su negocio, como ser carne, bebidas, verduras, frutas, y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su arduo trabajo luchando por poder mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
The group called El Divino was formed in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. It has 17 members of whom every single one has established as a goal growth, not just economically, but also as a person.

They are completing the poverty elimination questionnaire, where Margarita stands out. She has a well-stocked general store in which she works every day from very early in the morning. She says that she began with a small business but little by little she has been making her way to now having a very good customer base.

She asks for this loan to be able to purchase a variety of products to stock her business such as meat, drinks, vegetables, fruit, and more, in such a way as to be able to continue with her hard work struggling to be able to improve each day.

loans.use: to purchase meat, drinks, vegetables, fruit, and more.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El Sr. Juan está casado con la Sra. Antonia hace varios años, tienen 4 hijos mayores, que pudieron sacar adelante gracias al sacrificio de ambos.
Ellos trabajan en la venta de productos varios en forma ambulante ya que viven en un barrio muy concurrido de la ciudad, Además Juan trabaja como constructor en sus horas libres así de esa manera aumentan sus ingresos, es una pareja muy trabajadora.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de prendas variadas para la venta, para que de esa manera pueda seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Juan has been married to Antonia for a number of years. They have 4 adult children who they could get ahead thanks to the sacrifices of both of them.

They work selling a variety of products as street vendors since they live in a busy neighborhood in the city. In addition, Juan works in construction in his free time, so in this way they increase their income. They are a very hard-working couple. 

He asks for this loan to purchase a variety of clothing to sell, so that in this way he can continue with his work as he has been doing.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Librada está en su ciclo número 4 del programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando todas por poder salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mercedes, quien a través de las capacitaciones ha ido mejorando poco a poco, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora que está luchando para poder salir adelante. Tiene una despensa, y también trabaja en una peluquería, es una mujer muy sacrificada que lucha por poder salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de insumos para despensa y también para peluquería. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
The Santo Librada group is in its 4th loan cycle in the program of enterprising women's committees, where they all work and help each other to get ahead.  It is within the poverty elimination program, with all struggling to be able to get ahead.

One of the members is Mercedes who, through the training, has improved little by little. She is a very hard-working and enterprising woman who is struggling to be able to get ahead. She has a store and also works in a hair salon. She is a very selfless woman who struggles to be able to get ahead.

She asks for this loan to purchase supplies for her store and also for the hair salon. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is getting to be able to grow and improve each day.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to be able to stock her store and hair salon.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is age 35, married and charged with the responsibility of taking care of one child. 

He deals in produce, mainly the buying and selling of maize and beans with supplemented incomes from owning rentals. 

He intends to expand his business and develop his business but is limited by inadequate capital. He is seeking credit to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
This is Isaac, a grocery seller in Nairobi county. He is married and has children. 

He buys his produce in the local market and adds value to it by selling in small quantities and redistributing it. Through his business, he has been able to educate his children and provide for the basic needs of his family, such as food and shelter. 

His dream is to one day own a piece of his own land and grow his own produce to sell. With a Kiva loan he will be able to buy more stock of vegetables and expand his business to offer variety.

loans.use: To buy stock of vegetables for his business.

loans.name: Odisha

texts.en:
Odisha is a 20-year-old businesswoman who lives in the Mudzi District of Zimbabwe. 

She has been successfully operating a flea market stall, selling clothes, bags, and shoes. The first loan that she received made it possible for her to increase the number of items and quality of goods sold. Odisha also serves as a weekly volunteer learner guide in her community and is known as a role model. 

With the second loan requested, Odisha intends to make bulk purchases of clothes, bags, and shoes to reduce transportation costs and increase her sales volume. She hopes to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To make bulk purchases of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Unidas se formó en la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, todas está luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
Entre las integrantes del grupo se destaca la Sra. Tereza, quien hace comidas para la venta, comenta que se levanta todos los días desde muy temprano para poder preparar las delicias que vende, y por medio de ella se gana la vida de una manera digna y decorosa.
Tereza quiere ir capacitándose y mejorar sus condiciones de vida, y sabe que por medio del programa de comité de mujeres podrá hacerlo. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder hacer sus comidas, como ser carne, verduras, condimentos y otros.
texts.en:
The group called Mujeres Unidas was formed in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso, and is within the poverty elimination program, they are all struggling to improve their living conditions and that of their families. 

Among the members of the group, Tereza stands out. She makes meals to sell. She says that she gets up very early every day to be able to prepare the delicacies that she sells, and through this she earns her living in a dignified and decent way.

Tereza wants to continue getting training and improving her living conditions and knows that, through this women's committee program, she will be able to do it. She asks for this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of supplies to be able to make her dishes, such as meat, vegetables, seasonings, and more.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to be able to make meals, such as meat, vegetables, seasonings, and more.

loans.name: Uchumi Group

texts.en:
Elias, who is in his early 70s, is divorced and has four children who are all adults. 

He has been selling different types of soap for three years now. He works from 8 a.m. to 6.30 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Elias's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase his soap business and has paid back all his loans successfully.  He used the profit to take care of himself, to repay loans and to cover household expenses.  

He will use this loan to buy different types of soap, like bar soap, liquid soap, powdered soap, and toilet cleaning soap. He dreams of owning a big business.

Elias will share this loan with his loan group, Uchumi, which consists of six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy different types of soap, like bar soap, liquid soap, powdered soap, and toilet cleaning soap.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Mujeres Activas, el grupo lleva ese nombre ya que son mujeres muy activas, están haciendo el ciclo número 24, y además están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, cada una poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
La Sra. Del Pilar, es una persona muy sacrificada que se esfuerza para poder superarse cada día en lo que hace, ya que por medio de su trabajo ayudar a su familia. Ella se dedica a su humilde trabajo de peluquera y también es empleada doméstica, es una mujer muy trabajadora que a través de sacrificios y esfuerzo ha ido  mejorando cada día.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de insumos para su peluquería, como ser tintes, cremas, shampoo, enjuagues y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo y ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group  is called Mujeres Activas. It has this name because they are very active women. They are in their 24th cycle and they are also in the poverty elimination program. Each of them is putting her best effort into improving her living conditions. 

Del Pilar is a very hardworking person who strives to get ahead every day in what she does, because through her work she helps her family. She works at her humble job as a stylist and she also is a maid. She is a very hardworking woman who is improving every day due to her hard work and efforts.

She is asking for this loan to buy materials for her hair salon, such as dyes, creams, shampoo, rinses and more. This way, she can continue with her job as she has been doing, and offer her customers a good service.

loans.use: to buy dyes, creams, shampoo, rinses, and other materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for maintenance on his micro-bus. This will allow him to transport people with the necessary safety.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Sheilou Mico is 21 years old and is second of three children in the family. His mother, Esterlita, is a member of NWTF, and she supports the family through her general store business in the Philippines.

Sheilou Mico is studying for a Bachelor of Science degree in criminology and is currently in the second year of this four-year course.

Esterlita is borrowing PHP 4,670 to pay tuition fees of her son, Sheilou Mico, for the first semester of the school year 2015-2016.

Sheilou Mico plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her son.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is age 29, married and has three children ranging from 6 to 1 year old. All attend school. 

He deals in produce, mainly buying and selling maize, beans and rice as well as operating a bar selling beers and sodas. 

He intends to grow and develop his business as well as paying school fees for his children. He will use the loan to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, corn, beans, beverages, sugar, juices, etc. to offer new merchandise and meet her customers' demands

loans.name: Diana Iris

texts.es:
Diana Iris tiene 43 años de edad,conviviente, con dos hijos a su cargo, viven en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Diana se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pollos, gallinas, patos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Diana Iris espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Diana Iris is forty-three, married with two children under her care. She lives in a rural area in the Oyotún district, in Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region, on Peru's northern coast. The residents of this district mostly work in farming, raising livestock and commercial business. 

Diana raises and sells small poultry animals such as chickens, hens and ducks, among others. Her business is located in her home. She has ten years of experience in the business, and has very good personal and professional references in the area. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more animals such as hens, ducks, turkeys, and chickens, among others, and to buy good quality feed for them. Diana Iris hopes to offer a better product to her customers, which will let her generate more income and ultimately improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more animals and feed for them

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 27-year-old single woman who lives in the town of Shurugwi, Zimbabwe. She is very passionate about empowering young women in her community to overcome the economic hardships that many of them face. 

She runs a poultry business. She got a loan that she used to diversify to a take-away. 

With the second loan that she is requesting, she would like to scale up her take-away business. An improvement in her business means that she will be able to provide for her two dependents and take them through school.

loans.use: To expand her restaurant.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John, a father of three children, is married and living in Hoima. His business is distilling a local alcohol called waragi alongside farming mainly sugarcane for additional income. He ventured into business to make income to support his family. John is a hardworking man who loves to see himself having a sustainable source of income. He is only challenged by inadequate capital. John is asking for a loan to buy more raw materials for distilling alcohol.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for distilling alcohol.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her clothing business.

loans.name: Overflowing Group

texts.en:
Caroline is from Dzivarasekwa, a suburb of the Zimbabwean capital Harare. She lives in her parents’ house, which she extended to make a five-room house thanks to her cross-border trading business. Many of Caroline’s peers who graduated from Zimbabwe’s tertiary institutions have failed to get a white- or blue-collar job. Many have therefore crossed the border to neighbouring South Africa to seek employment.

Unlike her colleagues, Caroline never prioritised looking for a white-collar job. In fact, she did not attend tertiary education as the cost of education was high and her parents could not afford it. This worsened as the economy started crumbling and she resorted to self-employment. She travels to South Africa to buy clothes, blankets and shoes and sells them in Mozambique. She crosses the border to Mozambique once every two weeks to sell her goods. She has been focused and is willing to take chances to make it through. Although her business is highly competitive with many traders selling the same products, Caroline has mastered the art of marketing. She calls out to her customers in their local language and builds relationships with them to encourage loyalty and repeat sales. 

Caroline wishes to own her house, and the only way she can do that is working hard and growing her business. She formed a group with her friends and they have attended financial training at Thrive to help them better manage their businesses. They hope that a loan from Kiva will help them expand their businesses and someday build houses of their own.

loans.use: To expand the range of clothes she can sell abroad.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, who lives in Hoima, Uganda, is aged 35 years. He is married with three children of ages ranging from 2 to 14 years, and all of them attend school.

He operates a retail shop, mainly selling general merchandise, salt, sugar and soap. He supplements his business by owning rentals. He has always been admired for the self-supportive business, only to be limited by high transport costs and stiff competition. 

He is seeking credit to buy more salt, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy more salt, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase a collarette/coverstitch machine, a Siruba sewing machine and raw materials for the production of clothes, allowing him to increase his income and pay for his studies

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosalina is 44 years old and has three children who are in school.

Rosalina has a broom-making business in the Philippines. Rosalina requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed like bamboo sticks, etc. Rosalina has been in this business for 25 years.

In the future, Rosalina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed like bamboo, etc.

loans.name: Carlos Gilbel

texts.es:
Carlos es un agricultor, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, la familia es totalmente dependiente de los ingresos que él genera con su trabajo, no tienen ayuda económica de familiares en el extranjero; tiene su propio negocio desde hace más de 20 años, los cultivos que más práctica son de maíz y frijol, mantiene un horario de trabajo de seis de la mañana a dos de la tarde, por su gran experiencia en el área no representa dificultades.
Está iniciando el invierno lo cual es  favorable para sembrar, Carlos hace la solicitud de un financiamiento para comprar abono, insecticidas, herbicidas y semilla mejorada de granos básicos, tendrá los materiales que necesita para preparar el terreno y darle un buen trato a sus cultivos, espera que las cosechas sean abundantes, los riesgos son perdida de la cosecha si hace un mal clima.
Los sueños que él tiene son continuar trabajando para que sus hijos puedan culminar una carrera universitaria y  ampliar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Carlos is a farmer and lives with his wife and children. The family is totally dependent on the income he generates in his job, and they don't have any financial help from relatives abroad. He has had his own business for more than 20 years. The crops he grows most are corn and beans. His work schedule is from six o'clock in the morning until two o'clock in the afternoon; because of his wealth of experience in the area, it doesn't cause him difficulty.

Winter is starting, which is a favorable time for planting. Carlos is requesting financing to purchase manure, insecticides, herbicides, and improved basic grain seeds, necessary materials to prepare the ground and treat his crops well.  He hopes that his crops are abundant, as the risk is losing his crop if there is bad weather. The dreams he has is to continue working so that his children can finish university and he can expand his home.

loans.use: purchase manure, insecticides, herbicides, and improved basic grain seeds, necessary materials to prepare the ground and treat his crops well.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a married man with three children living in Hoima, Uganda. He deals in selling spare parts for motorcycles, supplemented by income from being a mechanic, whereby he repairs motorcycles. He started his business three years ago with an aim of generating family income. 

Patrick intends to use the loan to buy more spare parts like tires to sell. His business dream is to develop his business to remarkable standards such that it can be self-sustaining despite the challenges of insufficient capital and high rental costs.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts like tires to sell

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a 24-year-old businesswoman. She is a single mother with one child and lives in the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully running her own hairdressing business from her home. When she is not working at her business, Salome serves as a Cama (Camfed’s alumni network) member and volunteers as a Community Health Trainer in schools.

She got a first loan that enabled her to buy hairdressing equipment that helped her get more clients. She repaid this loan on time. With the second loan requested, she intends to make bulk purchases of rollers, hair extensions, hair sprays, hair relaxers, blowers, and solar electricity so that she can offer more to her clients.

With additional profits, she hopes to expand into a bigger hair salon and create employment within her community.

loans.use: to expand her hairdressing business.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a very hardworking, married man with six children (all attend school) in Hoima, Uganda. He deals in a piggery, mainly rearing piglets alongside carrying out mechanic work. 

He dreams of expanding and growing his business, only to be limited by inadequate capital and lack of enough land to expand his project. John desires to buy land to expand his piggery project in the future. 

He is seeking a loan to buy more piglets for rearing.

loans.use: to buy more piglets for rearing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and install a Biological Filter toilet facility in his house for his family and tenants

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is aged 32, married with 2 children, and 1 attends school in Hoima, Uganda.

He deals in mechanics, mainly the repairing of motor vehicles. He has ventured into video showing in order to raise enough income to support his family. He hopes for the growth and expansion of his business, however inadequate capital poses a strong threat to his business.

He will use the loan to complete his residential house by roofing it.

loans.use: to complete his house by roofing it.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a Biofil Toilet System to install in her house for her tenants and family.

loans.name: Karachach

texts.ru: Карачач, 44 года, замужем, имеет 5 детей, младшей дочери- 5 лет, старшему сыну - 13. Карачач 13 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 15 овец, лошадь. На 1,20 Га земли Карачач выращивает ячмень, на ежедневной основе продает молоко. Деятельность приносит ей ежемесячный доход в сумме 9,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Карачач обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы. На доходы от кредита Карачач хочет построить сараи и приобрести автомобиль для семьи.
texts.en: Karachach is 44 years old, married, and has five children. Her youngest daughter is 5 years old, and her eldest son is 13. Karachach has been farming for 13 years. She has two cows, fifteen sheep, and a horse. Karachach grows barley on 1.20 hectares of land, and she sells milk on a daily basis. The business brings her a monthly income of 9,000 som (KGS). In order to develop her business further, Karachach has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy a cow. Karachach wants to build barns and acquire a car for the family with the proceeds of the loan.

loans.use: to buy a cow in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Winston

texts.en:
Winston lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is aged 54, married with 6 children, and 4 attend school.

He deals in piggery where by he rears pigs for roasting, along side earning his pension. He has hopes of growing and expanding his business. He will use the loan to buy more pigs for slaughtering.

loans.use: to buy more pigs for slaughtering.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more bags of sachet water for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her sachet water business by buying more water to sell

loans.name: Makburat

texts.ru: Макбурат, 48 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. У Макбурат высшее образование, работает учителем в школе, она уже много лет в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Макбурат, на данный момент есть 2 коровы, 5 овец, лошадь, выращивает чеснок. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Макбурат обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку корма и сена для скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса и постройку времянки с кухней.
texts.en: Makburat is 48 years old, married, and the mother of four children. Makburat has a higher education and works as a school teacher. For many years she has been rearing animals and growing crops as additional income for her family. Thanks to Makburat's hard work, at present she has two cows, five sheep, and a horse, and she grows garlic. In order to develop her business further, Makburat has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to buy feed and hay for her livestock. She plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in the further expansion of her business and building a hut with a kitchen.

loans.use: to buy hay and feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Cumbre 7 Group

texts.es:
Andrea es una mujer de 22 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 1 hijo de 7 meses, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, cariñosa, amable, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad ‘El torno’; comunidad rural ubicada a 32 kilómetros al Sudoeste de la ciudad, caracterizada por su pintoresco paisaje cubierto por vegetación tropical.  Posee una importante riqueza forestal y diversidad de fauna silvestre. Es centro de acopio de productos del campo. Con una temperatura media anual de 24 grados centígrados.
Andrea es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que desarrolla (de pie, viste blusa ploma). Su vida la disfruta en compañía de su pareja que trabaja como plomero y con su bebé, viven en un cuarto propio construido de madera con techo de calamina y piso de tierra que cuenta con agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba, energía eléctrica y no tiene alcantarillado. Sus deseos de superación para pagar los gastos posnatales de su bebé, la llevaron a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de cosméticos por catálogo, servicio de construcción, venta de empanadas, venta de desayunos, salón de belleza y comercio de ganado, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional, actividad que realiza de lunes a sábado a la hora del medio día en su puesto de venta fijo al aire libre. La comidas tradicionales más demandadas son; locotos rellenos (locotos, carne picada, cebollas), arroz con queso (arroz, leche y queso) y ají de panza (panza, cebollas, tomate acompañado con arroz), “gracias a este negocio puedo cubrir los gastos posnatales de mi bebé…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que existe la demanda y necesidad la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de insumos de cocina, como; aceite, arroz, fideo, yuca, carne, etc. Su sueño es ver crecer a su hijo en las mejores condiciones, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de insumos de cocina como; aceite, arroz, fideo huevo, carne, papa, chuño, etc., para atender a más clientes y mejorar sus ventas. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que lleva desarrollando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Andrea solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de cocina para la venta de comida y con los beneficios pagar los gastos médicos de su bebé.
texts.en:
Andrea is a 22 year old woman, she lives with her life partner, has a 7 month old son and her business is the sale of traditional food. She is a good mother, an entrepreneur, independent, caring, kind, responsible and very hard working. She runs her business in 'El Torno' a rural community located 32 kilometers southeast of the city. It is characterized by its picturesque landscape covered by tropical vegetation. It possesses an important abundance of forest and wild animal diversity. It is a collection center for field products and has an average annual temperature of 24 degrees centigrade. 
Andrea is dark skinned, has brown eyes and wears her black hair tied up. She is short, has a robust physical complexion, her native tongue is the Guarani which she speaks with her family and Spanish due to general culture and the business she runs (she is standing, wearing the blue blouse).
She enjoys her life in the company of her partner, who works as a plumber, and her baby. They live in their own room, built out of wood with a calamine roof and soil floor, which has water from a well dispensed via a water pump, electricity and no sewage system.
Her desire for self improvement to pay for the postnatal expenses of her baby led her to start a communal bank of people with business such as: sales of second hand clothing, cosmetic sales via catalog, construction service, empanada sales, breakfast sales, beauty parlor and a cattle business, to request a loan and improve their activities.
Her business is the sales of traditional food, she runs this business Monday through Saturday, during the middle of the day at her outdoors, stationary locale. The traditional foods which are in highest demand are: 'locotos rellenos' (stuffed peppers with ground beef and onions), 'arroz con queso' (rice, milk and cheese) and 'aji de panza' (belly beef, onions, tomatoes and rice). "thanks to this business, I can cover the postnatal expenses of my baby..." she explains. The advantage of her business is that the demand and the necessity exists, but the disadvantage is the lack of capital to purchase more kitchen ingredients such as: oil, rice, noodles, yucca, meat, etc. Her dream is to see her son grow up in the best conditions, she wants to expand her business through the purchase of kitchen ingredients such as: oil, rice, noodles, eggs, meat, potatoes,  freeze-dried potatoes, etc., in order to serve more clients and improve her sales.
This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in the two years which she has been performing this activity. These are the motives behind Andrea's request of a loan to purchase kitchen ingredients for the sale of food and with the benefits be able to pay the medical expenses of her baby.

loans.use: purchase kitchen materials for the sale of food and with the benefits, be able to pay for the medical expenses of her baby.

loans.name: Ruperta

texts.es: La señora Ruperta de 52 años de edad se dedica al comercio de calzados (zapatos), vive en Sucre y en su domicilio tiene su negocio de venta de calzado, tiene 1 dependiente económico que es su hija y ambas viven en alquiler, su actividad la realiza durante todo el año,los ingresos de su actividad le sirven para cubrir los gastos de alimentación, ropa, servicios básicos y otros gastos que incurren en su hogar. Actualmente requiere un crédito para la compra de mercadería (zapatos) para incrementar las ventas en su negocio y así obtener mayores ingresos que le ayuden en su diario vivir y tenga mejores condiciones de vida, de esta forma le podrá dar una mejor calidad de vida a su hija, quien solo depende de ella para poder seguir estudiando y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Ruperta, age 52, sells shoes.  She lives in Sucre, and her sales business is at her house.  She has one person who is financially dependent upon her, her daughter.  Both of them live in a rented place.  She conducts her business during the whole year.  The earnings from her business serve her to cover the expenses for food, clothing, basic services, and other expenses incurred by her household.

She now needs a loan to buy merchandise (shoes) in order to increase the sales in her business.  This way she will get greater income, which will help them in their daily living, and it will help them to have better living conditions.  This way she will be able to give her daughter a better quality of life.  Her daughter is entirely dependent upon her to be able to continue studying and to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (shoes) in order to increase sales and get greater earnings.

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.en:
Rafael is an artisan from Guatemala who specializes in silver and gemstone jewelry. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and jade for his designs.

Rafael Antonio has been selling through NOVICA since 2013. This is his story:

"I have a great love for jewelry; this is my vocation. My father created designs with jade and crafted very good jewelry. When I was 12, I began helping in the workshop after school and, little by little, I learned the art. In fact, by the age of 16, I could transform rough jade and silver into a piece of jewelry. In my country, it isn't easy to be an artisan. It's a challenge, and you have to go knocking on doors to be able to show your designs. We run into people who don't believe in us, so it can be complicated. But this is a challenge I've had to face and overcome. Today, I'm able to benefit my family and my community because, when I get a big order, I can offer jobs to my neighbors."

"Many thanks to everyone for the support. This microcredit will help us to continue growing, just as past loans helped us to build up our workshop."

Use the link below to view Rafael Antonio's silver and gemstone jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/9013

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and jade for his designs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase drinking water to sell

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is 30 years old and she has an 8-year-old son. Isabel wants to work doing something different so she talked with her landlord and he accepted that she open a little restaurant at the house where she is living. In that way she will be closer to her son. 

Isabel is a good cook and she needs a loan to buy  tables and chairs for the restaurant. You can see in the picture the place where Isabel will be working in the future. She hopes you can help her. She wants the best for her son.

loans.use: To buy chairs and tables for her restaurant

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander opened the doors to his general contracting business in 2010, and has been providing clients in the Medford, NJ area with top notch construction, roofing, window installation, and siding services ever since. His excellent work is fueled by his drive to perform his duties promptly and efficiently. He is fully committed to his job and is eager to serve his clients each day. He credits his great industry mentors with helping him in developing his business sense, on-the-job skills, and even overcoming his language barrier. 

The only thing in the world Alexander is more passionate about than his business is his family. He loves spending time with his kids, and works hard each day to be a great role model and provider for them. He is requesting this loan of $2,650 to help him purchase equipment so he can continue to expand his business: serving more happy clients, and growing as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for his general contracting business

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.en:
Maria del Carmen is 38 years old, married, and has a daughter and a son ages 18 and 4. She describes her family as very tight and happy. She has a beauty salon located in her house where she provides different types of services such as hair cuts, hair coloring and also fixing hair for special occasions. Her daughter helps her. 

Maria del Carmen is asking for a loan to buy supplies for her beauty salon. She is a recurring Kubo Financiero client and she repaid her previous loans on time.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Nilma Evelin

texts.es:
Nilma, es dueña de una tienda de productos varios y ofrece el servicio de un molino nixtamal, cuenta con su negocio desde hace siete años, no tiene un horario de atención fijo; su núcleo familiar está compuesto por su esposo e hijos, se dedica a trabajar con mucho esmero para salir adelante con su familia.
Está solicitando ayuda con un crédito para poder comprar detergentes, jabón, aceite, harinas, cereales, boquitas, etc., de esta manera reducirá las necesidades de sus clientes y generara los ingresos económicos necesarios para cumplir con sus obligaciones.
Sus aspiraciones son ofrecer a su familia un mejor estilo de vida, ser reconocida en su comunidad como una persona altruista y atraer nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
Nilma has a store where she sells various products and provides corn grinding services.  She has had her business for seven years.  She does not have a fixed schedule.  Her family is comprised of her husband and children.  She works with great care in order to get ahead with her family.

She is requesting a loan to be able to buy detergents, soap, cooking oil, flours, grains, and snacks, etc.  This way she will better meet her customers’ needs, and she will generate the income needed to meet her obligations.

Her dreams are to give her family a better life style, to be well-known as an altruistic person in her community, and to attract new customers.

loans.use: to buy detergents, soap, cooking oil, flours, grains, and snacks, etc.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina, vive en una casa familiar con sus tres hijos de 20, 18 y 11 años de edad, ellos están estudiando, su medio de subsistencia es elaborar antojitos como yuca frita, enchiladas, pastelitos, empanadas, etc., trabaja todas las tardes a partir de las 2:00 pm., y los días domingo prepara sopa de puya para vender, inicio su negocio con capital propio.
Necesita de un crédito para poder comprar maíz, plátanos, papas, aderezos, tomates, aceite, harina, carnes y otros materiales para preparar la venta de antojitos y la sopa de puya, tendrá materia prima para mantenerse trabajando y atendiendo mejor a sus clientes.
Sus aspiraciones son tener un negocio más popular y rentable en la zona.
texts.en: Martina lives in a family home with her three children aged 20, 18 and 11 who all study. Her means of sustenance is the production of snacks such as fried yucca, enchiladas, pastries, empanadas, etc. She works every afternoon starting at 2:00 pm and on Sundays she prepares a beef paw soup to sell. She started her business with her own capital. She needs a loan to be able to purchase corn, plantains, potatoes, seasonings, tomatoes, oil, flour, meat and other ingredients necessary for the preparation and sale of snacks and the beef paw soup. This will allow her to have raw materials on hand in order to stay in business, serving her clients better. Her aspirations are to have a more popular and profitable business in the area.

loans.use: purchase corn, plantains, potatoes, seasonings, tomatoes, oil, flour, meat and other ingredients for the preparation and sale of snacks and beef paw soup

loans.name: Afouavi

texts.fr: Afouavi est une femme mariée et âgée de 37 ans qui habite à Adidogome. Afouavi est mère de deux enfants et travaille activement pour son épanouissement. Pour trouver son revenu, Afouavi vend des sceaux et objets plastiques exposés dans le quartier. Afouavi s’approvisionne une fois par mois et demande ce crédit pour commander des assiettes, des bassines et des sceaux en plastiques. Afouavi souhaite augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire et permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en: Afouavi is a married woman aged 37 who lives in Adidogomé. She is the mother of two children and works actively for their well-being. In order to earn a living, Afouavi sells buckets and plastic objects that she displays in her district. She adds to her inventory once a month and is asking for this loan to order plates, basins, and buckets made of plastic. She hopes to grow her profit margin and give her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy six dozen plates, six dozen basins, and eight dozen buckets

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita continúa con su negocio de tienda de barrio, el préstamo que obtuvo lo invirtió en su negocio mediante la compra de alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad como; fideo, arroz, azúcar, huevo, golosinas, refrescos, etc., el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque no tuvo mayores inconvenientes. Su negocio continúa siendo su principal fuente de ingresos, es por esa razón que constantemente debe mantenerla surtida y abastecida, “trabajo toda la semana y mi tienda se desabastece constantemente, el problema es surtirla a diario…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital para abastecer el negocio. Su sueño es ampliar su tienda y vender artículos de librería, ella desea abastecer su tienda de barrio con alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad para continuar con su negocio. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que desarrolla esta actividad
Es por esos motivos que Margarita solicita un préstamo para abastecer su tienda de barrio y con los beneficios ampliar la venta con artículos de librería.
texts.en:
Margarita continues in her neighborhood store. The loan she got was invested in her business through the purchase of food and basic food items like noodles, rice, sugar, eggs, sweets, soft drinks, etc. The payment of her installments was punctual as she had no problems.

Her business continues to be her main source of income and for this reason she must constantly keep it stocked and supplied. "I work all week and my store constantly runs out of supplies. The problem is you have to stock it daily" she commented. The advantage of her business is the daily sales and her disadvantage is the lack of capital to stock the store.

Her dream is to expand her store and include bookstore items. She wants to stock her neighborhood store with food and basic needs items to continue with her business. This is her third loan with the institution in the four years she has carried out this activity. For these reasons Margarita is requesting a loan to stock her store and with the profits expand her sales with bookstore items.

loans.use: to stock her neighborhood store and with the profits expand her sales with bookstore items.

loans.name: Andres Felipe

texts.es:
Andres vive en unión libre con su compañera a quien le garantiza una buena calidad de vida gracias a su negocio con el cual intenta generar ingresos para contribuir económicamente, para que en su hogar mejoren las condiciones económicas y puedan tener una vida plena. 

Desde hace 2 años comenzó con gran esfuerzo un negocio de papelería y venta de variedades en un local ubicado en el municipio de Medellin.
Trabaja con 1 empleado durante 7 horas todos los días.

Debido a que sus clientes están aumentando y cada vez demandan más productos, Andres busca un préstamo para comprar surtido de papelería y ofrecer a sus clientes mayor variedad de productos en su negocio.

Con este préstamo la actividad de Andres tendrá un gran impulso pues mejorara su inventario y sus ventas.
texts.en:
Andres lives in a common-law relationship with his partner for whom he guarantees a good quality of living thanks to his business. With it he tries to generate income to contribute financially to improve his household's economic situation so they can have a full life.

Two years ago he started through great effort a business selling paper goods and other goods in his shop located in the municipality of Medellin. He works with one employee seven hours a day, everyday. As his clients are increasing and every day request more products, Andres is looking for a loan to buy a variety of paper goods to offer his clients a greater variety of products in his business. The loan will give Andre's business a big boost as he will improve his inventory and sales.
