loans.use: to buy an assortment of paper products to offer his clients more variety of products in his business.

loans.name: Juli Johana

texts.es:
Juli es una mujer de 28 años de edad, que desde hace 5 años comenzó a trabajar en diferentes actividades, actualmente tiene una tienda de abarrotes con la que intenta generar ingresos para sustentar los gastos del hogar.

Este negocio lo atiende todos los días de 7 am a 9 pm y, a pesar de la competencia que existe en el sector, ha obtenido buenos resultados, generando ingresos suficientes para sostenerse.

El crédito que solicita con la Corporación Interactuar es un apoyo para comprar surtido al por mayor como mecato, lácteos, galletería, granos, entre otros, esto le permitirá ofrecer mayor variedad de productos para satisfacer las necesidades inmediatas de sus clientes, aumentando las ventas e ingresos que recibe por su labor.

Juli, con su espíritu de superación y las ganas de salir adelante con su familia, la impulsan a seguir luchando y avanzar para cumplir el sueño de adquirir una casa propia.
texts.en:
Juli is a 28 year-old woman who began working in a few different businesses five years ago. She currently has a grocery store, with which she is trying to generate income in order to pay for household expenses. 

She runs her business every day from 7:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m., and despite the competition in this sector, she has had good results, generating enough income to support herself. 

The loan she is asking for with the Corporación Interactuar [Interact Corporation] is to help purchase wholesale stock such as snacks, dairy products, cookies and grains, among other things. This will allow her to offer a greater variety of products in order to satisfy the immediate needs of her clients, thus increasing her sales and earnings that she makes for her work. 

Juli's spirit of excellence and her desire to get ahead with her family motivates her to continue struggling and to advance herself in order to achieve her dream of having her own house.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale stock such as snacks, dairy products, cookies and grains, among other things.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.ru: Тамара, 28 лет, замужем, 2 детей. Тамара в качестве дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 9 лет назад с суммы 4,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Тамары в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 3 коровы, 20 овец, лошадь. На 1,0 Га арендованной и 0,37 Га собственной земли Тамара выращивает ячмень для реализации. Доход в месяц от бизнеса составляет до 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Тамара обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку лошадей для отгона на пастбище. Доходы от кредита Тамара планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, чтобы накопить на покупку автомобиля.
texts.en: Tamara is 28, married, and has two children. She earns income for her family by raising livestock and planting crops, which she began nine years ago with 4,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Tamara's hard work, she currently has 3 cows, 20 sheep, and a horse. She has a 1.0 hectare plot of rented land and 0.37 hectares of her own land where she plants barley to sell. Her business brings in around 20,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to develop her business, Tamara applied for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to buy horses to fatten at pasture. She plans to use the earnings from the loan to invest in additional livestock in order to save money to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy horses to fatten at pasture

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.en:
Nicolas is 43 years old. He studied applied mathematics at the national university but never got his degree. He used to work in the public sector in the systems department, but now he works as a blacksmith. He is married and has a small daughter. 

Nicolas says that he enjoys spending time with his family, listening to Cuban music and teaching mathematics. He earns additional income from repairing computers for his friends and neighbors.  

Nicolas is asking for a loan to buy some supplies for his blacksmith business, specifically some metal profiles. His biggest accomplishment is starting a business that he enjoys, and his goal is to make it grow.

loans.use: To buy metal profiles for his blacksmith business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to do some studying for her surgery and in this way improve her health and be able to continue to work to get ahead.

loans.name: Ermaline

texts.en:
Ermaline is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ermaline is 31 years old and has five children who are in school.

Ermaline has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Ermaline has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Elma is 35 years old and both of her children are attending school.

Elma has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Elma has been in this business for three years. In the future, Elma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a married woman with three children. Marissa is 29 years old and has three children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Marissa has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. Marissa requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

In the future, Marissa would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Luz Andrea

texts.es:
Ella es Luz es una mujer trabajadora, luchadora, soñadora que se rebusca diariamente el sustento con su negocio de servicios de manicura y pedicura, con los ingresos que genera pro su profesión está mujer puede pagar el alimento, arriendo, servicios públicos de su hogar.

Luz tiene una pequeña de 3 años de edad su ilusión y sueño es darle estudio y tener una vivienda propia, razón que la lleva a contar su historia ante la comunidad KIVA, pidiendo un apoyo parta que pueda transformar su servicios a domicilio de manicura y pedicura en un salón de belleza.

Con el dinero que se encuentra solicitando Luz quiere comprar la maquinaria y la infraestructura para montar una sala de belleza, con la que espera mejorar sus ingresos para pagar puntualmente el crédito y generar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luz is a hardworking dreamer with a fighting spirit who supports herself working in her manicure and pedicure business every day. With the income she makes in her profession, she can pay for food, rent, and utilities for her home.

Luz has a three year-old daughter and her dream is to give her an education and to have a home of their own. This is what brings her to tell her story to the KIVA community and to request support so that she can transform her home-based manicure and pedicure services into a beauty salon.

With the money that she is requesting, Luz wants to purchase the machinery and infrastructure to open a beauty salon, with which she hopes to increase her income in order to punctually pay back the loan and create a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase the machinery and infrastructure to open a beauty salon.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Jerniel is 23 years old and is the second of three children in the family. His mother, Gemma, who is a member of NWTF, supports the family through her rice-retailing business in the Philippines.

Jerniel is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Criminology and is currently in the 3rd of this 4-year course.

Gemma is borrowing Php 7,000 to pay for the tuition fees of her son Jerniel for the first semester of the school year 2015-16.

When he graduates, Jerniel plans to help his family to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Analisa

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Analisa works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell bananas business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Analisa is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of bananas to sell.

Analisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Neonita

texts.en:
Mailyn is 18 years old and is the youngest of 11 children in the family. Her mother Neonita, a member of NWTF, supports the family through her general store business in the Philippines.

Mailyn is studying for her Bachelor of Science in Business Administration, majoring in Fishery Business Management, and is currently in the 3rd of this 4-year course.

Neonita is borrowing Php 7,000 to pay the tuition fees of her daughter Maily for the first semester of the school year 2015-16.

When she graduates, Mailyn plans to be gainfully employed in the future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Woetsa

texts.fr: Woetsa est une femme mariée et âgée de 51 ans. Mère d’un enfant, Woetsa vit à Adidogomé et  travaille  activement pour son épanouissement. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Woetsa vend des produits d’alimentations générales dans sa boutique afin d’avoir son bénéfice. Woetsa achète ses provisions trois fois par mois sur un marché local du quartier. Pour commander des sacs de riz et des cartons de sardines, Woetsa demande ce crédit pour réaliser son achat et tirer plus de bénéfice pour agrandir son commerce.
texts.en: Woetsa is a 51-year-old married mother to one child who lives in Adidogomé and who actively strives for a better life. In order to meet her goals, Woetsa sells general foodstuffs from her stall so she can make a profit. She purchases her supplies three times per month from a local market. Woetsa is requesting this loan to purchase bags of rice and tins of sardines so she can earn larger profits and grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase three tins of sardines and three bags of rice

loans.name: Debi

texts.fr: Agée de 55 ans, Debi est une femme mariée qui a deux enfants à sa charge. Habitant à Adidogomé, Debi est très dynamique et active pour assurer les charges quotidiennes. Debi vend des objets d’arts et des statuettes devant sa maison et réalise un revenu favorable. Debi s’approvisionne au marché deux fois par mois. Debi sollicite ce microcrédit pour commander des objets d’arts pour satisfaire ses clients et avoir assez de profits pour promouvoir l’éducation de son enfant.
texts.en: 55-year-old Debi is a married woman who has two children living in her care. Living in Adidogomé, Debi is very dynamic and active in ensuring her family's daily needs are met. She sells pieces of art and small statues outside of her home and earns a good income from this. Debi gets her supplies from market twice monthly. Debi is requesting this loan to order more art pieces so she can satisfy her customers and make enough profit to see that her child receives an education.

loans.use: to purchase 20 pieces of art

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: Agée de 37 ans, Julienne est une femme célibataire qui vit avec six enfants à Adidogomé. Pour favoriser leur épanouissement, Julienne vend des pagnes en se déplaçant dans le quartier. Julienne réalise son gain grâce à cette activité et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter des pièces de pagne, Julienne demande ce fonds pour favoriser sa commande et avoir une marge bénéficiaire qui l’aidera à mieux contribuer aux charges de la famille.
texts.en: 37-year-old Julienne is a single woman who lives with six children in Adidogomé. In order to make sure they have everything they need, Julienne sells sheets of pagne cloth as a street vendor. She is able to earn a living through this activity and gets her supplies twice monthly from market. Julienne is requesting the funds to purchase sheets of pagne so she can earn enough profit for her to better meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase six sheets of traditional pagne cloth

loans.name: Nora Eneida

texts.es:
Nora se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo, productos que son muy bien acogidos por los habitantes del municipio de Itagüí.

Es casada y con gran satisfacción y amor por su trabajo, pues este le ha dado lo necesario para vivir.

Solicita un aliento económico el cual invertirá en la compra de mercancía como ropa, accesorios y demás para vender a través de catalogo.

Con este préstamo podrá sacar adelante su empresa y podría convertirse en una gran empresaria a futuro.
texts.en:
Nora sells products through a catalog. These products are very well received by the people in Itagüí municipality.

Nora is married. She loves her job and is very satisfied because it provides her with what she needs to live. 

She is requesting a financial boost that she will use to buy merchandise such as clothing and accessories, among others, that she will sell through catalog. 

With this loan she can move her business forward and become a real entrepreneur in the future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as clothing, accessories, and others to sell through catalog.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Adjo est une femme mariée qui vit à Adidogomé avec trois enfants. Adjo vend des produits cosmétiques et des pommades de beauté pour gagner son revenu et favoriser une éducation adéquate à ses enfants. Grâce à cette activité, Adjo arrive à faire une bonne épargne et tirer un bon profit de son activité. Adjo s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché local. Pour passer une commande, Adjo demande ce prêt pour acheter des parfums et des pommades pour gagner son revenu et atteindre ses objectifs.
texts.en:
Adjo is a married woman who lives in Adidogomé with her three children. She sells cosmetics and beauty creams to earn a living and give her children an adequate education. Thanks to this little business, Adjo manages to put by savings and make a good profit from her activity. She adds to her inventory twice a month in a local market. 

So that she can put in an order, Adjo is requesting this loan to buy perfume and pomades so as to earn her livelihood and meet her objectives.

loans.use: to buy 10 containers of perfume and 34 of pomade

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Glen Mark is 17 years old and is the only child of the family. His mother, Jonalyn, a member of NWTF, supports the family through her frozen food retail business in the Philippines.

Glen Mark is studying for a Bachelor of Industrial Arts major in automotive and is currently in the 1st of this 4-year course.

Jonalyn is borrowing Php 6,500 to pay for the tuition fees of her son Glen Mark for the first semester of the school year 2015-16.

When he graduates, Glen Mark plans to be gainfully employed in the future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Glady

texts.en:
Vadainie is 16 years old and is the first of six children in the family. His mother, Glady, a member of NWTF, supports the family through her pig-fattening business in the Philippines.

Vadainie is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Information Technology and is currently in the 1st of this 4-year course.

Glady is borrowing Php 5,000 to pay for tuition fees of her son Vadainie for the first semester of the school year 2015-16.

When he graduates, Vadainie plans to be gainfully employed in the future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Jesusima

texts.en:
George Paul is 18 years old and is the only child in the family. His mother, Jesusima a member of NWTF, supports the family through her dressmaking business in the Philippines.

George Paul is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Information Technology and is currently in the 3rd of this 4-year course.

Jesusima is borrowing PHP 9,000 to pay for the First Semester fees for the 2015-16 school year for her son George Paul.

George Paul plans to graduate and be gainfully employed in the future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees for her son George Paul.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гулмира, 41 год, вдова, есть 3 детей, младшему сыну 16 лет. У Гулмиры среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и полеводством уже 15 лет. Благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Гулмиры, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 3 коровы. На участке мерою 0,32 Га собственной и 0,18 Га арендованной земли, она выращивает кукурузу и картофель для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный доход - порядка 18,500 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь, поэтому Гулмира решила обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 4 бычков и нетели для увеличения поголовья скота и семейных доходов. Гулмира намерена расширить свой бизнес, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи и в будущем позволит отремонтировать дом.
texts.en: Gulmira is 41, widowed, and has three children. Her youngest son is 16. Gulmira has a high school education and has earned the main income for her family over the last 15 years by raising livestock and planting crops. Thanks to Gulmira's perseverance, determination, and hard work, she currently has three cows. She also has a 0.32 hectare plot of her own land and rents a 0.18 hectare plot where she grows corn and potatoes to consume on the farm and to sell. Her monthly income is 18,500 som (KGS), which is not enough to live on, so Gulmira decided to apply for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to buy four young bulls and calves to increase her livestock headcount and her family's income. Gulmira intends to expand her business, which will inevitably lead to an increase in her family's income and allow her to repair her house in the future.

loans.use: to buy four young bulls and calves in order to help bolster her income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy local produce such as dried beans, livestock feed, and maize for resale in the town and countryside

loans.name: Essé

texts.fr: Essé est une femme mariée de 43 ans et très entreprenante. Essé vit à Adidogomé avec quatre enfants à sa charge. Essé travaille activement pour leur favoriser une bonne éducation. Pour cela Essé vend des chaines en or pour homme et femme dans son quartier pour trouver le revenu nécessaire. Essé s’approvisionne deux fois par mois marché. Pour commander des paquets de chaines, Essé demande ce crédit pour financer son activité et réaliser plus de profits pour aider son mari à assurer  l’épanouissement de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Essé is a married woman of 43 and a self-starter. She lives in Adidogomé, raising four children. She works hard to be able to give them a good education. For that reason, Essé sells gold necklaces for men and women in her area so as to earn the necessary income. She buys more inventory twice a week at a market. 

To be able to order some packets of necklaces, Essé is requesting this loan to finance her business and make more profits so as to help her husband to ensure the well-being of their children.

loans.use: to buy six dozen necklaces

loans.name: Welchita

texts.en: Jean Mar is 21 years old and the youngest of seven children in her family. Her mother Welchita, who is a member of NWTF, supports the family by selling clothing on a retail basis in the Philippines. Jean Mar is studying to get a Bachelor's degree in Elementary Education and is currently in the second year of a four-year course. To help pay her daughter's tuition, Welchita has requested a loan for PHP  11,710. Jean Mar's goal for the future is to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en: Friendship Mae is 18 and the oldest of two children in her family. Her mother Michelle is a member of NWTF and supports her family by buying and selling jewelry in the Philippines. Friendship Mae is studying to get a Bachelor of Science degree in Accountancy and is currently in the third year of this four-year program. Michelle has requested a loan for PHP 1,2000 to pay her daughter's tuition for the first semester of the school year 2015-16. When she graduates, Friendship Mae plans to be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Fiorella Elizabeth

texts.es:
Fiorella Elizabeth tiene 27 años de edad de estado civil casada, vive en casa alquilada, junto a su esposo e hijo, en el aa.hh Santa Julia, del Distrito de Morropon, que pertenece a la Provincia de Chiclayo, Región Cajamarca, Sierra Norte de Perú. Santa Julia es un lugar donde sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura , ganadería y comercio cuenta con servicios básicos como son agua y luz.

La actividad que desarrolla Fiorella es la venta de cerveza por unidades y cajas y bebidas preparadas como chicha de maiz morado, agua de manzana, y maracuya, actividades que realiza hace más de 5 años, contando con clientela fija y con muy buenas referencias. El destino del crédito será para invertirlo en la compra de más cajas de cerveza y otras golosinas para surtir el negocio, para incrementar ventas,lo que le ayudará a tener un mejor modo de vida.
texts.en:
Fiorella Elizabeth is 27 years old and married. She lives in a rented house with her husband and child in the town of Santa Julia, which is located in the Morropon district, which belongs to the Chiclayo province in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru. Santa Julia is a place where the people work in agriculture, livestock, and commerce, and they have basic services such as water and electricity.

Fiorella makes a living selling bottles and cases of beer as well as prepared beverages such as chicha de maiz morado (a sweet drink made from purple corn), apple water, and passion fruit water. She has been performing this work for more than 5 years, and she relies on regular customers as well as very good references. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more cases of beer as well as other snacks in order to stock her business and increase sales. This will help her improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more cases of beer as well as other snacks in order to stock her business.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en: Analiza is 46 years old, married and the mother of one child, who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who earns a living by running a fish-selling business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 16,000 loan from NWTF to buy more seafood to sell. Analiza has been in this business for twenty years. Her goal for the future is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Dans le quartier d’Adidogomé, Afi vit avec ses quatre enfants. Afi une femme mariée et âgée de 35 ans. Afi est revendeuse de charbon de bois qui gagne son revenu journalier grâce à cette activité. Afi stock les charbons dans sa maison et livre ensuite aux clients qui viennent en chercher. Afi s’approvisionne au marché deux fois par mois. Pour acheter de nouveaux sacs de charbons, Afi demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et tirer un revenu favorable pour l’épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en:
In the neighborhood of Adidogomé, Afi lives with her four children. She is a married woman aged 35. She sells charcoal and earns her daily income thanks to this activity. Afi stocks the charcoal in her  home and then sells it to her customers who come to get it. She stocks up twice a month at the market. 

In order to buy more sacks of charcoal, Afi is requesting this loan to complete her purchase and make a good income so that her family can flourish.

loans.use: to buy six sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Everlyn

texts.en:
Lodelon is 18 years old and he is the youngest of four children in the family. His mother Everlyn is a member of NWTF, and supports the family through her livestock business in the Philippines.

Lodelon is studying for his Bachelor of Elementary Education degree and is currently in the second year of this four-year course.

Everlyn is borrowing PHP 12,250 to pay her son's tuition fees for the first semester of the school year 2015-16.

When he graduates, Lodelon plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to to pay for her son's tuition fees.

loans.name: Ainura

texts.ru: Айнура, 41 год, замужем, мать 3 детей. У нее среднее образование, работает в школе. Также много лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Айнуры, ее хозяйство на сегодняшний день насчитывает корову, 16 овец, лошадь. Также есть 1,0 ГА арендованной поливной земли, где Айнура выращивает ячмень для реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айнура обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки коровы и нетели. Доходы от кредита Айнура планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, чтобы построить сараи для скота.
texts.en: Ainura is 41 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She has a secondary education and works in a school. She has also reared animals and grown crops for many years. Thanks to Ainura's hard work, today she has a cow, sixteen sheep, and a horse. There are also 1.0 hectares of rented irrigated land where Ainura grows barley for sale. In order to develop her business further, Ainura has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) to increase the size of her herd by buying a cow and a heifer. Ainura plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in further increasing her number of domestic livestock in order to build barns for the livestock.

loans.use: to buy a cow and a heifer to increase her herd.

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Girlie is 18 years old and is the only child in the family. Her mother Ma. Theresa is a member of NWTF, and supports the family through her pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Girlie is studying for her Bachelor of Science in Business Administration degree and is currently in the third year of this four-year course.

Ma. Theresa is borrowing PHP 10,000 to pay her daughter's tuition fees for the first semester of the school year 2015-16.

When she graduates, Girlie plans to be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition fees.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is a hard-working woman entrepreneur with two children.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her business.

She industriously earns additional income from coconut wine.

Analiza dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: In 2013, the borrower was diagnosed with multi-drug resistant TB. He has successfully completed treatment, having received support from Partners In Health-Peru during this time. Now 20 years old, the borrower is working with his sister, who has a stall selling children’s clothing in a local market. The borrower will complement her business with the sale of children’s shoes in the same market. He will use the money from the loan to purchase sport shoes and socks for children.

loans.use: To sell children's shoes

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The borrower is 27. She is married and has three children between the ages of one and nine. The borrower and her husband started a business making jackets, purchasing an overlocking sewing machine with their savings. Their business was doing well at first, but needs more support to move forward. That is why the borrower would like to have a cover stitch machine, so that her products are better presented. Her sister will support her with sales.

loans.use: To purchase a cover stitch sewing machine

loans.name: Sutami

texts.en: Sutami lives in Kudus, which is east of Semarang, the capital of Central Java, and a nine-hour drive from Jakarta. She is happily married and the mother of one cute daughter. She also owns a stall where she sells small snacks and mobile airtime credits to people in her community. She has been a member of Ruma for a year and joined after hearing about our organization from a sales executive who came to her stall. She is requesting a loan to sell more mobile airtime credits. This loan will help her improve her business and her community's access to these services. Sutami is very grateful for the kind support of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits and electricity bill-payment services in her village.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a married and the mother of two children who earns a living by running a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan from NWTF to buy more items to sell, including canned goods and personal care products. Jane has been in this business for eight years, and her goal for the future is to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy items to sell.

loans.name: Libardo Antonio

texts.es:
Libardo es un determinante, imparable y simpático hombre, que sin importar las adversidades que se le han presentado en la vida, tanto económicas, familiares como laboralmente, inicio con un negocio de cafetería.

Tiene diferentes inconvenientes, básicamente la competencia; pero superando estas crisis, Libardo está logrando consolidar su negocio. 

Su negocio está prosperando y quiere poder ofrecer un empleo 

Solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido de bebidas e ingredientes para la preparación de comestibles.

De este modo podrá crecer con un negocio fuerte y estable que compite con los demás de la zona.
texts.en:
Libardo is a determined, unstoppable, and friendly man. Regardless of the adversities that he has encountered in life -- economic, family, and work related -- he started a restaurant business. He has various challenges, most notably competition. However, overcoming this obstacle, Libardo is managing to strengthen his business. His business is thriving, and he wishes to offer employment.

He is requesting a loan to buy an assortment of beverages and ingredients for the preparation of food items. This way, he will be able to growth with a strong and stable business that can compete with the others in the area.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of beverages and ingredients for the preparation of food items.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.pt:
Marcos de 43 anos de idade, nasceu em Mavanja e é residente de Magude na casa própria, casado e pai de 2 filhos menores todos frequentando o ensino primário. 
Com o presente financiamento de 30.000 irá comprar cimento, areia e pedra para rebocar a sua casa e fazer murro de vedação.
Tem como sonhos concluir a sua obra e adquirir uma viatura para o uso pessoal.
Tem como desafios a insuficiência fundos, mas tem recorrido ao negócio e ao crédito para resolver seus pendentes.
texts.en:
Marcos is 43 years old and comes from Mavanja. He lives in Magude in a house that he owns. He's married and has two underage children who are in primary school.
With the current loan for 30,000mt he'll purchase cement, sand and rocks in order to plaster his house and build a fence wall.
His dreams are to finish his construction work and buy a vehicle for personal use.
His challenge is the lack of funds, but he has been turning to his business and to credit as a way to settle his affairs.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand and rocks in order to plaster his house and build a fence wall.

loans.name: Divine Group

texts.fr: Marie Augustine est une femme veuve de 55 ans et mère de 3 enfants;elle une expérience d"environ 5 ans dans production du savon;elle a un circuit fidèle d"approvisionnement ce qui fait sa force car elle n'a pas de rupture en temps de pénurie de matière première;elle est une client régulière a ACFIME. La cliente veux le crédit pour stocker sa matière première. Acheter 3 bidons de d"huile; 2 sacs de soude caustique; 2 bidons de beurre de karité. Après ses ventes, son bénéfice lui permettra de contribuer au dépenses de sa famille mais aussi de continuer son activité.
texts.en:
Marie Augustine is a widowed woman, who is 55 years old, and a mother of three children. She has worked for around five years making soap.

She has access to a constant supply, which is good, because she does not have gaps in her stock even when there is a shortage of raw materials. 

She is a regular client with ACFIME. 

Marie Augustine wants a loan to buy raw materials--three drums of oil, two sacs of caustic soda, and two drums of Shea butter.

loans.use: to increase her production of soap

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es:
Fanny con su gran voluntad y verdaderos deseos de salir adelante, decidió emprender con un negocio de venta de mercancía como ropa y accesorios para vestir.  Estos elementos intenta venderlos para obtener la manutención de sus gastos.

Es una mujer emprendedora, con visión, juiciosa, organizada y muy simpática; valores que la han convertido en una vendedora muy reconocida.

Su anhelo es poder aumentar y hacer crecer su negocio, es por eso que solicita el apoyo de un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de ropa al por mayor y accesorios.

Solo de este modo podrá tener esa gran oportunidad de progresar.
texts.en:
Fanny, with her great will and desire to get ahead, decided to begin a business selling clothing and accessories.  She tries to sell her merchandise to cover her expenses. 

She is an enterprising woman with vision, judicious, organized and very kind.  These are values that have converted her into a well recognized salesperson.  Her desire is to be able to grow her business.  This is why she is asking for the support of a loan to invest it in the purchase of wholesale clothing and accessories.  Only in this manner will she have the great opportunity to progress.

loans.use: to buy clothing wholesale and accessories.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 64 years old, married, and has four children. Elvira works very hard to provide for them.

Elvira runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, bread, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, sugar, eggs, and personal care products.

Elvira has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Yoeni Estefania

texts.es:
Yoeni es una joven de 23 años de edad, madre cabeza de familia, una persona responsable que asumió la consecuencia de sus dos embarazos prematuros, haciéndoles frente con madurez.

Yoeni es madre de dos hijos una de 7 años y otro de 5 meses, su mayor deseo es brindarle un hogar confortable, estudio y amor por lo que le quede de vida y se gana el sustento para llevar el alimento diario a la mesa vendiendo calzado, específicamente sandalias que es el producto de mayor venta en su sector debido a su comodidad y bajo precio.

Yoeni si le pidieran un deseo para ella sería comprar una vivienda propia y a esto le apunto y a pesar de que en el municipio hay baja economía ella hace hasta lo imposible por vender calzado para alimentar a sus hijas.

Yoeni quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de Sandalias en cantidad, reduciendo el costo de compra, siendo el aumento de su utilidad su mayor beneficio.
texts.en:
Yoeni is a young woman of 23, head of the family, a responsible person who takes responsibility for both of her early pregnancies.  Yoeni is mother to a 7 year old daughter and a 5 month old baby.  Her wish is to give them a comfortable home, schooling and love with what she has left of her life.  

She earns a living selling footwear, specifically sandals, which are the biggest seller in her area due to the comfort and low price.  

Yoeni wishes to purchase her own house and although the economy in her town is slow, she does the impossible by selling shoes to feed her children.  Yoeni is asking for the loan to purchase sandals in bulk, reducing the purchase cost, as she makes her money by selling them at retail prices.

loans.use: to purchase sandals in bulk, reducing the purchase price, earning her money off of the increased retail price.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy has requested a fourth loan from Kiva so that he can open a sixth mobile money transfer shop. He is 42 years old and has been running the business for the past six years. Jimmy has successfully repaid all his previous loans. He would like to let his Kiva lenders know that he is doing well in his business. The loans helped expand his business, and he is now selling air time / phone credit. This has given him more new customers across his five shops.

Jimmy is requesting another Kiva loan so that he can open another shop. He will use the money to buy a new trading kiosk and fund all his start-up costs, such as working capital float needed to serve customers. Jimmy says he has been encouraged by how his business has grown in the last few years, and he is sure that opening another shop will help him to earn more commissions. 

Jimmy is working very hard because he would like to own his own house someday. He hopeful that, once he opens his sixth shop, the combined profits will put him in a position where he can be able to build his own house and continue to pay for his children’s school fees.

In this photo, Jimmy poses with the phone he uses to make transactions and one of his employees, Joseph is inside the trading booth.

loans.use: to buy a new trading kiosk and have working capital float needed to serve customers

loans.name: Irma Luz

texts.es:
Buscando generar una vida digna y de comodidades la señora Irma decidió emprender un camino como comerciante ya que con un salario ordinario no alcanza a cubrir los gastos de su hogar, ya que es madre cabeza de familia y tiene un pequeño de 8 años de edad.

Irma tiene un negocio de tienda de abarrotes el cual siempre ha querido invertirle capital para mejorar y aumentar su inventario pero sus deudas y su labor como cabeza de familia le han impedido tener dinero.

Una entidad financiera no había confiado en Irma por eso para ella es una bendición recibir el Si de una entidad como Interactuar que está dispuesta a confiar en ella y apoyarla para abastecer su negocio.

Irma solicita un préstamo para la compra de  refrescos, snacks, vivieres, abarrotes, cerveza, lácteos u dulces, un préstamo que dará progreso a su actividad.
texts.en:
Looking for a way to generate a dignified and comfortable life, Irma decided to start herself on the way of a businesswoman since with an ordinary salary she couldn't cover her household expenses, because she is the head of the family and has a little one who is 8 years old.

Irma's business is a grocery store, which she has always wanted to invest capital in to improve and increase her inventory, but her debts and her labor as head of the family have impeded her from having enough money.

A traditional bank hasn't trusted in Irma, so for her it is a blessing to receive the confidence of an organization like Interactuar that is prepared to trust her and support her to provide for her business.  

Irma is requesting a loan to purchase refreshments, snacks, produce, groceries, beer, dairy products and sweets.  This loan will allow her business to progress.

loans.use: to purchase refreshments, snacks, produce, groceries, beer, dairy products and sweets.  This loan will allow her business to progress.

loans.name: Zanele

texts.en:
Zanele is a Business Management Student at the Maharishi Institute and was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute: This is her story

:1.	What do you study at the Maharishi Institute? Which classes do you enjoy the most?
At the Maharishi Institute I am currently studying a BBA degree; my favorite classes are Marketing, Human Resources and Economics, because I love to interact with people and sitting with people, brain picking them about what they are thinking and working with numbers.
 
2.	What are your goals after graduating from the Maharishi Institute? Please be specific: in which sector do you expect to work? In which city would you like to work? Would you like to travel?
My goals are to become a world known Marketing Director, working for PRIMEDIA, because you have to start slow and develop and grow yourself before you can go play with the big dogs. The Marketing department is where my heart is, the rush of coming up with an advert concept is mind blowing for me, which is why I want to see myself there.

3.	Tell us about your background. Where were you born? Do you have brothers and sisters? What do your parents do for work? Are you married; do you have children?
I was born and breed here in Gauteng; I stay at Soweto with both my parents and my three sisters. I am the second born. Since my family is a big family and most of the people do not work. My mother chose to take two of my cousins to take care of them, because their parents could not. My father has not worked in 10 years, my mother has been a domestic worker since she got let go from her previous work. After that things became very bad, because both my parents were struggling to maintain this huge family. Then I had to go out and look for a small part time job, which made me suffer because my school work took strain. Later on my mom found out about the Maharishi Institute, but we still cannot afford to pay the minimum fee of R200 a month. I really enjoy attending the institute because they do not only focus on feeding you with knowledge but they also help you grow at your potential best.

4.	What do you like to do in your spare time?
During my spare time I enjoy reading a lot and also to the gym to stay healthy mentally and physically. I also go to my nearest old age home to help them wash and clean around the home, and also sit and read for the old people. My love for being with people has grown but lately I have not had much time to myself because of school.

5.	How will Kiva loan change your life? Describe how the loan will affect your studies and your lifestyle: will there be significant changes?
The kiva loan will help me a lot because it will help me with being able to pay back my student loan and also with the small money I will get for myself, it will help me with paying all my expenses. Mostly what I really need it for is for me to be able to pay back my student loan while am still studying. My lifestyle would completely change because I will depend on myself and give my parents some space to breathe and take care of my other siblings.

loans.use: to pay for one year tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Sururi

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of the Ruma agents, Sururi. Sururi lives in Magelang, around a one hour and thirty minute flight from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Sururi is happily married. 

He owns a stall where he sells small snacks, drinks, and mobile airtime credits for his community. He joined PT Rekan Usaha Mikro Anda (Ruma) a year ago. He knew Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive, who came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he is interested in Ruma’s system. The sales executive will be coming to his stall to collect the money. Moreover, his community sees him as a trustworthy mobile provider.

As the business grows, Sururi is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits to his local community. Understanding its importance, your loan will be very useful in helping Sururi improve his business and, by extension, his community, which needs access to such services. 

As seen in the photo, Sururi is the one who is standing in his own stall. He will be very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to help local community members who need access to communication services.

loans.name: Siti

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Meet one of the new Ruma agents, Siti, who lives in Magelang, Central Java. Siti sells mobile airtime credits and provides electricity bill payment service for her community. Siti is known by her neighbors as a cheerful and kind woman. That’s why it’s really easy for her to attract customers. She began to realize that she needed to help her husband improve their lives by contributing to their income. Therefore, almost a year ago, she decided to join Ruma and provide the services that allow her customers to buy mobile phone credits and pay the bills.

As the business grows, Siti is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community, especially on weekends. The loan will be very useful in helping Siti improve her business and in helping her community access her services.

Siti, in the photo, is very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases and electricity bill payments for members of her local community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle, so as to attract more customers for more income gain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits to sell to gain more income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock of maize grains for sale in the market so as to meet clients needs.

loans.name: Erika Merielle

texts.en: Erika is 19 years old and single. As younger person, she wants to finish her studies to achieve her dreams in life. Erika really wants to finish her courses so she decided to take out a loan to pay for her tuition and complete her education.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is a 36 years old, married, and has two children to provide for. To earn a living she's engaged in a rice production business. 

As a mother she wants to give her children a good life, so she decided to request a loan to purchase fertilizer for the rice farm.  This will help produce a good quality of rice and enable her to deliver rice to the market and increase sales to generate more income.

In the future, Cheryl wants to expand her business to improve her family's living condition.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the rice farm

loans.name: Bernardus

texts.en:
Hello lenders! This is Bernardus, one of Ruma’s agents who lives in Magelang, Indonesia. He is happily married and he and his wife have two sons and one daughter. As a main source of income, he owns and manages a small stall that sells consumer products. 

He joined Ruma last year. He is excited to learn more about mobile technology from Ruma’s mobile application. 
By supporting this loan you will be providing extra working capital for Bernardus' shop. This will allow Bernardus to become an agent for Ruma’s layaway product, Mapan, which is designed for lower-income communities.. Mapan enables customers to save money, little by little, by depositing change at places like Bernardus' business. As their balances grow, customers can make major asset purchases like housewares, appliances, and school supplies for their children. As a Mapan agent, Bernardus is responsible for processing deposits from customers into their Mapan accounts as well as receiving orders from customers who want to buy products listed in Ruma's Mapan catalog. When a customer orders, Bernardus will submit the order via SMS and, within five to 10 days, the product will be delivered to the customer. With Mapan, Bernardus believes that his local community will be able to have access to higher quality products at lower prices. 

Bernardus, who is in the photo, is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide additional working capital to help introduce Ruma's new savings plan for low-income communities..

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 48 years old, married, and has three children.

She runs an agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Fatima is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Fatima has been in this business for 6 years, and also earns additional income from running a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines, and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Ruthnaren

texts.en:
Ruthnaren is 38 years old, married, and has four children.

She runs an agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Ruthnaren is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Ruthnaren has been in this business for 15 years, and also earns additional income from running a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Egna Lucero

texts.es:
Lucero cuenta con una experiencia de muchos años en la actividad de la confección, tiene su taller de confección a terceros en su casa desde hace 19 años. 
Trabaja durante todo el día y con su taller desea generar empleo para personas con muchas necesidades. 

Esta actividad la aprendió de su madre quien le enseñó desde muy pequeña. La ventaja es que ya tiene reconocimiento en el sector y la calidad de sus productos es muy buena, lo que le ha permitido cada vez conseguir más clientes para su negocio y también se ha transformado en buenos pedidos. 

Trabaja con 1 empleado durante 4 horas aproximadamente todos los días.

Debido a que en la actualidad su capacidad de producción no alcanza para satisfacer a todos sus clientes, Lucero requiere de un préstamo para comprar una máquina fileteadora para aumentar la capacidad de producción de su negocio e insumos de confección.

Su mayor anhelo es salir adelante con su taller de confección y poder tener en su hogar unas mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar junto a sus 3 hijos.
texts.en:
Lucero has operated a sewing business for many years, a business that she started when she was only 19 years old.  She learned sewing from her mother when she was a young girl.  She works from dawn to dusk and says that she wants to hire more employees.  

Lucero is known for the quality of her work, an advantage that has brought her many customers over the years and contributed to the success of her business.  She has one employee now who works about 4 hours a day, every day.  

Lucero is applying for a loan that she will use to buy a specialist machine for embroidering cloth.  She cannot meet demand for her sewing services now and the investment will allow her to rectify that.  She wants to grow her business and earn enough to give her 3 children a better chance to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy a specialist machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Delicia

texts.en:
Delicia works hard to support her family. Delicia is married and has a weaving abaca business in the Philippines.

Delicia requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional abaca and other materials for her business.

Delicia has been in this business for 2 years now, and also earns additional income from running a general store.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional abaca and other materials for her business

loans.name: Sheilla

texts.en:
Sheilla is a 20-year-old businesswoman from Zimbabwe’s Mudzi District. Originally, she sold her clothes door to door. Sheilla volunteers on a weekly basis at the local secondary school working with the students as a Camfed Learner Guide, and in addition, she helps keep the facility clean. She is a source of inspiration to many young people in her community.  

She got a first loan that she used to increase her stock that enabled her to start renting a stall at a flea market where she sells dresses, skirts, jackets, and baby clothes and she repaid the loan timely. Sheilla will use the second Kiva loan to purchase dresses, shirts, and pants in bulk, to be able to increase her profits and to boost sales. Sheila is planning to have her own shop in future.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Nyarai

texts.en: Nyarai is 28 years old and married with two children. She resides in Chikomba West District, Zimbabwe. Nyarai volunteers at community centres where she assists students with their studies through cooperative learning groups. Nyarai buys and sells clothes and is doing extremely well. She has also diversified by keeping chickens to increase her profits. She has been able to repay her loan on time and to buy food and clothes for her family. Her husband is currently unemployed. With the second loan that she is requesting, she is looking forward to expanding her poultry business. She wants to purchase more chicks and chick feed and to make sure that she will keep poultry throughout the year. She wishes her business could continue to expand and she hopes if she gets the loan, her business will flourish.Thank you for supporting Nyarai’s loan!

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chick feeds

loans.name: Salomu

texts.en:
Salomu is a 23-year-old businesswoman living in Mbire, a district in rural Zimbabwe. She is married and a mother of one. She provides counseling services at a local community center to young people facing challenges. Salomu also inspires young women in her community as an entrepreneur, operating a grocery shop selling items such as cooking oil, sugar, salt, maize-meal, sugar beans, matemba (sardines), biscuits, sweets, and stationery. 

The loan has brought a significant change in her life – she can now fend for herself and her family. She has proven that a young rural girl can be self-reliant regardless of deep-seated cultural beliefs, norms, and practices in her community. With the requested loan she would like to further expand her business and open another retail outlet in the next village.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for her shop.

loans.name: Moline

texts.en: Moline is a 24-year-old mother of two. She currently lives in the Mbire District of Zimbabwe. For the past three years, Moline has successfully operated a grocery shop at the local business center where she sells sugar, cooking oil, matches, chips, macaroni and flour. The business is well stocked and has a flea market base in the village. The customers are happy because they get most of their supplies from the shop. She would like to use this second loan to expand her business. An increase in the profit will mean better living conditions for her family and support to vulnerable children in her community.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, cooking oil, matches, chips, macaroni and flour.

loans.name: Tsitsi

texts.en:
Tsitsi is a 35-year-old businesswoman. She is married with three children, and residing in Chikomba West District in Zimbabwe. She is well-known as a pillar of support for vulnerable children and a source of inspiration for young rural women in the community. 

Tsitsi has proven that a little can go a long way. When she received her first loan, she invested it in her business by purchasing more stock and adding variety. Her sales increased by 5% over time. 

Given another loan, she would like to diversify to hardware, which is a very lucrative business in her community. 

She will use the loan to stock her shop with stock feed and hardware items. 

The profits from her business will enable her to secure further education, as well as provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To stock her shop with stock feed and hardware items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, rice, milk, cooking oil and soap detergents to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs (fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides) to use in farming.

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora is 64 years old, married and has four children. She has a vegetable farm to earn income and is able to help her husband provide for the family's needs. She wants to increase her income so she is taking out a loan to purchase fertilizer for the vegetables to produce a high-quality crop to sell at the market. 

Dioscora's plan for the future to save money to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for the vegetable farm.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 40 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell of charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Marilou has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell of charcoal for 10 years and also earns an income from her general store.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice farming business in the Philippines. 

Imelda has been in this business for 5 years. She earns additional income from raising pigs.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies for her rice farming business.

Imelda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 43 years old, married, and has three children, two of which are in school.  Elena works very hard to provide for them.

Elena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, bread, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, sugar, eggs, and personal care products.

Elena has been in this business for 6 years. 

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
Jona is 31 years old, married, and has two children. Jona works very hard to provide for them.

Jona runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, bread, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, sugar, eggs, and personal care products.

Jona has been in this business for 5 years. 

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 54 years old, married and has five children.

Delia is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Delia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Delia has been farming rice for 10 years now and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Razel

texts.en:
Razel is 63 years old, widowed, and has two children.

Razel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, bread, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, sugar, eggs, and personal care products.

Razel has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready to wear clothing.

Razel aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is married and has nine children.   Sandra works hard to support her family. and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Sandra requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Sandra has been in this business for 10 years now, and also earns additional income from running a general store.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan práctica la agricultura, crianza y comercialización de ganado, anteriormente se dedicaba  al destazo de reses, para vender sus derivados, su negocio es muy popular en la zona. Vive con su familia y no tiene parientes que le ayuden económicamente.
Está solicitando un crédito para fortalecer su negocio, comprara ganado e insumos agrícolas para tener un mejor inventario y mantenerse trabajando en el campo, espera que la productividad sea mayor y que pueda abastecer a sus clientes.
Sus objetivos son tener menos necesidades en su hogar y darles a sus hijos la oportunidad de tener acceso a una educación superior.
texts.en: Juan is a farmer, raising and selling cattle.  Previously, he worked slaughtering cattle to sell meat and his business is very popular in the area.  He lives with his family and doesn't have any relatives who help him financially.  He is requesting a loan to strengthen his business.  He will purchase cattle and agricultural supplies to have a better inventory and maintain his work in the field.  He hopes that his productivity will improve and that he'll be able to provide for his customers.  His goals are to have less household needs and to give his children the opportunity to have access to a higher education.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and agricultural supplies to have a better inventory and maintain his work in the field.

loans.name: Martha Edilma

texts.es:
Sin mucho capital, Martha montó su taller de confección con el ánimo de generar ingresos con los cuales pueda sostener los gastos de su hogar donde convive con sus hijos.

La actividad la aprendió realizando algunos cursos y esto le ha permitido realizar trabajos que se caracterizan por su buena calidad y su puntualidad en la entrega. 

Con sus trabajos, Martha ha logrado captar un gran número de clientes que le han garantizado muy buenas ventas mensuales, por lo que espera que su negocio siga creciendo y posteriormente pueda generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas. 

Con la finalidad de responder a la demanda sus clientes, Martha busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de una maquina fileteadora.

Martha espera que así su familia pueda gozar de unos mejores ingresos los cuales les permitan tener una mejor calidad de vida y una educación de mejor calidad. 

Además, Martha espera que si su negocio sigue ampliándose a un buen ritmo y que en su taller pueda generar como mínimo un empleo para una persona que lo requiera y no tenga oportunidades laborales.
texts.en:
Without much capital, Martha began her dressmaking shop with the idea of generating income to cover the expenses of the home where she lives with her children. She learned this skill by taking some courses and this has allowed her to complete orders which are characterized by the good quality of her work and her timeliness.  

With her work, Martha has managed to keep a large number of clients who have guaranteed her very good monthly sales. She hopes that her business continues to grow and eventually she could hire help.  

With the need to respond to client demand, Martha is looking for a loan which would allow her the possibility to purchase a serger.  Martha hopes that then her family will enjoy better income which will allow a better quality of life and a higher quality education.  Furthermore, Martha hopes that if her business continues to grow in a good rhythm that she can at least have one employee to help a person who does not have a job.

loans.use: to purchase a serger (sewing machine).

loans.name: Han's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Kampong Cham province, Han is 41 years old. She is a mother of four children. Three of them are in school, and another one is too young to attend school. 

Because of her living condition, she could earn income via rice farming as the main source of income around twenty-three years. In order to earn additional income, she works as a paid worker as well. Her daily income is about 41,700KHR per day. Due to lack of fund, she is now leading a group of six to take the first Kiva loan via VisionFund. As a group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizers, seeds and pay for the plowing fee. 

She hopes that she can get more income to expand her farmland and be able to keep her children in school until their graduation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and pay for the plowing fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Sue Juliet

texts.en:
Sue is a 20-year-old, single, young woman living in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. She inspires young women in her community to become entrepreneurs in order to achieve financial independence. 

Sue’s business is doing well. She repaid her $500 loan very well. The loan is uplifting her and her family’s standard of living. She managed to pay school fees for her sibling who is in secondary school, buy clothes for her mother and also pay her examination fees for November. 

With the second Kiva loan she intends to expand her poultry business and buy more chickens to increase production. With this investment in her business, Sue’s profits will increase and she will be able to advance her education.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom at their home to improve access to sanitation and water.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is aged 50, married, and they're blessed with four children. She has managed a vegetable production business in their village for almost 25 years and earns a net income of PHP 3,000 weekly. Her net income from her business is usually spent on their daily expenses. 

Due to insufficient capital on her business, she would like to access a loan amounting to PHP 12,000 to  purchase vegetable seedlings and fertilizers to use in her vegetable production. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow productively.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable seedlings and fertilizers to use in her vegetable production.

loans.name: Procesa

texts.en:
Procesa is 62 years old, married and has four children to provide for. To earn a living she is engaged in a sari sari store business. She's been in the business for 12 years already and it really helps her family in providing for their family's daily needs. She aims for a better income so she decided to borrow a loan to buy more goods and items to sell to increase her store inventory to result in more sales that will generate greater income.

Procesa wants to save money for her children's educational needs in the future.

loans.use: to buy more goods and items to sell.

location.town: Doña Consuelo, Ozamiz City, Mis. Occ

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.en:
Anastacio, 48, is a hardworking farmer from Badian, Cebu. His farm is located on terrain that is not conducive to farming crops other than corn and cassava, but he perseveres.

Anastacio is asking for an 11,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner CEVI to buy seeds and fertilizer. He hopes that with fertilizer he will increase his future harvest. His resulting income will be used for food, savings and reinvestment in his farm.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en: Genelyn has always  dreamed of her own house for her children. She applied a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks for the construction of their house. Genelyn wants to maintain her membership in good standing and hopes to live in a comfortable home with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks

loans.name: Babee Joy

texts.en:
As a zealous member of CCT Credit Cooperative for almost eight years, Babee Joy gains inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who regularly meet once a week to study the Word of God and share stories of their life and business. She herself has also encouraged her group, her family, and her community in Santa Barbara, Iloilo by being a warm and inspiring colleague. 

Babee Joy is a loving wife to her husband Joemarie, a driver, and a caring mother to their four children. She gives all out support to her husband’s hard work by supplementing it with her own business. She has been raising pigs for four years now and she’s convinced that it’s a productive enterprise. Although there are problems like lack of water in their area and return of investment takes some time, she persists so as to add income for their daily needs and save some amount for their children’s education. Babee Joy and her husband hope to bestow a priceless inheritance to their children, which is education. 

As of now, Babee Joy needs additional capital to buy more piglets to raise including enough feeds and vitamins for them. She is requesting for a 13,000 PHP loan to address this need and she is knocking at your generous heart. You can be a great blessing to her through your kind assistance. Warm appreciation in advance.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more piglets, feeds, and vitamins

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Meet Leonida. She's undeniably a selfless and passion-driven mother. When talking about working hard for just raising her children, she's unstoppable. This is maybe the reason why her husband, Evangelista, loves her so much. 

Back then, Leonida wasn't able to reach the college phase of life. Today she's 46. But though she and her husband entered into having a family that early (mentioning that they now have four kids), they still remain persevering, knowing that someday they can also rise from an awful poverty. 

Leonida owns a small sari-sari store today (commonly known as a variety store). Here she sells different commodities such as toiletries, beverages, condiments and other grocery items. Customers are attracted to buy because of the low-cost price of the items. 

To further improve sales, she asks for your help. She wants to sustain her family needs and she envisions her business turning into a wholesale business. The realizations of these visions starts today as you let her borrow a loan of PHP 50,000. She will use this to buy more grocery stuffs to sell in her sari-sari store. 

She hopes that you will not ignore this. It means a lot to her if you respond to her prayer. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more grocery stuffs to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Mira

texts.en:
Mira is 41 years old and married with five children. Three of her children are attending school.

Mira works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Mira has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from fishing.

Mira aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Gina is 41 years old and has three children who are still in school.

Gina has a furniture making business in the Philippines. Gina requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials like wood, varnish, nails and to pay the salaries of the laborers in her furniture business.

Gina has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like wood, varnish, nails and to pay the salaries of the laborers.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 41 years old and married with two children.

Alma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a bicycle transport business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed.

Alma has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the bicycle transport for 4 years and also earns an income from fishing. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Alma aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials for her bicycle transport business.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is 64 years old, married, and has two children. One child is still in school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Juana has a bakery shop business in the Philippines. Juana requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, cooking oil, and other materials for her food production business.

Juana has been in this business for 16 years. 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es:
Francisco es un joven de 23 años de edad, su deseo de apoyar incondicionalmente a su madre y comprar una vivienda, tener sus comodidades lo llevaron a iniciar un negocio de ebanistería, el cual pudo consolidar gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre.

Inicio en el año 2007 aun siendo menor de edad, dando ejemplo a personas del barrio de como un joven con entusiasmo, sueños y humildad se convirtió en un empresario con ingresos que le permiten mantener su hogar y a su hijo de 4 años de edad.

Con el ánimo de aumentar su producción, tener mayor inventario que ofrecer a sus clientes Francisco quiere solicitar un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de materiales principalmente madera, compra de maquina cortadora y herramientas d emano que le permitirán agilizar y mejorar los tiempos de producción en su negocio.
texts.en:
Francisco, 23, started his own furniture-making business so that he can provide for his mother and buy his own house one day.  

Francisco learned carpentry from his father and started his own shop in 2007.  He was only a boy then, an example to the neighborhood of how to create a self-supporting business by building on a young man's dreams and enthusiasm.  He is an entrepreneur now with a business that supports him and his 4-year old son.  

Francisco wants to grow his business and is applying for a loan, part of which he will use to stock the wood he needs and the rest to buy a cutting machine and other equipment for carrying on his business.

loans.use: to purchase materials and equipment for his furniture-making business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom at their home to improve access to sanitation and water.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
30-year-old Juliet is married with two children and lives in Chikomba West District of Zimbabwe. 

She is an aspiring entrepreneur who buys and sells plastic products such as buckets, laundry baskets and cutlery racks. She also sells towels and clothing accessories such as shirts, skirts and shorts. Juliet is a businesswoman who is doing very well after receiving her first loan. With the profits she is earning from her business, she is now able to provide food and shelter, as well as pay for her family’s school and medical fees. She is also able to pay medical bills for herself and her family. 

Juliet managed to repay her loan promptly. Juliet is also into poultry business and is looking forward to getting a second loan so that she can further expand her poultry business. With the second loan, she wishes to purchase more chicks and chick feeds.
 
Thank you for supporting Juliet’s business!

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chick feeds

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is a 28-year-old single woman with a passion for improving her community of Chiredzi, Zimbabwe. Gladys actively assists the elderly and less privileged, as well as volunteers in schools teaching life skills education. To support herself, she has been running a business selling clothing such as jackets, shirts, shorts, skirts, jerseys, and trousers for the past three years. When Gladys received her $500 loan she invested it in her business and used the profits to purchase building materials to build her two-room house. She intends to expand her clothing business with the second loan. An increase in profits would make her desire to create employment in her community a reality.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes

loans.name: Loveness

texts.en:
Loveness is 23 years old and resides in Mbire District, Zimbabwe. Loveness actively supports the community clinic by volunteering as a janitor. Loveness also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide in schools, working to improve the well-being of students. 

In addition, Loveness owns a small stall at the local flea market where she sells products such as bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and t-shirts. She used much of her profit to reinvest into her business and partly supports her siblings as she is the sole breadwinner in the family. 

With the requested loan, she will purchase clothing items in bulk in order to cut costs for transport. The profit will be used for continued support to the family and expansion of the business.

loans.use: To purchase clothing items in bulk in order to cut costs for transport.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Silvia is a 33-year-old businesswoman and mother of two. She lives in the Chiredzi district of Zimbabwe, where she is a well-known volunteer who works to keep children in school. 

She used her $500 loan to boost her clothing business. With the $1,000 Kiva loan, Silvia will purchase more clothes to increase her merchandise selection and expand her business and profits. This will enable her to provide for her children’s needs as well as for herself. 

She hopes to someday grow the business and create employment in her community.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Muborakhon

texts.ru: Муборакхон из района Чиликул. В Чиликуле хорошая погода и свежий воздух для развития сельскохозяйственной деятельностью. Жители района трудолюбивые и ответственные люди.
