Они ни смотря, ни на, что трудятся на земле и скотном дворе. Можно сказать, что Муборакхон одна из них. Муборакхон занимается земледелием. Она выращивает хлопок уже 7 лет. Муборакхон еще занимается торговлей деятельностью в свободное время. Она продает масло для приготовления пищи.  Муборакхон любить зарабатывать честным нажитым трудом, и поэтому она много времени проводят на земле. Она на половине землю посадила помидоры и кукуруза. На половине оставшаяся  часть землю Муборакхон посадила хлопок.  Для сбора хлопок осталось мало времени, и Муборакхону надо обработать хлопок минеральными удобрениями, чтобы собрать качественный и хороший хлопок. Муборакхон надеется, что финансирование поможет ей  приобрести минеральные удобрения.
texts.en:
Muborakhon is from the Jilikul area. In Jilikul, there is good weather and fresh air for the development of agricultural activities. 

The residents of the area are hardworking and responsible people. They toil on the fields and farm-yard no matter what. One can say that Muborakhon is one of them. 

Muborakhon is engaged in agriculture. She has been growing cotton for seven years. Muborakhon also engages in trade in her spare time. She sells cooking oil. 

Muborakhon loves to support herself through honest acquired work, thus she spends a lot of time on the fields. She has planted tomatoes and corn on one half of the fields. On the remaining half, Muborakhon has planted cotton. 

There is little time left for harvesting the cotton, and Muborakhon needs to go over the cotton with mineral fertilisers in order to harvest high-quality and good cotton. Muborakhon hopes that the financing will help her to obtain mineral fertilisers.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilisers.

loans.name: Marjul Carmen

texts.en:
Marjul is a 25 years old, married and have two children. To earn for living she engaged in a buy & sell business of cosmetics. To improve her living she needs to increase her income. So she decided to availed a loan at GDMPC to buy more stocks of cosmetics for sell and be able to increase her store inventory that can generate more income.

Marjul plan for the future to expand her business out from her income.

loans.use: To buy more stocks for selling in her store.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is 55 years old, married and has two children.

Ligaya is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ligaya has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Annaliza works hard to support her family.

She has a repair shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Annaliza is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy new tools and equipment for her repair shop business.

Annaliza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her repair shop.

loans.name: Celmira Del Carmen

texts.es:
Celmira, en su humilde hogar, intenta ganarse la vida ofreciendo el servicio de hospedaje en el municipio de Sincelejo. Tiene una casa grande con varias habitaciones las cuales utiliza para arrendarlas a turistas y visitantes del municipio.

Es madre de 6 hijos por quienes dio gran parte de su vida para levantarlos y verlos crecer.

Con esta actividad ha sobrevivido durante 3 años, y a pesar de los pocos ingresos y lo difícil de su vida, nunca abandona su alegría y gran sonrisa.

Solicita un apoyo económico para realizar algunas reformas locativas en una de las habitaciones de su hotel; de esta forma podrá ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Este préstamo le dará la oportunidad de mejorar su negocio y de progresar como empresaria.
texts.en:
Celmira has made a living renting rooms in her house in Sincelejo for 3 years.  Her house is modest, but large and she has several bedrooms that she rents to both locals and tourists.  

Celmira has 6 children and has spent most of her life raising them and seeing to their every need.  Even though she barely scrapes by and despite the many challenges she has faced over the years, she has never stopped smiling.

Celmira is applying for a loan that she will use to renovate one of the rooms she rents.  The investment will allow her to provide a better service to her guests and continue growing as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: to renovate one of the rooms she rents.

loans.name: Margareth

texts.en:
Margareth is 25 years old and lives in the Chikomba West District in Zimbabwe. She is married and is a mother of one. She is a committed volunteer in her community, actively helping to keep children in school. 

Margareth is currently running a poultry business. On average, she produces about 150 birds every six weeks and sells them to the community. Margaret is very proud of the business and would love to expand it.  

With the second Kiva loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase more chick feed and broiler chicks to increase her production and boost sales. Improving her business will help her to increase profits to pay school fees for her child. 

Margareth has gained respect and is a pillar of hope in the family and in the community because of her poultry business. She successfully made her loan repayments and is now providing the community with readily available meat.  

She desires to get a second loan to expand her poultry project. She also plans to build a very big fowl run to accommodate more chickens with different batches.

Thank you for supporting Margareth’s Kiva loan!

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chick feeds

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
Melody is a 31-year-old single woman living in Wedza, Zimbabwe. She trains young women in life skills education, leadership and entrepreneurship and is well-known in her community for her work in women’s empowerment. 

She used a first $500 loan from Kiva to invest in a mobile phone airtime business and successfully repaid this last year. 

Melody would now like to take a further loan, to establish a soya and maize farming business. The profits from the business will be used pay for college fees for her two siblings.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs such as fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Borrowing And Repayment Group

texts.en:
Mrs Giang is 45 years old and she is married. Giang lives in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years. For more income, she opened a store selling fruit. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover, the market need is low in this region. 


The main hardship that Giang faces is a lack of capital. She has no collateral so she can't get a loan from other banks or credit institutions. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to sell, then expand her business.

In 2015, Giang joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Giang has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

With her business profit, Giang hopes for her business to do well, her family will be healthy. She also hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to sell

loans.name: 22 - Tây Ga - Phú Sơn1- Repay Timely Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hương is 38 years old and she is married. She has had a retail business selling shoes for more than 10 years.

Hương lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region. 

The main hardship that Hương faces is lack of capital to do business and pay school tuition fees for her children.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more shoes to resell.

This is Hương's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. With her business profit, Hương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and to repair her house because the one her family is living in is a small and cramped house.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes to resell

loans.name: Alamid

texts.en:
Alamid is a resident of Badian, Cebu. He drives his motorcycle and offers transport service to the locals as his way of earning an income. In addition to this, he also raises hogs for more income. He is requesting a loan from CEVI to buy more piglets to raise and quality feed to fatten them. 

Alamid works hard in order to provide for his baby girl who is one year old. He hopes to make his business more successful so he can send his daughter to school someday.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en:
Gleceria is a 64 years old, widowed, and has six children to provide for. As a single parent, she wants to provide her children a good living, so she engages in a dressmaking/tailoring business. She sews dresses for customers and caters to their specific tastes and needs.   She aims to increase her income so that she can provide her family's daily needs. Recently, she requested a loan to buy more cloth and materials to make more dresses and increase sales and income.

In the future, Gleceria plans to save money from her business income.

loans.use: to buy more clothing and materials for her dressmaking business

loans.name: Yolanda De Jesus

texts.es:
Yolanda es una madre cabeza de familia, una mujer humilde que se dedica a ejercer sus labores como ama de casa, tiene tres hijos y genera ingreso gracias a la venta de mercancía por catálogo.

Sus buenos resultados, la mejora en la calidad de vida, la oportunidad de tener empleo hacen que Yolanda se ilusione y busque potenciar y consolidar su negocio, por ello pide a ustedes comunidad Kiva que la apoyen, que le ayuden a crecer en su empresa, con un préstamo para la compra de una vitrina y mercancía como lo es lociones, ropa, accesorios, con la vitrina tendrá aun almacén ubicado en su hogar con mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Yolanda has three children and is head of her small family.  She operates a business buying merchandise from catalogs and reselling what she buys to her customers.  The business is successful and her earnings from the business have provided her with a means to make a living and improve her family's quality of life.  

Yolanda sees potential for growing her business and asks that the Kiva community support her efforts to improve it.  She is applying for a loan that she will to buy a display case and stock the merchandise that she needs--lotions, clothing, accessories--to carry on the business.  The investment will allow her to sell more easily from home and generate a larger income.

loans.use: to stock her retail business and buy a display case for her merchandise.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is 47 years old, married, and has eleven children, five of which are in school.

Lanie is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Lanie requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lanie has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lanie would like to save enough money to expand her business, and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Osmainer

texts.es:
Osmainer es un hombre muy trabajador y muy organizado, se gana la vida prestando el servicio de transporte de personas en su motocicleta a través de las veredas del municipio de Valdivia, posibilitando así el desplazamiento de la comunidad hasta las distintitas áreas del municipio.

Es un hombre amable, servicial y muy emprendedor, es soltero y sostiene a su madre a la cual siempre ha procurado ofrecerle la mejor vida posible.

Solicita un préstamo con la Corporación Interactuar para comprar un moto-carro, el cual le permitirá prestar un mejor servicio de transporte.

Con este crédito podrá aumentar la capacidad de pasajeros que moviliza diariamente.

Apoya a Osmainer con un préstamo hoy!
texts.en:
Osmainer is a very hard-working and organized man.  He earns his living providing transportation services on his motorcycle through the streets of the city of Valdivia, allowing the transport of the community members to the different parts of the city.

He is a kind, serving, and very enterprising man.  He is single and provides for his mother who has always offered him the best life possible.

He is requesting a loan with Interactuar to purchase a moto-taxi, which will allow him to provide better transportation services.  With this loan, he will be able to increase the capacity of passengers that he moves daily.

Support Osmainer with a loan today!

loans.use: to purchase a moto-taxi, which would allow him provide a better transportation service.

loans.name: Adelia

texts.en:
A $600 loan is offered to Adelia to improve her business. She has a business where many people come to buy every day. She will buy a buffalo. She has been involved in business activities since 2010. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Adelia independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo

loans.name: Falemalu

texts.en:
Falemalu is 38 years old and married with four children. She lives in a rural village on the island of Savaii in Samoa. Falemalu owns and operates a small general store in her village. She has been running her business for three years now, and sells a variety of products including flour, canned goods, toiletries, frozen goods, and soft drinks.

Falemalu became a microloan borrower with South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2008 and has successfully borrowed and repaid seven loans. With her first loan of about US $250, Falemalu started a small taro and banana chips business. Based on her successful history, Falemalu became eligible for a small business loan. She wishes to use this loan to buy a cooler, freezer, sacks of flour, sugar, rice, boxes of tinned fish, etc..

In the future, Falemalu hopes to improve her business by investing in a coffee maker so she can serve coffee to people on the go.

loans.use: to buy a cooler, freezer, sacks of flour, sugar, rice, boxes of tinned fish, etc.

loans.name: Delbert

texts.en:
Alex lives in Siquijor, Philippines, and he supports his children by building houses from the ground up. 

Alex has applied and successfully repaid a loan, which he used to to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks.  

Alex wants his children to get an education and escape the life of backbreaking work he has had to endure.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fresh fish

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia is 54 years old. She is married and lives with her family in Alegria, Cebu. Virgilia started her sari-sari (variety) store business five years ago, where she sells items like canned goods, noodles, eggs, soy sauce, cooking oil, shampoo, conditioner, coffee, sugar and milk. 

She would like to expand her business to buy more stock that sells the most and on a daily basis. She will use the loan to buy items like shampoo, coffee, vinegar, biscuits, detergent, milk, sugar, cooking oil and soy sauce. 

In the future, she hope to see all her children graduate from college and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, coffee, vinegar, biscuits, detergent, milk, sugar, cooking oil and soy sauce

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is grateful that she was granted a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more quantities of coffee and herbal products to expand her product inventory. Through her earnings, she has been able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

Norma is now requesting a 40,000 PHP loan to buy natural food supplements in the form of coffee and herbal products as multivitamins to meet the increasing demand of her products. She is happy with the result of her sales and is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and for the financial assistance that will be given to her. Her loan will surely help cover her family’s everyday personal and household needs.

Norma only dreams to expand her business so that all her children can go to college. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and also draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

 * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for an additional stock of coffee and herbal products needed in her business.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: La señora  Esperanza se encuentra separada de su ex pareja por violencia familiar que vino soportando por varios años, la señora tiene casa propia gracias a su esfuerzo personal, actualmente vive con sus dos hijos que asisten al colegio y al igual que su madre se esfuerzan por un mañana mejor, la señora se dedica a la venta de mantas para cholitas de la ciudad, comenzó dicha actividad hace cuatro años el día de hoy cuenta con un puesto de venta en un lugar estratégico de la ciudad, con una afluencia de personas bastante alta haciendo esto que sus ventas sean efectivas, la señora necesita el dinero para  la compra de mercadería (mantas) para ofrecer estos productos a sus clientes e incrementar su nivel de ventas, de esta manera  mejorará sus ingresos y podrá darles un mañana mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Esperanza separated from her ex because of the domestic violence she endured for several years. Thanks to her own efforts, she now has her own home and lives with her two children, who are in school. Just like their mother, they are working  hard for a better tomorrow.

Esperanza works selling traditional shawls and blankets to the local women. She started her business four years ago, and today she has a stand in a strategic location in the city where there is quite a bit of foot traffic. This helps her make effective sales.

She needs this money to buy merchandise like traditional shawls and blankets so that she can offer them to her customers and increase her sales. This will allow her to improve her income so that her children can have a better future.

loans.use: to buy blankets and shawls.

loans.name: Abegael

texts.en:
Abegael is 28 years old and single.

She runs an agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Abegael is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies to raise her pig.

Abegael has been in this business for two years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is married and has two children. Leticia works hard to support her family, and has a buy and sell fruits business in the Philippines.

Leticia requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more fruit to sell like mangos, bananas, apples, oranges, watermelon, and other fruits to sell.

Leticia has been in this business for 7 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 53 years old, a widow, and has three children, one child is in school.

Virginia is in the agricultural business raising poultry in the Philippines. Virginia requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her poultry.

Virginia has been raising poultry for seven years now, and has borrowed several times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her poultry

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife works hard to support her family. She is married with four children and has a buy-and-sell dry goods business in the Philippines.

Marife requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more products of dry goods to sell in her stall.

Marife has been in this business for six years now, and also earns additional income from food vending.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more products of dry goods to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is 44 years old and married with two children.

Rhoda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, bread, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, sugar, eggs and other personal care products.

Rhoda has borrowed and paid back one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 13 years and also earns an income from fish vending and pig fattening.

Rhoda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, bread, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, sugar, eggs and other personal care products

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 40 years old and married with four children.

Elma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, bread, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, sugar, eggs and other personal care products.

Elma has borrowed and paid back two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from farming vegetables and pig fattening.

Elma aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, bread, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, sugar, eggs and other personal care products

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 33-years old, married, and has one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Chona has a fishing business in the Philippines. Chona requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish nets, bamboo, gasoline, and other materials for her business.

Chona has been in this business for 6 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish nets, bamboo, gasoline, and other materials for her business

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is 27 years old, married, and has two children. Both her children are in school.

Brenda is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Brenda requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Brenda has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Brenda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Mayflor

texts.en:
Mayflor is 41 years old, married, and has five children. All her children are currently in school.

Mayflor is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Mayflor requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Mayflor has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines, and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
A single mother of three, Grace runs and maintains a mobile money transfer business in the Eastern province of Zambia. She hopes to keep growing her mobile money transfer business for her children so that she can be able to provide a better education and life for them. After using loans through Kiva to boost her business and earn more profits, Grace managed to get her three children from her mother and now lives with them. This makes her happy.

Today, Grace has fully repaid her two previous loans from Kiva. She has a total number of eight mobile money transfer outlets and employs 10 people throughout her network within the eastern province of Zambia. She spends her days moving around from one outlet to the next to insure that the customers are being served and her employees are happy. Grace mainly employs people straight out of high school trying to raise money for college. She explains that this is important to her as she understands the importance of a good education. 

Grace is requesting her third loan in order for her to open an additional outlet. She has identified a spot in Kuita, a market where people still do not have access to good financial services. With this loan, Grace will be able to purchase a big trading kiosk, and have the float needed to run the outlet successfully. She says the new location is at a busy market and since there is no much competition, she anticipates that the location is going to be profitable within a short period of time.

Grace would like to thank the Kiva lenders for their support. The Kiva loans changed her life and she is now with her children and doing work that she loves.

loans.use: to to open an additional outlet in Kuita market so that she can grow her business

loans.name: Sergio Erick

texts.en:
Sergio Erick is a Mexican farmer who dedicates himself to raising hogs and cultivating corn on the large field surrounding his farm. He used to pile the untreated raw manure of his hogs outside of his farm, where it was contaminating water sources and emitting greenhouse gases. In the meantime, he was purchasing large quantities of chemical fertilizer for his field, while cooking with wood and using fossil fuel-based LP gas to meet his other energy needs.

By investing in a large Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, Sergio will be able to transform all his hogs' manure into renewable energy (biogas) and organic fertilizer. Not only will he treat the manure, protect the environment and eliminate bad smells, but he will effectively displace wood fuel, LP gas, and chemical fertilizers. In addition to saving money, this investment will allow him to increase the yield of his cornfield in a natural way, nourishing the soil in the long term. He looks forward to becoming more sustainable and cost-effective, taking full advantage of the resources available on his farm.

This loan represents 20% of the full cost of the biodigester. The remaining part is being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to invest in a 40 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Familiar

texts.en:
Familiar is a 25-year-old businesswoman. She is married and has one child, and she currently lives in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. 

Familiar is a Camfed Learner Guide volunteer at the nearby school, and she teaches young students necessary leadership skills. 

She repaid well her $500 loan, and she intends to use her $1,000 loan to purchase more chicks. 

Over the past year, she has grown her poultry business to its current level to increase her sales volume and become a supplier to major supermarkets. She will use the Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. 

Familiar hopes to provide for herself and remain financially independent.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a 24-year-old mother of two living in Mbire District, Zimbabwe. She is an active volunteer for the Cama network, Camfed’s alumnae organization. As a member of Cama, she provides counseling services to young people facing challenges in her community. 

Rosemary operates a grocery shop for which she received a loan of $500 last year. The loan helped her to expand but not to the capacity she was hoping for. She will use this second loan to further expand her business by increasing the amount of cooking supplies she has available. 

Rosemary hopes to grow the business and increase its profitability to better provide for her family’s needs and the needs of vulnerable children in the community.

loans.use: to expand her business by increasing the amount of cooking supplies she has available.

loans.name: Gloria Group

texts.es:
Fanny continúa con su actividad de venta de empanadas tradicionales.
El préstamo que obtuvo lo invirtió en la compra de muebles para su negocio, como; mesas y sillas. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque realizó una buena inversión y no tuvo ningún problema (la segunda de la izquierda, viste blusa negra a rayas horizontales). Actualmente su negocio cuanta con ventas diarias y continuas, “ya finalizamos el primer ciclo, y continúo ampliando mi negocio, se cubre una necesidad y aparece otra…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas continuas, la desventaja es la falta de insumos de cocina, como harina, aceite. Huevo, carne, etc., su sueño es continuar mejorando su negocio para el bienestar de su familia, ella desea realizar la compra de insumos de cocina para abastecer su negocio y continuar trabajando. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Fanny solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de cocina para abastecer su negocio y continuar trabajando.para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Fanny is carrying on her restaurant business.  She used a previous loan to buy tables, chairs and other furniture that she needed and the investment paid off.  She repaid the loan easily and in the agreed-upon time.

Fanny--second from the left in the photo, wearing a striped black blouse--says that her business is growing: "The first round of funding is now complete and my business is growing, but as soon as we finish paying for one thing we need something else pops up . . . ".  Fanny can count on steady sales, but lacks the funding that she needs to buy flour, cooking oil, eggs, and the other supplies that she needs.  This loan will be her second loan from us in the 5 years that she has operated her restaurant. 

Fanny will use the loan to stock the supplies she needs.  The investment will allow her to carry on her business and continue working for the good of her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Janet Cecilia

texts.es:
Janet Cecilia tiene 23 años de edad, madre soltera, vive en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Janet Cecilia tiene su bodega en la cual vende productos de primera nesecidad, hace 05 años, negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio; goza de buenas referencias personales y laborales. Solicita el préstamo para invertir en capital de trabajo; compra de arroz, azucar, fideo, aceite, etc, esto le servira para tener mayor variedad de productos de primera nesecidad esto con la finalidad de poder satifacer los gustos de sus clientes y asi poder incrementar sus ventas, y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Janet Cecilia is 23 years old and is a single mother. She lives in the district of Oyotún, a community where people mostly work in agriculture and retail. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque region of Peru's northern coast.

For the past five years, Janet Cecilia has been running a grocery store where she sells basic products. Her business is located in her home. She has good personal and work references. She is requesting this loan to invest in working capital: She will buy rice, pasta, oil, etc. This will allow her to have a wider variety of basic staples and have more of what her customers want. This in turn will increase her sales and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to stock up on groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed, supplements and additional piglets

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is 46 years old, married, and has five children. Four of her children are in school. 

Emma is a very hard working entrepreneur.  She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. 

Erma requested a 7,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Erma has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, Erma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

Ethyl has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

Rizalie has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:

She has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Anita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables like eggplant, cabbage, beans, squash and other vegetables to sell.

Anita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables like eggplant, cabbage, beans, squash and other vegetables to sell.

Phoobel Adnel has been in this business for five years.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, bread, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, sugar, eggs and other personal care products

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and this man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.name: Argemiro

texts.es: Él es Argemiro es un hombre de 60 años de edad que trabaja diariamente 10 horas en un negocio de carpintería, persona humilde, comprometida y honrada que hoy pide tu ayuda para crecer, mejorar sus ingresos, y esa ayuda tú te la puedes dar prestándole un capital que l e permitirá a Argemiro comprar la materia prima la cual es Madera, la razón del préstamo es que su actividad ha ido en ascenso, tiene un mayor número de clientes y necesita la madera para cumplir con unos pedidos que significaran unos excelentes ingresos, Argemiro no tiene hijos solo a su señora y su negocio, es una persona que negaron la ayuda, pero gracias a interactuar junto con su aliado Kiva encontró un si, un sí te apoyo.
texts.en:
Argemiro is sixty years old and works ten hours a day at a carpenters' shop. He is a humble, committed, and honest person who is currently asking for help in order to grow and improve his income. This loan will allow Argemiro to buy supplies like wood. His business is growing, his customer base is larger, and he needs enough wood to complete some pending projects that will earn him an excellent profit. 

Argemiro doesn't have any children, just his wife and his business. He has always been denied financial support, but thanks to Interactuar and its Kiva partners he has found the support he needed.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Nurgiza

texts.ru: Нургиза, 29 лет, она замужем и воспитывает 3 детей. Занимается сельским хозяйством и торговлей продуктами питания в магазине около дома. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Нургизы имеется: 2 коровы, 10 овец, лошадь, также имеется 0,16 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает многолетние травы для покоса и заготовки в качестве корма для скота. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет 27,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нургиза обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 140,000 сом (KGS) для закупа 5 телят для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Нургиза планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса и постройку сараев для скота.
texts.en: Nurgiza is 29, married, and raising three children. She is a farmer and sells grocery products in a store near her house. Nurgiza currently has two cows, ten sheep, a horse, and a 0.16 hectare plot of land where she grows perennial grasses to mow and harvest as feed for livestock. Her monthly gross income is 27,000 som (KGS). In order to develop her farm, Nurgiza applied for a loan of 140,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to buy five calves to fatten and sell. Nurgiza plans to use the earnings from the loan to invest in the further development of her business and to build barns for livestock.

loans.use: to buy five calves to fatten and resell

loans.name: Toktokan

texts.ru: Токтокан, 54 года, замужем, есть 5 детей. У Токтокан среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается полеводством и животноводством, благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Токтокан, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 6 коров, 15 овец и лошадь, также земельный надел мерою 1,24 ГА, где она выращивает ячмень. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 19,000 сом (KGS). Токтокан обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 110,000 сом (KGS) для закупки скота для увеличения поголовья. Токтокан намерена улучшить благосостояние своей семьи и доходы от кредита направлять на развитие бизнеса и пристройку времянки к дому.
texts.en:
Toktokan is 54 and married with five children. She has a high school education and works in agriculture and animal husbandry as the primary source of income for her family. Thanks to her hard work and purposefulness she currently has six cows, 15 sheep and a horse on her farm as well as 1.24 hectares of land where she grows barley. Her monthly income is about 19,000 KGS.

Toktokan has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 110,000 KGS to purchase livestock to increase her head count. She intends to improve her family's living conditions and will put profits from the loan toward further developing her business and putting a temporary extension on her home.

loans.use: to purchase livestock in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Carlos Jose

texts.es:
Cansado de buscar empleo un día cualquiera del año 2007 Carlos tomo al decisión de montar un negocio de mecánica, apoyándose de la experiencia que obtuvo en trabajos similares, gracias a esa osadía encontró algo maravilloso, un medio de ingreso de dinero sostenible en el tiempo que ha sido fundamental para la mejora de calidad de vida de sus familia en los últimos 8 años.

Hoy Carlos se encuentra solicitando tu ayuda, la razón es que necesita comprar con urgencia un gato hidráulico para el levantamiento de carros, el que tenia se le daño y no tiene arreglo y al ser una herramienta tan indispensable necesita comprarla con inmediatez.

El préstamo ayudar a Carlos a comprar una herramienta principal y así seguir generando estabilidad económica, calidad de vida y progreso a su hogar en donde lo esperan su pareja y sus dos hijos menores de edad.
texts.en:
Tired of looking for work one day in 2007, Carlos decided to open his own mechanics shop.  Supporting himself through the experience that he had gained from similar jobs, and thanks to the struggle, he found something marvelous -- a means of sustainable income that has been the foundation for improving the quality of life for his family over the past 8 years. 

Today Carlos finds himself requesting your help.  He needs a loan in order to buy a hydraulic lift used to raise cars, and he needs it urgently. The one he had was damaged and he cannot fix it.  Because it is such an indispensable tool he needs to purchase one immediately. 

Carlos will use his loan to buy this key tool and thus be able to generate stable income, have a good quality of life, and progress with his family, which includes his wife and his two young children.

loans.use: to buy a hydraulic lift.

loans.name: Meldy

texts.en:
Meldy is a 33-year-old married woman with three children, who are all in school.. She is a very hard working entrepreneur with a food production/vending business in the Philippines. Meldy requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her business.

Meldy has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Teresa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Con la comercialización de ropa, Teresa ha podido construir una vida junto a sus ocho hijos.

Esta actividad viene ejerciéndola hace aproximadamente 1 año y la aprendió a través del trabajo y conocimiento empírico en ventas.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa para surtir su inventario y aumentar su capital de trabajo, pues con este negocio es que pagara la educación de sus hijos y mejorara su vivienda.

Apoya a Teresa para que su hogar prospere!
texts.en:
By selling clothing, Teresa has been able to build a life together with her eight children. She has been performing this job for approximately one year, and she learned it through work and a general knowledge of sales.

She is requesting a loan to buy clothing to supply her inventory and increase her working capital. With this business she will pay for the education of her children, and she will improve her home.

Support Teresa so her home can prosper.

loans.use: to buy clothing to supply her inventory and increase her working capital.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 44 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Arlene requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Arlene has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 43 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Emma has been in this business for 10 years now and has borrowed from NWTF twice in the past to sustain it. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en:
Rodelyn is a 28-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Rodelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell.

Rodelyn has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 38 years old and married with five children. With four children in school, Maria works very hard to provide for them. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested this new loan to further build her business.

Maria has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is a 48-year-old married woman with five children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines. Salvacion requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her nipa roofing.

Salvacion has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her nipa roofing.

loans.name: Saidah's Group

texts.en:
Saidah's group is comprised of 2 hard working women. Saidah is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past 5 years, Saidah has been working hard to manage her restaurant business, which deals in cooked food and soft drinks. 

To help expand her business, Saidah has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy food items, saucepans, and plates, and will help Saidah to generate greater profits and increase demand. 

Saidah hopes that in the future she will be able to become a better employer.

Saidah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy food items, saucepans, and plates for her business.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is a 33-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. Janice requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other fishing supplies.

Janice has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Norberta

texts.en:
Norberta is a 50-year-old married mother of three children, one in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Norberta has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Norberta requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more rice to sell.

Norberta has been in this business for two years. In the future, Norberta would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: Teoni

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Teoni works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from fish vending. Teoni is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies for her fishing business.

Teoni has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
Anabel is a 32-year-old married mother of two children, one in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Anabel has a general store business in the Philippines. Anabel requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Anabel has been in this business for two years. In the future, Anabel would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rhea

texts.en:
Rhea is a 34-year-old married mother of seven children, five in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Rhea has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines. Rhea requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy nipa leaves, bamboo and other supplies for her business.

Rhea has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Rhea would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy nipa leaves, bamboo stick, and other supplies or her business

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is 49 years old and is married with five children, three of whom are in school. 

Adela is in the agricultural business. She farms vegetables in the Philippines. Adela has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Adela has been in this business for 21 years now. She has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She successfully repaid her previous loans and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

In the future, Adela would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
His name is Emmanuel, 51, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Lallaine, a tutor, and they have a son who is taking up architecture in college. The couple work hard to provide for their family’s daily personal and household needs and to fund their son's education.

Emmanuel operates a convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. He earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. 

His store is located adjacent to his house. Emmanuel has a charming personality that people prefer to buy at his store. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every day. 

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan which he will use to buy grocery items such adult and infants milk, brad, cookies, chips, frozen meat, beverages, and toiletries to sell.  He is positive this will boost his income as he expands his business. He is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given him.  His earning will definitely help cover their daily sustenance and assist their son's college education.

Emmanuel aims to grow his business to give his family a better life. He looks forward to seeing his son become a licensed architect. He faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages, and toiletries to sell at his convenience store.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a mother of four children at the aged of 50. She wants to earn a living and be able to help her husband as a private employee in providing for her children's needs, so she engaged in the rice production business to earn income. 

She aims to increase her family income and improve their family living. Recently, she took a loan to purchase fertilizer for the rice farm to produce good quality of rice and to be able to deliver rice to the market to have more sales and generate a better income.

Susan wants to expand her business to change her family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for the rice farm.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 38 years old and married with three children.

Arlene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread and personal care products.

Arlene has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Arlene aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread and personal care products

loans.name: Cecil

texts.en:
Cecil is 42 years old and married with five children.

She runs an agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines, and is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Cecil has been in this business for five years and also earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a 48-year-old married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Alma requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

Alma has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Ediltrudes

texts.en:
Ediltrudes is 49 years old and married with seven children. With two of her children in school, Ediltrudes works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, like eggs, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Ediltrudes has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like eggs, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Clarissa

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Clarissa works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell bananas business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and pig raising. 

Clarissa is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional bananas to sell in her food stall.

Clarissa has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional bananas to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is 52 years old and married with two children.

Ellen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil and other groceries.

Ellen has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending.

Ellen aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil and other groceries.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en:
Modesta is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Modesta has a business farming fruits in the Philippines. Modesta requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested this loan to further build her businesses.

Modesta has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Modesta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 43-year-old married mother of six children, one in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Evelyn has a general store business in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 9,500 loan NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Evelyn has been in this business for three years. In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a 48-year-old married mother of four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Eva has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines. Eva requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell in the market.

Eva has been in this business for 14 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell in the market

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es: Valentina es una morena de 40 años de edad, una persona trabajadora felizmente casada  y madre de tres hijas, dos de ellas adolescente y una menor de edad, inicio hace poco con un negocio de tienda de productos de la canasta familiar, la razón es que quiere mejorar las condiciones de vivienda y apoyar los estudios de sus hijas, quiere que se conviertan en las primeras universitarias de su familia y tengan un futuro prometedor, por ello está tan empeñada en hacer crecer su negocio y hoy solicita un apoyo tuyo para crecer como negocio, en pocas palabras necesita un préstamo para la compra de productos como lo son granos, víveres, compra de productos congelados como lo son presas de pollos, productos embutidos que serán un plus muy importante en su negocio y le permitirá captar la atención de más clientes.
texts.en:
Valentina, age 40, has a dark complexion.  She is a hard-working person.  She is happily married and has three daughters.  Two of them are adolescents, and one is younger.  A little while ago she started a business, a store selling basic needs products.  The reason she did so is that she wants to improve the condition of her house and to support her daughters’ education.  She wants them to become the first in her family to attend the university, and she wants them to have a promising future.  

That is why she is so engaged in making her business grow.  She is now requesting your support to grow as a business.  In a few words, she needs a loan to buy products like grains, supplies, frozen products like chicken pieces, and sausage products that will be a very important addition to her business.  It will allow her to capture the attention of more customers.

loans.use: to buy frozen products like chicken pieces and sausage products

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Etant une femme mariée, Ama vit à Adidogomé avec un enfant à sa charge. Agée de 49 ans, Ama est une commerçante de petits poissons fumés dans son quartier et satisfait agréablement ses clients. Ama trouve son revenu à travers ce commerce et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché de Lomé. Pour commander des paniers de poissons, Ama sollicite ce microcrédit pour réaliser son achat afin d’avoir le bénéfice qui pourrait soutenir son mari à favoriser l’éducation de son enfant.
texts.en: Ama is a married woman who lives in Adidogomé with one child in her care. Ama is 49 years old and sells small smoked fish in her neighborhood, pleasantly meeting her customers' needs. Ama's income comes from this business, and she gets her supplies twice per month at the market in Lomé. To order baskets of fish, Ama is seeking this microloan in order to make her purchase and generate the profit that could support her husband in promoting the education of her child.

loans.use: To purchase nine baskets of fish.

loans.name: Rose

texts.fr: Rose est une femme mariée âgée de 32 ans et mère de six enfants. Rose vit à Adidogomé pour entreprendre son activité. Rose vend des produits d’alimentations générales pour gagner sa vie et aider sa famille. Rose s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Rose demande ce nouveau crédit pour acheter des sacs de riz et des bidons d’huile afin de réaliser des bénéfices pour soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en: Rose is a 32 year old married woman and the mother of six children. She lives in Adidogomé to run her business. Rose sells general foodstuffs in order to earn her living and help her family. She gets her supplies twice per month at the market. Rose is asking for this new loan to purchase sacks of rice and containers of oil in order to generate profits to help her husband with the family expenses and allow her children to get a good education.

loans.use: To purchase two sacks of rice and three containers of oil.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en: Farida was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1985. She is living in a village with her parents. She is in the business of buying and selling livestock. She likes her business and takes good care of her livestock. She wants to widen her business and is planning to buy additional livestock. She appealed to IMON, asking for financial support to buy livestock. She hopes to expand her business and earn money to help her parents. She awaits Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Didith

texts.en:
Didith is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who is 58 years old and has three children in school.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

Didith has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Adzo

texts.fr: A 28 ans, Adzo est une femme mariée et avec ses trois enfants, elle vit dans le quartier d’Adidogomé. Adzo est une marchande de chaussures pour femme qui se promène dans les rues de son quartier afin de bien vendre. Adzo s’approvisionne deux fois par mois dans un marché local. Adzo réalise une très bonne rentabilité dans son commerce. Adzo nécessite ce crédit pour acheter des chaussures afin de gagner du bénéfice et venir en aide à l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en: Adzo is a 28-year-old married woman with three children; she lives in the neighborhood of Adidogomé. Adzo is a women's shoes merchant who walks along the streets of her neighborhood in order to sell [her shoes] successfully. Adzo gets her supplies twice per month from a local market. Her business is very profitable. Adzo needs this loan to purchase shoes in order to earn a profit and help with her children's academic education.

loans.use: To purchase 27 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Sath

texts.en:
Sath is 45 years old and married. She is a rice farmer with five children in her care and she resides in the Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice for over 27 years. Her husband is also a 47-year-old rice farmer, and her two children are working in a factory and three of her children attend school. Together, they can make around 18 USD per day. 

Now Sath would like to buy lumber and zinc sheets to build a kitchen, but she is short of the money, so she has decided to take out a loan. With this loan, she will have enough money to build a kitchen. For her future, Sath wants to buy more farmland, renovate a proper house and support her children to go through higher education.

loans.use: to buy lumber and zinc sheets to build a kitchen

loans.name: Delsy Yomar

texts.es: La señora Delsy es soltera, vive  en la ciudad de Santa Cruz  de la Sierra en casa de sus padres.La señora es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora que tiene dos actividades, en el día trabaja en una empresa de helados como auxiliar de ventas y en la noche prepara  comida para vender afuera de su domicilio, ofrece platos como ser pollo a la parrilla, milanezas entre otros, todo esto para sacar adelante a sus cuatro hijos, menores de 12 años ya que ella es padre y madre para ellos. El  negocio de la Sra. Delsy se encuentra en crecimiento, ella solicita un crédito para comprar un refrigerador grande y otros enseres para su negocio y así satisfacer la demanda e incrementar sus ventas, para tener mayores ingresos y ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Delsy is single, and she lives in the city of Santa Cruz de la Sierra in her parents’ house. She is an enterprising and hard-working person who has two business activities.  In the daytime she works for an ice cream company as a sales assistant.  In the evening she prepares food to sell outside her house.  She offers dishes like grilled chicken and breaded cutlets, among others.

Delsy’s business is growing.  She is requesting a loan to buy a big refrigerator and other goods for her business.  This way she will satisfy the demand and increase her sales.  She will do this in order to have greater earnings and to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a big refrigerator and other goods for her business to meet the demand and increase her sales.

loans.name: Hom's Group

texts.en:
Hom, 49, lives in a rural village of Kampong Thom province’s Stoung district, Cambodia. She is married and has four children. For the last 31 years, Hom has been working as a rice farmer while her husband is a paid worker. Together, they can earn about 20,000KHR per day. 

Hom has never been with VisionFund before. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Hom will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. This loan will enable her to earn more crops from her rice farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator in order to sell ice and cream.

loans.name: Cindi Bibiana

texts.es:
Cindi, a sus 25 años de edad, es casada y madre de 1 hijo, al que ha sacado adelante con arduo esfuerzo y dedicación. 

Durante mucho tiempo ha trabajado como comerciante independiente en su propio almacén de ropa; allí trabaja todos los días durante 10 horas y ha logrado generar los ingresos para solventar las necesidades familiares.

Expresa que su interés con el crédito es invertir en la compra de surtido al por mayor como blusas, jeans, pantalones de dama, entre otros para abastecerse lo suficiente y poder satisfacer los gustos de su clientela con la variedad que ofrecerá; esto le ayudará a mejorar las ventas  y los ingresos que recibe, además le hará frente a su mayor desafío que es sostenerse frente a la competencia desleal que se presenta en el sector. 

Cindi manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y pagar la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Cindi, at 25 years of age, is married and mother of one child, who she has provided for with hard work and dedication.

For a long time, she has worked as an independent merchant at her own clothing store; she works there every day for 10 hours and has managed to generate income to pay for her family's needs.  

She said that her interest with the loan is to invest in the purchase of merchandise at wholesale such as blouses, jeans, women's pants, and more, in order to stock up sufficiently and to able to satisfy the tastes of her customers with the variety that she offers.  This will help her to improve her sales and income that she receives.  In addition it will address her greatest challenge which is to sustain her business in the face of the unfair competition which arises in this sector.  

Cindi says that her greatest wish is to improve their housing conditions and to pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise at wholesale such as blouses, jeans, women's pants, among other things.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is 42 years of age and the mother of two children, living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a green grocer by profession, and he has been selling fresh vegetables at a shop in a nearby town for many years. 

Her husband offers seasonal and fresh vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this vegetable shop. Nowadays, the needs of his family have suddenly increased, and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs. So, he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales of the vegetables. Therefore, Shahnaz has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy additional seasonal vegetables. 

Shahnaz is thankful to Kiva and it's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fresh vegetables for her husband's green grocery business.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Zenaida works hard to support her family.

She has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and general store businesses. Zenaida is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of charcoal to resell.

Zenaida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 40 years old and has four children. Gina is married and has two children are still in school.

Gina is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Gina requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Gina has been in this business for 7 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jonalyn is 33 years old and has four children are currently in school.

Jonalyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. Jonalyn requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional material like fish nets, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other material for her business.

Jonalyn has been in this business for 2 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional material like fish nets, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other material for her business

loans.name: Jusebel

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Jusebel works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending.  Jusebel is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF to  purchase more vegetables to sell like squash, egg plant, beans, potato, sweet potato, cabbage and other vegetables to sell.

Jusebel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell like squash, egg plant, beans, potato, sweet potato, cabbage and other vegetables to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Susan works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. Susan is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Fernando Julio

texts.es:
Pueden faltarle recursos, puede no tener grandes lujos, pero Fernando no se queja, vive su realidad a pesar de tener un negocio humilde como lo es el reciclaje mantiene a su familia conformada por 4 hijos, su sueño es tener comida, ha pasado hambre, necesidades y solo pide no aguantar más hambre.

Fernando solicita un préstamo para tener capital de trabajo  y comprar la chatarra que le ofrecen diariamente, los motivos del préstamo sobran, ayúdalo.
texts.en:
He may lack resources, he may not have great luxury, but Fernando does not complain. He lives his reality despite having a humble business as it is recycling. He supports his family consisting of 4 children. His dream is to have food; he has been hungry and in want, and asks only to endure no more hunger.

Fernando is requesting a loan to have working capital and buy the scrap that is offered to him daily. Reasons of the loan abound; help him.

loans.use: to have working capital to buy materials for recycling.

loans.name: Lazaro Eliseo

texts.es:
Lázaro, vive en casa propia junto a su esposa e hijos, para poder cumplir con la responsabilidad de familiares, se dedica a cultivar granos básicos y a la crianza de cerdos, ya cuenta con mucha experiencia por lo que no representa dificultades.
Invertirá el capital en la compra de insumos agrícolas para limpiar el terreno de la maleza y sembrar maíz, pretende tener mejores cosechas y recuperar la inversión con nuevas ganancias que le servirán para cancelar las cuotas de la deuda adquirida.
Su visión es tener un negocio productivo y estabilizar su situación económica.
texts.en:
Lazaro lives in his own home together with his wife and children.  In order to meet the responsibility of family, he makes a living cultivating basic grains and breeding pigs.  Since he already has much experience, this does not present difficulties. 

He will invest the capital in the purchase of agricultural inputs to clear the field of weeds and to plant corn.  He aims to have better yields and to recoup the investment with new profits that will serve him to cancel out the acquired debt.  

His vision is to have a productive business and to stabilize his economic situation.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs to clear the field of weeds and to plant corn.

loans.name: Lelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Lelita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell sea foods business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Lelita is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to buy crabs, shrimp, oyster and other see foods to sell to her customers.

Lelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy crabs, shrimp, oyster and other sea foods to sell to her customers

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 59 years old and married with eight children.

She runs an agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Lilia is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Lilia has been in this business for 2 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Victoria is 63 years old and has one child who is in school.

Victoria has a general store business in the Philippines. Victoria requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Victoria has been in this business for five years. In the future, Victoria would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell

loans.name: Sanobar

texts.en:
Sanobar is a skillful girl. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1995 and she is living in a village with her family. She is busy with planting agricultural products in her yard. She likes her activity, but also wants to do business serving women with traditional dresses. She participated at training “Women entrepreneur – achieve success” which was provided by IMON to startup clients. 

She dreams to start doing business, but she does not have the money to buy a sewing machine. She asked a loan from Kiva lenders to buy a sewing machine, in order to start her business. She wants to be supported.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to make traditional Tajik dresses for women

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.en:
Pelagia is thankful that she previously accessed a PHP 11,000 loan that she used for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another PHP 11,000 loan to pay for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She is thanking God and you for your good heart and the financial help that will be given to her.

Pelagia hopes to acquire another tricycle to improve her income. She prays for the safety of her driver and passengers on all of their trips. Every week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Pablo Manuel

texts.es:
Pablo es un hombre de 54 años de edad, es una persona del campo, luchadora, emprendedora, soñadora, un hombre que trabaja 10 horas diarias para generar el sustento de su familia, tiene un negocio de cría de cerdos.

Pablo tiene dos hijos la mayor de 15 años y el menor de 10, Pablo quiere solicitar un préstamo para mejorar su negocio, busca tranquilidad, sostenibilidad y un deseo de poder darle una fiesta de 15 años a su hija, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo pero no   para costear el evento, quiere invertirlo en su empresa, comprando cerdos y alimento que le permita vender lo suficiente para ir pagando la fiesta e ir pagando el préstamo puntualmente, por ello apóyalo permítele aumentar su utilidad y hacer realidad el sueño de su pequeña.
texts.en:
Pablo is a 54 year old man. He is a determined and entrepreneurial farmer and a dreamer. He is a man who works 10 hours daily in order to generate his family's livelihood. Pablo has a pig farming business.

Pablo has two children. The oldest is 15 years of age and the youngest is 10. Pablo is requesting a loan to improve his business. He is in search of tranquility, sustainability, and wishes to be able to throw a 15th birthday celebration for his daughter. He is requesting the loan for this reason, but not to cover the cost of the event. He wants to invest it in his business by purchasing pigs and feed that allow him to make enough sales in order to pay for the celebration and punctually pay the loan. Support him for this reason.
