Allow him to increase his profits and make his little girl's dream a reality.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of Svay Reang province’s Svay Chrom district, Sokha is aged 35 years and married with three children, two of whom are in school while another one is too young. For more than 10 years, she and her husband have been selling grocery items as the primary source of her family’s income to make a living and sometimes her husband works as a paid worker in the local area. They can earn about KHR66,000 per day and manage to save about 10,000KHR each day for the future needs. 

Sokha has been a member of VisionFund for two cycles already and she wisely and successfully used the past loans to make her living condition better. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of her loan to spend on buying grocery items for resale. She hopes that this loan will enable her to extend her farmland to increase her rice farming production to make more rice to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland to improve yield and profits

location.town: Svay Reang Province, Svay Chrom District

loans.name: Fredis Francisco

texts.es:
Fredis, con 54 años de edad, se ha dedicado por muchos años a vender abarrotes en una tienda en el municipio de Taraza; de esta forma complementa los ingresos con los que ha sacado adelante a sus 3 hijos.

Su tenacidad y perseverancia le han permitido luchar incansablemente, siempre buscando la manera de salir adelante, esto lo impulsa a solicitar el crédito para comprar una vitrina y comprará surtido al por mayor como snacks, gaseosas, dulces, productos de panadería, entre otros, esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y tendrá más variedad de productos para ofrecer a los clientes, mejorando así sus ventas e ingresos.

Fredis manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es poder mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y lograr que su negocio sea mucho más rentable, que le garantice una estabilidad económica favorable y así poder brindarle bienestar a su familia.

El confía en el apoyo de la Corporación interactuar y en los prestamistas de Kiva para lograr este objetivo.
texts.en:
Fredis, at 54 years of age, has dedicated many years to selling groceries in a shop in the municipality of Taraza.  In this way he supplements the income with which he has raised his 3 children.

His tenacity and perseverance has enabled him to fight unceasingly, always looking for the means to get ahead.  This has pushed him to request a loan to buy a display cabinet and to buy stock at wholesale such as snacks, soft drinks, sweets, and baked goods amongst other items.  This will allow him to continue with his work and have a wider variety of products to offer his customers, thereby improving his sales and income.

Fredis reveals that his greatest desires are to be able to improve the condition of his home and to make his business much more profitable, which will guarantee him economic stability and in that way allow him to provide for the welfare of his family.

He has confidence in the help of the corporation Interactuar and the lenders of Kiva to achieve these objectives.

loans.use: to buy stock at wholesale like snacks, sodas, sweets, and baked goods amongst others

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is the age of 47 and mother of four. She  lives in Lahore, Pakistan, with her husband who is a rickshaw driver by profession. From the past many days his rickshaw is not working properly because for which he was unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. 

However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. Therefore,Shahnaz has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. 

Shahnaz is so much thankful to Kiva and Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to maintain her husbands rickshaw.

loans.name: Samon's Group

texts.en:
Aged 50 years, Samon is married and lives with her family in a rural area located in the Svay Reang province. She is a mother of five children. She earns a living through farming rice which she had been in for 32 years. She can earn about KHR35,000 per day from the current business and is able to save about 15,000 each day for the future. 

This is the second loan for Samon with VisionFund. She has used past loans wisely and successfully to improve her family’s livelihood. Now she is leading another group to ask for a new loan. Samon is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on renovating her old house. This loan will enable her to extend her farmland so as to increase her rice farming production to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Svay Reang Province, Svay Chrom District

loans.name: Yonie

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Yonie works hard to support her family.

She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food processing. Yonie is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pig.

Yonie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehanna is a 53-year old, married and energetic woman living with her husband and four children in the area of Lahore,Pakistan. He owns a general store in which he sells shampoo, bath soaps, detergents, biscuits, rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store as well, his some relatives like to purchase from his general store. He speaks with monotonous tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone; he has built up very good relation with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town that is the reason his business running well. 

Due to good relations his sales have increased a lot but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with demand. Moreover, his customer demand fresh milk and ice cream as well. To cope with demand of his customer he wants to start a milk and ice cream business in his store as well. 

But he does not have sufficient amount to open additional business of milk and ice cream. Therefore,Rehanna has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that he would be able to open a new additional business of milk sales and ice cream in his general store. He hopes that lenders will support him and this loan will prove productive for his business as well. She is very impressed with the Kiva loan cycle system and she is thankful to Kiva lenders

loans.use: to buy general store's inventory for her son.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy drinks and beverages for selling in the pub

loans.name: Siek

texts.en:
Siek, a 40-year-old married factory worker with four children in her care, lives in Takeo province in Cambodia. From 2002 to 2104, Siek and her 42-year-old husband earned their main income from rice cultivation. As farmers, they could not earn enough to support their family, so they stopped farming and started working in a factory in 2014, earning USD10 each day. 

Siek is now requesting a loan to buy a calf to fatten and sell and zinc sheets to renovate her house. With this loan, she will be able to improve her family’s finances and have a nicer house for her family to live in. 

In the future, Siek wants to buy more farmland, save money to build a new house, and help her children achieve higher education.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheets to renovate her house and a calf to fatten and sell

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maricel is 27 years old and has two children who are in school.

Maricel has a firewood sales business in the Philippines. Maricel requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of firewood to sell.

Maricel has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 52 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school.

Janet works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Janet has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twelve years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Janet aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gesery

texts.en:
Gesery is 55 years old, married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Gesery has a general store business in the Philippines. Gesery requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell .

Gesery has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Gesery would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell .

loans.name: Samith's Group

texts.en:
Samith lives in a rural village of the Svay Chrom district of Svay Reang province, Cambodia. He is 58 years old and married with eight children. To support his big family, he has been growing rice and raising pigs for 40 years. 

This is Samith’s group loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. He and another member are just a member of VisionFund. Now he is leading his group of two to apply for a loan. Samith will use her portion to renovate his old house and use some portion of it to spend on buying pig feeds. With this loan, he hopes to have a decent house for living in.

loans.use: to renovate his old house, to make a decent house to live in

location.town: Svay Reang Province, Svay Chrom District

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 61 years old, married with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Erlinda has a general store business in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Erlinda has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Erlinda would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 59 years old, married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Flora has a general store business in the Philippines. Flora requested a PHP 26,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

Flora has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Flora would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 34 years old with four children, ages eight, six, four, and nine months old. She is a hard-working entrepreneur.

She and her husband operate their fish cracker business. They’ve learned this business from her husband's former job in production in the fish cracker factory. When her husband's contract was over, instead of finding another job, they started to put up a small store for fish crackers in their house. Her husband made the crackers from the fresh fish and she was the one selling the crackers to her neighbors and friends. And because of the low price and since fish crackers are a popular snack food of the Filipinos, customers patronized their crackers until such time that they were ordering in bulk and buying bags of their crackers.

Fe has been a Social Enhancement for Entrepreneurial Development (SEED) partner for four years and they have seen Fe's improvement through hard work and good management.

Fe is now delivering their fish crackers in their community and other nearby towns. She bought a second-hand vehicle to deliver their goods, employed four helpers from her community, and best of all, she was able to put her children into a good school. 

Fe wanted to expand her business and add a stall near a market where she can display her crackers and other snack foods.

Fe is now requesting a loan, amounting to PHP 100,000, to buy five boxes of assorted biscuits, five boxes of assorted cupcakes, two boxes of banana chips, and five boxes of cookies as additional goods, aside from her very own fish crackers to sell in her new store. 

Fe wants to expand her business and add another store in the future. She wants to save more money for her children's future and to provide comfortably for her family, while helping her community through employment.

loans.use: to buy five boxes of assorted biscuits, five boxes of assorted cupcakes, two boxes of banana chips, and five boxes of cookies to sell in her new store.

loans.name: Makwetu Grp Group

texts.en:
Mwajuma, a businesswoman who is early forties, is married and has got four children who are at school. She involves with business selling cereals(maize and millet) and Irish potatoes together with fruits. She is really a hardworking mama who has been in this business for 20 years now. She dream to have a center where she can be able to store and resell those products, she need to catch up more customers and get away from unsettled movements. She starts working from 8.am to 6:30.pm per working, Mwajuma is able to make a small profit per month.

This is her third credit from Kiva partner's Tujijenge Tanzania to be apportioned to Makwetu, two members group. The members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. She used the previous two credits, paid back in full, to buy bags of corn to put to her business to resell. Mwajuma earned profit which she used to plow back into her business. She is now requesting her third credit which she will use to buy bags of Irish potatoes,millet and corns for her business to resell.

She is so thankful to those who supported and keep supporting her life.

loans.use: to buy bags of Irish potatoes,millet and corns for her business to resell.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
As the married mother of five children, Judith works hard to support her family.

She has a ice candy business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming rice. Judith is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her ice candy business.

Judith has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her ice candy business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 32 years old, married and has one child in school. 

Josephine is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Josephine has been raising pigs for seven years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Esperance Twigire Acb Group

texts.en:
Esperance is the group leader of this sub group. She is 39 years old, and she is married with four children aged between 6-15; they all go to school.
This entire group generally owns small general stores, while Esperance own a butchery. She has been doing this business for past five years.

With the loan she would like to buy more meat to sell, and with the profits she wishes to pay school fees for her children.

She wishes to expand her business of be four times bigger in the future, with the the future profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: To buy more meat to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is aged 45. He is a hardworking teacher and is married with six children; only five attend school in Hoima, Uganda. He deals in farming, mainly growing passion fruits, which is supplemented by income earned from teaching. 

He intends to grow and expand his business so as to improve on their standards of living. 

He will use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 56 years old and single woman. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lolita has a general store business in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 29,000 loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Lolita has been in this business for five years. In the future, Lolita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Zoodo De Bingo Group

texts.fr:
M. TASSERE est responsable du groupe  ZOODO DE BINGO. Marié il père de 07 enfants. Le plus âgé a 26 ans et le moins âgé a 05 ans. 02 enfants vont à l’école et il a 07 personnes en charge.
Monsieur est tailleur depuis 30 ans. Il s’approvisionne  dans les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, compte s’acheter 05 mètres de double col, 01 rouleau de popeline et 03 paquets de fils. 
Monsieur veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour réinvestir dans son activité. Il ambitionne être plus tard un grand tailleur.
texts.en:
Mr. TASSERE is the official of the group ZOODO DE BINGO. He is a married father of seven children. The oldest is 26, and the youngest is 5. Two of the children go to school. He has seven persons to support. 

Mr. TASSERE has been a tailor for thirty years. He gets his supplies from nearby markets. With the money granted, he intends to purchase 5 meters of double col, a roll of poplin, and 3 packets of thread. He wants to use the profits from his loan for reinvesting in his business. His ambition later is to be a major tailor.

loans.use: to purchase 5 meters of double col, a roll of poplin, and 3 packets of thread

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Luis se gana la vida prestando sus servicios de voceador trabaja para distintos negocios en el municipio de Abejorral, actividad con la cual ha intentado generar los ingresos necesarios para su sostenimiento.

Trabaja actualmente todos los días en los contratos que le resulten en la zona.

Luis pide un préstamo para la compra de un nuevo megáfono para remplazar el que tiene en mal estado. De esta forma podrá ofrecer sus servicios de una mejor manera.
texts.en:
Luis makes a living by providing his services as a news vendor.  He works for various businesses in the municipality of Abejorral.  With this occupation, he has tried to generate the income necessary to sustain himself.

He currently works every day for the contracts that he has in the area.

Luis is requesting a loan for the purchase of a new megaphone to replace the one he has, which is in poor condition.  In this way, he will be able to offer his services in a better way.

loans.use: to buy a new megaphone to replace one which is in poor condition.

loans.name: Maria Denis

texts.es:
Con su negocio de confecciones, María ha logrado sacar adelante a su hijo con gran coraje y perseverancia.

Trabaja 6 días a la semana durante 8 horas, enfrentando múltiples dificultades como el alto costo de los insumos para su trabajo.

Solicita un préstamo para renovar sus máquinas de confección y para la compra de insumos para la confección como telas, hilos, agujas, encajes, entre otros.

Con este préstamo podrá mejorar su producción y aumentara cu capacidad de trabajo.
texts.en:
With her sewing business, María has managed to raise her son with great courage and perseverance. María works eight hour days six days a week. She faces several difficulties such as the high cost of supplies for her business.

She is requesting a loan to renovate her sewing machines and to buy sewing supplies to make clothing such as fabric, thread, needles, and lace among others. With this loan she will be able to improve her production and increase her ability to work.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies such as fabric, thread, needles, and lace among other things.

loans.name: Kiran

texts.en:
Kiran is a married woman and has been running her beauty parlor for the past ten years. She does her job passionately. She knows the techniques of makeup and hair design and is a well-known beautician in her town. Kiran is a responsible mother of two children and is working hard to meet their day-to-day expenses. 

She has slowly but surely improved her business through the support of her husband. Now she has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy more beauty products including lotions, makeup kits and lightening creams. The loan would enable her to cater to a large number of customers efficiently.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for her parlor to deal with an expanding client base

loans.name: Séraphine

texts.fr: Séraphine est une femme mariée âgée de 34 ans qui vit à Adidogomé avec ses cinq enfants. Pour contribuer à l’épanouissement de sa famille, Séraphine vend de la bouillie qu’elle prépare à l’aide du maïs accompagné des beignets dans son quartier. Séraphine s’approvisionne une fois par mois auprès des fournisseurs du quartier pour disposer en permanence ses ingrédients. Pour acheter des bols de maïs, Séraphine demande ce crédit pour financer son achat et développer favorablement son activité pour avoir plus de rentabilité.
texts.en: Séraphine is a married woman, 34 years old, living in Adidogomé with her five children. To help her family to thrive, she sells porridge, which she makes from corn and serves with beignets, in her district. She gets her supplies once a month from neighborhood suppliers in order to have a constant supply of ingredients. To purchase tubs of corn, Séraphine is asking for this loan to finance her purchase and to develop her business in order to be more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase 50 tubs of corn

loans.name: Kimleng

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Bovel district of Battambang province, Kimleng is 60 years old and married, with three children. 
The primary sources of her family’s income are from rice farming, cassava and bean growing. To better support the family, her husband sometimes works for others for a fee. Having been in this business for thirteen years, she can earn about 15USD per day to support her family. The main challenge for her family’s business is a lack of working capital for operating an agribusiness. 

Kimleng has never been with VisionFund before. Now she is seeking for a loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and for plowing the fields and she also use some portion of her loan to spend on buying household supplies. She hopes to expand her business so as to increase her family’s income to better her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and to plow the fields ready for planting

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia along with her husband lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a rickshaw for the last five years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of entire family. Nazia's husband needs to make maintenance of his vehicle because the current condition of his vehicle is not good. It requires some maintenance charges to maintain his rickshaw . 

Due to insufficient financial means he is unable to make maintenance of his vehicle. Therefore Nazia has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.
With the help of this loan Nazia's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. In this way he can provide the better transport facilities to earn the profitable income. Nazia also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs for the  future.

loans.use: to maintain her husbands rickshaw

loans.name: Enyovi

texts.fr: Etant une femme mariée et mère de deux enfants, Enyovi est âgée de 31 ans et vit à Adidogomé. Dans le quartier, Enyovi vend du charbon de bois pour répondre aux besoins de son ménage. Enyovi s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des sacs de charbons de bois, Enyovi demande ce crédit pour réaliser son objectif afin d’avoir le bénéfice nécessaire pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation.
texts.en: A married mother of two, Enyovi is a 31-year-old woman living in Adidogomé. She sells charcoal in the district to respond to household needs. She gets her supplies three times a month at the market. To order sacks of of charcoal, Enyovi is asking for this loan to make the profit necessary for helping her children with their education.

loans.use: to purchase 14 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Cherovette

texts.en:
Cherovette is 37 years old and she is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Cherovette is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Cherovette requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Cherovette has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Cherovette would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est une femme mariée et  âgée  de 40 ans. Avec ses quatre enfants, Afi vit à Agoè pour vendre du riz préparé accompagné du spaghetti dans le quartier. Ce commerce lui procure le bénéfice et Afi s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Afi sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des sacs de riz qu’elle pourra vendre pour avoir un profit considérable et faire face à ses préoccupations.
texts.en: Afi is a married woman, 40 years old, and living with her four children, in Agoè in order to sell cooked rice served with spaghetti in the district. This business brings in a profit. She gets her supplies three times a month at the market. Afi is requesting this loan to purchase sacks of rice she will be able to sell, so as to have a significant profit and to cope with her concerns.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of rice

loans.name: Shohista

texts.en:
Shohista is a talented woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1988 and is living in village with her big family. She is married and has three children. Her husband is an emigrant that works hard to earn money and ensure his family. She wants to have a better their standard of living and tries to help her husband. She is willing to do business and earn money to feed their family. 

She was interested in IMON’s training to start up clients and wished to participate in it. After participation she got necessary knowledge and opportunity to open her new business. She is planning to serve Tajik women with beautiful dresses. She hopes to have the best tailoring salon in her area and has regular customers. She is requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine. 

She awaits Kiva lenders kindness and hopes will have a good opportunity to help her husband to ensure their family.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to make traditional Tajik dresses for women

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 64 years old and has one child.  

Josefina is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Josefina requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Josefina has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Josefina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is 58 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming corn in the Philippines. Jovita is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jovita has been in this business for 4 years and also earns additional income from buy and sell rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Bashir

texts.en:
Bashir is a hard working man from kisenyi cell, kakoba Mbarara district. He is an agriculturalist who has applied for a loan of ugx3,000,000 to hire labour to clear his farm in preparation for the planting season. He also wants to boost his poultry business by buying chicks and poultry feeds. He supplements the income by a business of transport in mbarara town. 

Bashir has dreams of having a good poultry business and accumulating money to start other businesses. Indeed he is expanding but he needs to buy chicken feed and other business materials to use in order to increase output which will increase income for the family. Bashir appreciates the good work of the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy chicks and their feeds

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 34 ans, Adjo est mère de trois enfants. Adjo habite à Baguida pour exercer ses activités. Adjo vend des friperies dans le quartier afin de trouver son bénéfice et satisfaire agréablement ses besoins quotidiens. Adjo s’approvisionne trois fois au marché pour disposer de son stock. Dans le souci de commander des habits et des pantalons, Adjo demande ce crédit pour réaliser son achat et tirer une marge bénéficiaire pour soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille.
texts.en: Married and 34 years old, Adjo is the mother of three. She lives in Baguida to operate her business. She sells secondhand clothing in the district to make a profit and to meet day-to-day needs appropriately. She gets her supplies three times a month at the market in order to have an inventory. Concerned about putting in an order for clothing and pants, Adjo is asking for this loan to realize her purchase and to derive a profit margin for supporting her husband in covering family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase 90 shirts and 20 pants

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Agée de 28 ans, Ablavi  est une femme mariée vivant dans le quartier d’Adakpamé avec son enfant. Ablavi est très dynamique et vend des produits cosmétiques pour satisfaire favorablement ses clients. Son activité lui procure un bénéfice nécessaire pour venir en aide aux besoins de la famille. Ablavi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Ablavi demande ce crédit pour commander des savons et des pommades pour vendre et gagner encore plus de revenus et permettre une bonne éducation à son enfant.
texts.en: Ablavi, aged 28, is a married woman living in the Adakpamé district with her child. She is very energetic and sells cosmetic products to satisfy her customers in a favorable manner. Her business brings in a profit necessary for helping out her family in meeting its needs. She gets her supplies twice a month at the market. Ablavi is asking for this loan to order some soaps and ointments to sell and earn more income, enabling a good education for her child.

loans.use: to purchase 9 dozen of soap and 8 ointments

loans.name: Ruben Dario

texts.es:
Ruben, de 51 años, inicio con un negocio de prestación de servicios de jardinería hace aproximadamente 1 año con el afán de buscar una actividad que le generara ingresos para poder sobrevivir.

En el momento, encuentra su motivación para trabajar incansablemente en sus dos hijos y es así como desea ofrecerles lo mejor para su vida y desarrollo.

Hoy en día sus hijos se han convertido en la alegría de este hombre trabajador.

Solicita un préstamo en la Corporación Interactuar para la compra de una guadañadora nueva con la que mejorara su servicio.

Con este préstamo podrá sostener su negocio y a su vez a sus hijos, brindándoles una mejor estabilidad no solo económica, sino tambien educativa.
texts.en:
Ruben, 51 years old, started his business providing landscaping services about one year ago with the hope of finding a business that would generate income for him to survive. At this time, he finds his motivation to work tirelessly in his two children. He wants to offer them the best for their lives and development. Today, his children have become a joy for this hard working man. 

Ruben is requesting a loan through Corporación Interactuar to buy a new weed trimmer to improve his services. With this loan he will be able to support his business and in turn his children, giving them better stability, not just economic, but also educational.

loans.use: to buy a new weed trimmer to improve his services.

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.en:
Dionisio is a 54 years old, married and has five children to provide for. He is engaged in a transport business as a source income of his family. He aims for a better income as the father of the family. 

Recently, he borrowed a loan to buy motor parts for motor maintenance so that he can continue carrying passengers, more passengers that will generate more income.

Dionisio plan for the future to save money to renovate his house.

loans.use: To buy motor parts for motor tricycle maintenance.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Judith works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.  

Judith is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of vegetables to sell for her buy and sell vegetables business.

Judith has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 59 years old and married with five children. Lydia works very hard to provide for them.

Lydia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

Lydia has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as can goods, junk foods, biscuits, candies and other groceries. 

In the future, Lydia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Battambang province’s Bovel district, Chantha is 27-year-old mother of three dependent kids; one is too young for school while another two are in school. She is a rice farmer in the local area and supplements her family’s income by working as a paid worker. She has been in this business for 10 years. Lack of working capital is still the main problem for her business. 

This is the first loan for Chantha with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is leading her group to ask for a loan. She will use her portion to buy seeds, pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy seeds, pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Bour's Group

texts.en:
Bour, 39, is a married living with her child in a rural village of the Kam Rieng district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She earns a living through farming rice and working for others for a fee. She has been in this business for 16 years. The main challenge for her business is a lack of working capital for operating her business. 

Bour has never been with VisionFund before, now she is leading her group of three to ask for a loan. As the leader, Bour wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income so as to fulfill her dream of renovating her old house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her son in purchasing more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits, etc. for his general store.

loans.name: Nazeeran

texts.en:
Nazeeran is 49-years old married person, mother of 4 children. She is living happily with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
Her husband owns an embroidery shop. He has been selling embroidery material for many years. He sells sequins, pearls, threads, precious stones, silk, needles and wooden frames for embroidery. The embroidery material for bridal dresses is very expensive but its turnover very high. 


Due to high costs, he is facing a shortage of material and is unable to purchase expensive raw materials to sell. Therefore, Nazeeran requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can resolve the shortage of embroidery materials. Through this amount her husband will buy stocks of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, precious stones and pearls of various colors.

Nazeeran is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw material for her husband's embroidery supplies shop

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en:
Gerlie is 54 years old and married with two children, two children are still in school, Gerlie works very hard to provide for them.

Gerlie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy item to sell like canned goods, personal care product, noodles, spices, coffee, drinks and other personal care products.

Gerlie has been in this business for 1 year. 

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy item to sell like canned goods, personal care product, noodles, spices, coffee, drinks and other personal care products

loans.name: Jocel

texts.en:
Jocel, 45, is married and has three children, two of whom are presently in school. For the past two years she has worked hard running her sari-sari, or small general store in the Philippines.

Jocel has applied for a 5000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, noodles, milk, coffee, drinks, etc. She is working to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her sari-sari

loans.name: Sombor's Group

texts.en:
Sombor, 57, lives with her husband and four children in a rural village of the Sangke district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has struggled to feed and care for her children by growing cassava which she has been in the business of for 20 years, while her husband buys and sells recycle items and sometimes he works for others for a fee to add up more income for the family. Lack of working capital is the main challenge for operating her business. 

Sombor’s group consists of two members who have been with VisionFund for two cycles and they completely paid back the loans. Sombor wisely and successfully used the loans from VisionFund to relieve family’s financial burden and afford to buy some basic household necessities for the family. As the leader, she is leading her group to apply for another loan. She wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice well  and earn more healthy crops to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland, for a healthy and abundant rice crop

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a hardworking man aged 33 years old and a resident of Buhigure,Kamuri, with 2 children. He has a business in a rural trading centre and he intends to expand it to wholesale shop.  He says the distance from the trading centre to Isingiro town is so long which eats into his profit and also compromises his service delivery since he does not have some of the items needed. Having come from an extended family, he has many dependents that he takes care of and he also supports in paying tuition for his siblings, because he wants them to study and get jobs so that they can be self sustaining.

Robert wants to replenish his business stock, so he requests a loan to buy general stock of daily household use items, such as rice, sugar, corn flour, beverages, soap, stationery, toiletries and other personal use products. This loan will allow his store to continue being one of the best stocked ones in the neighborhood.

This business is allowing him to support his household, help his parents, siblings, relatives and allocate a small amount of her earnings to save up for building his own house. It is his big dream to have a house that he loves because of the effort its taking to save for it. He has to work very hard to achieve this.

For these reasons, help and support this progressive man, who wants to become self-sufficient and also contribute to his community.
Pictured is Ugafode credit staff (left) and Robert in his general store.

loans.use: To boost his store's stocks of everyday items so it will be the best stocked shop in town

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en: Tahira is a 45-year-old single woman. She is shown in the photo with her brother. She has been involved in the business of cloth trade. She purchases a variety of cloth at low prices from the city market and sells it in her own town. She has a strong customer base. Tahira has requested a Murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR. She wanted to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get a boost in her earnings with her loan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get a boost in her earnings with her loan.

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en:
Mercidita, 67 years old, is married and has four children. For the past three years she has bought and sold charcoal in the Philippines to earn an income.

Mercidita has applied for a 5000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy extra sacks of charcoal to sell. She is working hard to develop her business.

loans.use: to buy extra sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 56 years old and has five children. Rosario is married and has two children who are in school.

Rosario is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosario requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Rosario has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosario would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Sochat's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in Battambang province’s Kam Rieng district, Sochat is now 45 years old and married. She has four children. Sochat and her husband are farmers who grow cassava as their main business to support the family and they supplement family’s income by working for others for a fee. She has been in the business for 10 years and the main challenge for her business is lacking of working capital. 

This is the third loan for Sochat with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The past loans have helped her better support her family. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her cassava. She hopes this loan will enable her to extend her cassava plantation and also grow her crops healthily to make more income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her cassava so as to improve the family's living conditions

loans.name: Sokun's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in Battambang province’s Bovel district, Sokun is now 35 years old and married. She has five children, two of whom are in school. Sokun and her husband have farmed rice for the past seven years. Daily, they earn approximately 55,000 KHR and can afford to save about 24,000 KHR of that.

Sokun is a first-time client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund Cambodia. She is the leader of this two-member group that is applying for a 2,100,000 KHR loan to be divided between them. Sokun will use her portion to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes the loan from VisionFund will enable her to grow more healthy and bountiful crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
A rural villager living in Kandal province’s Kandal Stoeng district, Oun is 54 years old and married with four children. She farms rice and mushrooms and raises chickens. Her husband is also employed. Together they can earn about 60,000 KHR a day.

This is will be the first loan for Oun with Kiva’s partner VisionFund Cambodia. She is applying for a 2,500,000 KHR loan to buy a reliable motorbike for her children to commute to work. She hopes to reduce their travel expenses by taxi.

loans.use: to buy a reliable motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.name: Diana Marcela

texts.es:
Diana, con su gran energía y perseverancia tiene un deseo en su mente; el de poder mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y poder formarse como una trabajadora independiente en el municipio de La Dorada.

Tiene 18 años y todas las ganas de salir adelante y progresar. Solicita un préstamo para la compra de un carro de comidas, utensilios de cocina e insumos para la preparación de comidas rápidas.

Apoya a Diana y has que su vida se lo mas prospera posible con un  préstamo!
texts.en:
Diana, with her high energy and perseverance has a desire in mind; the power to improve her living conditions and to train as an independent worker in the town of La Dorada.

She is 18 years old and her desires are to learn and grow. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of a cart for food, utensils, and supplies for preparing quick meals.

Support Diana and make it possible for her life to prosper with this loan!

loans.use: to purchase a cart for food, utensils, and supplies for the preparation of quick meals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow and farm tools

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es:
Rafael es padre de una hija de 2 años. Aparte de su familia, se dedica también a la agricultura desde hace 5 años. 

Aprendió de este oficio empíricamente, es decir, a través del trabajo con sus padres. 

El y su familia viven una zona rural de Colombia en la cual no es fácil tener acceso a servicios financieros como los que otorga Interactuar. 

Su crédito lo usara para comprar insumos agropecuarios como semillas, productos para el control de plagas, y abonos para poder preparar sus cultivos de yuca. 

Gracias a este crédito, la economía y calidad de vida de su familia mejorarían pues aumentara sus ingresos. 

¡Impacte la vida de Rafael y su familia con un crédito!
texts.en:
Rafael is the father of a two-year-old girl. Aside from his dedication to his family, he has made a living in agriculture for the last five years. He learned this work empirically, i.e., through working with his parents. He and his family live in a rural area of Colombia where it isn't easy to get access to financial services like the ones Interactuar provides. He will use his loan to buy agricultural supplies like seeds, insect-control products, and fertilizer to be able to prepare his cassava crops. Thanks to this loan, his family's budget and quality of life will improve as his earnings increase. 

Have an impact on Rafael's life and that of his family with a loan!

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies like seeds, insect-control products, and fertilizer to be able to prepare his cassava crops.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia, 49 years old and married with three children, works very hard to provide for her family. For six years she has operated a general store in the Philippines that sells a variety of items such as biscuits, candies, coffee, vinegar and other groceries.  

Sofia has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, home care products, eggs and other groceries. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, home care products, eggs and other groceries

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa is 61 years old and married with four children.

She runs an agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Ninfa is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pig.

Ninfa has been in this business for 3 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 32 years old, married and has one child. She wants to help her husband in providing for their children's needs. To earn a living, she is engaged in a transport business so that with her income, she can provide for her children too. Julie aims to increase her income to change her family's life so she decided to borrow a loan to buy motor parts for motorcycle repair. This will enable her business to continue to cater to passengers; more passengers will generate more income.

Julie's plan for the future is to buy a new motorcycle to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy motor parts for motorcycle repair.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Lilian has a food vending business in the Philippines. Lilian requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Lilian has been in this business for 29 years. In the future, Lilian would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food preparation business.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Loreta is 61 years old and has one child who is in school.

Loreta has a general store business in the Philippines. Loreta requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy items, such as canned goods, personal care products, etc., to sell in her store.

Loreta has been in this business for two years. In the future, Loreta would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy items, such as canned goods, personal care products, etc., to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Mary Jane is 36 years old and has two children who are in school.

Mary Jane has a fishing business in the Philippines. Mary Jane requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Mary Jane has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gear for her business

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is 64 years old and married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Marietta has a personal products business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more personal care products to sell.

Marietta has been in this business for 26 years. In the future, Marietta would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more personal care products to sell.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Mary Ann is 42 years old and has three children who are in school.

Mary Ann has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Mary Ann requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fruits to sell in her food stall.

Mary Ann has been in this business for four years. In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Adolé

texts.fr: Adolé est une femme mariée âgée de 30 ans. Adolé vit avec son enfant dans le quartier de Baguida. Adolé vend des sceaux et bassines en plastiques dans son quartier à ses clients qui trouvent satisfaction dans son activité. Adolé achète ses provisions deux fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des sceaux et bassines en plastiques, Adolé nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire pour ainsi promouvoir l’éducation de son enfant.
texts.en: Adolé is a married woman, 30 years old, living with her child in the Baguida district. She sells plastic buckets and tubs in her district to her customers who are happy with her business. She purchase her supplies twice a month at the market. To order plastic buckets and tubs, Adolé needs these funds to finance her inventory and to realize a good profit margin, so as to advance her child’s education.

loans.use: to purchase 3 dozen plastic buckets and 3 dozen plastic tubs

loans.name: Mizeituni Group

texts.fr: Angela est une femme d’affaires, membre d’une association de crédits «Mizeituni», âgée de 30 ans, mariée à un taximan moto et mère de 5 enfants  dont 3 étudient et 2 sont encore gosses. Elle est vendeuse divers matériels d’ustensiles de cuisine au marché de la ville depuis 8 ans. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter des casseroles, assiettes et gobelets. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique. Nous tenons à signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en:
Angela is a businesswoman and a member of the loan association “Mizeituni”. She is 30 years old and married to a moto-taxi driver. And she is the mother of five children, of whom three are students, and two are still very young. She has been a vendor of a variety of kitchen utensils at the town market for eight years. 

Angela is requesting a loan from Hekima to grow her business. She is going to purchase pots, pans, plates, and cups. Thus, her wish is to provide education and food for her children.
 
She thanks Hekima for supporting entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system. We really want to indicate that certain clients are carrying their babies.

loans.use: to purchase pots, pans, dishes, and cups

loans.name: Borey

texts.en:
Borey is 27 years old, single and a human resource management major in his second year at a university in the province. He resides in a village in the Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Borey has 3 siblings; he and his older brother work in an organization providing credit services and his youngest sister works in a factory. 

Borey can earn a daily income of USD 5. He is now lacking the finances to cover his university fees from his second through his fourth year; that’s why he has decided to take out a loan. This loan will help him have enough finances to earn a bachelor’s degree with specific skills to build his future. After graduation, he is going to find another better job with a better salary. Thereby he will be able to help improve his family’s living standards.

loans.use: to cover his university fees from his second through his fourth year

loans.name: Yesid Ramiro

texts.es:
Ramiro un hombre de 48 años, separado, con dos hijos de 3 y 14 años.
Debido a que no cuenta con una ayuda familiar y se encuentra desempleado, su medio para salir adelante fue dedicarse a la carpintería.

Su sueño tener una vivienda y montar su propio negocio, para así dejárselos a sus hijos.

Con el crédito ramiro pagara unas deudas y ajustara para la compra de un máquina canteadora.

Tú puedes ser parte de este sueño, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Ramiro is a man of 48 years. He is separated, with two children ages 3 and 14.

Because he didn't have family help and he was unemployed, his means of getting ahead was to work in carpentry.

His dream is to have a house and to set up his own business, so that he can leave it to his children.

With the loan, Ramiro will pay off some debts and arrange for the purchase of a edging machine.

You can be part of this dream -- make a loan!

loans.use: to buy an edging machine

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 55 years old, married with eight children.

Elisa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread and other groceries.

Elisa has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from ready to wear.

Elisa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread and other groceries

loans.name: Gemmalyn

texts.en:
Gemmalyn is a single woman, 23 years old with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Gemmalyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. Gemmalyn requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Gemmalyn has been in this business for 2 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 27 years old, married with three children.

Marissa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread and other groceries.

Marissa has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 9 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Marissa aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread and other groceries

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Mme AGUIRATA est responsable du groupe  DJIGUIYA. Elle est célibataire sans enfants. Elle a 01 personne en charge.
Madame vend des habits et des pagnes depuis 08 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans  les pays voisins.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle veut s’acheter 20 pièces de pagnes.
Elle veut épargner ses bénéfices pour pouvoir ouvrir plus tard un kiosque. Elle compte aussi s’occuper de sa mère et de son neveu.
texts.en:
Ms. AGUIRATA is the official of the group DJIGUIYA. She is unmarried and has no children. She has one person to support. 

Ms. AGUIRATA has been selling clothing and 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) for eight years. She gets her supplies from neighboring countries. With the money granted, she wants to purchase 20 lengths of ‘pagne’ cloth. She wants to save her profits to be able to open a kiosk later on. She is also counting on taking care of her mother and her nephew.

loans.use: to purchase 20 lengths of 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
L' homme par devant qui a la main sur les marmites est Mamah.
Mamah est marié vie avec sa femme et ses 4 enfants au Mali. Ses enfants sont âgés de 1 à 17 ans et 2 sont scolarisés. Respectueux et courageux, Mamah est analphabète il a fait recourt aux prêts RMCR pour acheter plus d’aluminium pour fabriquer ses marmites et faire développer son entreprise.
Mamah vit dans son village natal et depuis 20 ans il exerce son métier de forgeron. Il  s’approvisionne sur le marché hebdomadaire d’un village situé non loin de son village et les revend sur le même marché et aussi a sur un marché situe à 50 km de son village.
Mamah fait un bénéfice mensuel de 25 000FCFa ce qui lui permet de faire face aux dépenses de sa famille notamment la nourriture et aussi les frais de scolarité de ses enfants qui vont a l’école.
Mamah souhaite avoir un prêt plus élevé pour augmenter le nombre de ses forges et employers.
texts.en:
The man in front with a hand on the pots is Mamah. He and his wife have four children in Mali who are aged 1 to 17 years old. Two are in school. Respectful and courageous, he is illiterate and has turned to RMCR loans to purchase more aluminum for making pots and developing his enterprise. 

Mamah lives in the village of his birth. For twenty years, he has been working in the blacksmith trade. He gets his supplies at the weekly market of a village located not far from his own. He makes his sales at the same market and also at a market 50 km from his village. 

Mamah makes a monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA enabling him to cope with family expenses, especially school fees for his children in school. His wish is to have a bigger loan to increase the number of forges and employees he has.

loans.use: to purchase aluminum for making pots

loans.name: Celestel

texts.en:
Celestel is 40 years old and married with five children. She lives in a rural community on the outskirts of Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands.

She raises and sella pigs in her community or at the market to earn a living, and has been doing this for five years.

Celestel needs a loan to buy more piglets and pig feed to maintain her business. She plans to use her profits to cover for her family's daily expenses and also to improve her piggery business.

She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy 10 piglets and pig feed for her piggery business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more sewing materials, such as fabric, threads, laces and also to repair her sewing machine and be able to serve more customers.

loans.name: Irakli

texts.en:
Irakli is from the Chkhorotsku. He is 29 years old and lives with his mother and both of them are teachers at a local school. Irakli also earns a living through agriculture. Specifically, he owns a plot of agricultural land, where he grows maize and nut trees and also has a small vineyard. 

In addition the family has a cow. During grazing season, when his cow produces milk well, Irakli's mother makes cheese to sell, as well as for family consumption. 

Now, Irakli is requesting a loan to start an auto repair workshop in his house. With the received amount, he will buy all the needed tools and fix the cars on special projects. Irakli used to work as a hired car mechanic and has the proper experience in this field. Irakli will get a stable monthly income and improve their standard of living in the future.

loans.use: to open a car repair workshop, for a stable income

loans.name: Quyen's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Quyen, 40 years old, is a Kinh ethnic majority woman. She currently lives with her husband and her son in Mai Son district, Son La province. 
Her main occupation is land cultivation and pig breeding and each year she can sell from two to three pig herds. The income after deducting all costs is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and saved a small amount. However, the saved amount is not enough for her to buy breeding pigs and food for these pigs. 

Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose. She hopes much that loan will help her invest in breeding effectively and the next pig herd will bring her family a considerable profit. 

For herself, she will also work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to buy breeding pigs and food for these pigs

loans.name: Pum's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural area of Battambang province, Pum is 41 years old and married. She has six beloved children who are still under her care and one of them is in school. Pum earns her living through growing rice and fishing. She has been involved in her current businesses for twenty years and it earns her about 55,000KHR per day. 

Pum is a fourth-cycle client with VisionFund. The previous loans help her to have enough consumption for her family and ability to send her child to school. Due to lack of funds, she is now leading a group to take out a loan, with her requested loan portion to buy fertilizer, pesticide and pay labor fees to support her farming. 

She believes that with the help of this loan, she can boost her income to improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and pay labor fees to support her rice farming.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a married woman, 57 years old, with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Norma has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional cloth, thread, needles and maintenance for her sewing machine.

Norma has been in this business for seven years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional cloth, thread, needles and maintenance for her sewing machine

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from fattening pigs. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Mwamba Group

texts.fr: Mastaki est commerçante, trésorière du groupe solidaire «Mwamba», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un enseignant, âgée de 45 ans, mère de 10 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse des  divers produits manufacturés au marché de la ville depuis 25 ans. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle va acheter  des piles, biscuits, laits, du sucre, riz, savon Omo, huiles, etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Mastaki is a merchant and the treasurer of the solidarity group “Mwamba”. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is 45 years old and married to a teacher. And she is the mother of ten children, all provided with schooling. She has been a vendor of a variety of shop goods at the town market for 25 years. She began her business with funds from her husband. She is going to purchase batteries, cookies, milk, sugar, rice, Omo soap, oils, etc. Thus, her wish is to increase her capital and to provide education and food for her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for supporting unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase batteries, cookies, milk, sugar, rice, Omo soap, oils, etc.

loans.name: Maria Elsi

texts.es:
María, está feliz con los buenos resultados que ha tenido con el crédito anterior, pues sus clientes mantienen la fidelidad a su negocio, las circunstancias familiares son mucho más confortables y hasta la fecha no ha tenido problemas para seguir trabajando.
Siente que para continuar mejorando necesita de un nuevo crédito para resurtir su inventario, comprara carnes, quesillo, bebidas, chocolate, condimentos, aceite, gas propano y otros materiales para preparar la venta de pupusas, meriendas y bebidas, su objetivo es atender lo mejor que pueda a su clientes y tener un negocio competitivo.
texts.en: María is very happy with the good results she has had from the previous loan, as her customers remain faithful to her business, her family circumstances are much more comfortable, and so far she hasn't had any problems that have prevented her from continuing to work. To keep improving, she feels that she needs a new loan to restock her inventory. She will buy meat, cheese, drinks, chocolate, condiments, oil, propane gas and other materials to prepare pupusas, snacks and drinks for sale. Her objective is to attend to her customers as well as she can and to have a competitive business.

loans.use: to buy meat, cheese, drinks, chocolate, condiments, oil, propane gas and other materials to prepare pupusas, snacks and drinks for sale

loans.name: Apolinario

texts.es: Apolinario es un hombre de 55 años que vive junto a su pareja y su pequeño hijo en la localidad rural de Tomepampa ubicada en Arequipa. Él se dedica a la cría de animales de granja que sean orgánicos, teniendo mucho cuidado con el cuidado y la alimentación que les brinda a sus animales orgánicos,Apolinario gusta de criar sobre todo del ganado vacuno orgánico, dado que sus padres también lo hacían. Solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar un pequeño ternero orgánico y la alimentación orgánica para el ganado. en el futuro espera poder darle a su familia seguridad económica y una vida sin necesidades básicas.
texts.en:
Apolinario is a man of 55 who lives with his wife and their little son in a rural location in Tomepampa, which is located in Arequipa. He raises organic farm animals, being very careful with the care and feeding that he offers to his organic animals.

Apolinario likes to raise animals, especially organic cattle, given that his parents also did this. He is applying for the micro loan in order to be able to buy a little organic calf and the organic food for the cattle.

In the future, he hopes to be able to give his family economic security and a life that doesn't lack the basic necessities.

loans.use: to buy cattle and their organic feed.

loans.name: Tsitsi

texts.en:
Tsitsi is a 32-year-old woman from Chikomba West district. She is married with four children. Tsitsi is seen as an extraordinary woman in her village, with a heart for the needy and less privileged.  She feels that everyone deserves a chance in life. 

She was able to repay her monthly loan in time and to provide for her son. When she received this loan, which she is requesting to purchase heifers and stock feeds, as she wishes to diversify her business to cattle fattening. She really feels this business would enable her to become self-sustainable and to grow her business and earn more profit. 

She volunteers at the local community centre, actively helping to keep children in school through guidance and counseling, and life skills development for child headed families.

Thank you so much for funding her loan!

loans.use: To purchase heifers and stock feeds to provide a good income for her family

loans.name: Trang's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Trang, was born in 1992, is a Thai ethnic woman. Her family consists of four members, including her husband, her daughter and her son. Her family is living in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from cultivation and breeding goats. The annual income from cultivation and breeding after deducting all costs is about VND 40 to 50 million. However, the income is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and saved a small amount while she intends to to raise breeding goats to get more income. The saved amount is not enough, so she wants to borrow a loan to invest in this business model.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her family have money to invest in the breeding model at high productivity, and next year the breeding model will bring her family tens of goat. She also works hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to raise breeding goats for the future welfare of her family

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Rose Marie works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from pig fattening. Rose Marie is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like fish net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials.

Rose Marie has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fish net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 43 years old and has four children. She is married and three of her children are still in school.

Sylvia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Sylvia requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Sylvia has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. .

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Pastora

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Pastora works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from raising pigs and from her tricycle passenger business. Pastora is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Pastora has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Chakriya's Group

texts.en:
Chakriya is a 28-year-old mother of two small children and one of them is in school, while the other one is too young to attend school. She is a rural villager living in Battambang province. To earn income to support her family’s living, she raises chicken for sale for more than five years and it earns her about 33,300KHR per day and able to save about 17,000KHR each day. 

Chakriya has been with VisionFund for nine cycles already and completely paid back the loans. The previous loans help her to earn more income and ability to send her beloved children to school. 

Due to lack of funds, she is now leading a group to take a new Kiva loan to buy more chickens to feed and build more chicken’s cages. She hopes to earn more income and expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy more chickens to raise and also to build more chicken’s cages

loans.name: Yadires Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yadires una madre de 4 hermosos y adorables hijos,  a los cuales ama y da su vida por ellos, se dedica a la venta de mercancía, una actividad que inicio por gusto al trabajo independiente que descubrió cuando era estudiante y vendía cosas a sus amigos, aprendió sola de esta labor.

Trabaja diariamente durante 4 horas y quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de surtido de mochilas, accesorios y cosméticos, de esta forma podrá abastecer su negocio y su inventario. 

Su mayor objetivo en su vida se centra en sus hijos y es poder darles una buena calidad de vida y pagar su educación.
texts.en:
Yadires is the mother of four beautiful and adorable children who she loves and would give her life for. She makes a living by selling a variety of merchandise, a business she started because she liked working independently, which she discovered when she was a student and sold things to her friends. She learned this work by herself.

She works for four hours each day and wants to ask for a loan to buy an assortment of backpacks, accessories and cosmetics so she'll be able to stock her business and her inventory.

He greatest objective in life is centered around her children and it is to be able to give them a good quality of life and to pay for their education.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of backpacks, accessories and cosmetics so she'll be able to stock her business and her inventory

loans.name: Maria Emilse

texts.es:
Emilse una señora de 45 años de edad, con tres hijos de 22, 24 y 26 años de edad, su trabajo es vender pollos en Cundinamarca.

Con el crédito ella comprara pollos y remodelara el galpón, ya que debido a las fuertes lluvias se ha ido deteriorando.

Emilse con su espíritu emprendedor, quiere seguir luchando para cumplir el sueño de tener una casa propio, en la que pueda tener más variedad de animales y así tener una mejor estabilidad.
texts.en:
Emilse is a woman of 45, with three children ages 22, 24, and 26. Her work is selling chickens in Cundinamarca.

With the loan, she will buy chickens and remodel the chicken coop, since it has deteriorated due to the strong rains.

Emilse, with her entrepreneurial spirit, wants to continue striving to accomplish her dream of having a house of her own, in which she can have a greater variety of animals and thus have better stability.

loans.use: to buy chickens and remodel the chicken coop, since it has deteriorated due to the strong rains.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Adjo vit à Baguida et est âgée de 55 ans. Mariée, Adjo est mère de trois enfants et œuvre dynamiquement pour favoriser leur éducation. Adjo vend des bois de chauffage dans son quartier et ses environs pour avoir son revenu nécessaire pour leur subsistance. Adjo s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des bois, Adjo demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et tirer sa rentabilité.
texts.en: Adjo lives in Baguida and is 55 years old. She is a married mother of three children and energetically works for the sake of their education. She sells firewood in and around her district in order to have an income needed for their subsistence. She gets her supplies once a month at the market. To order some firewood, Adjo is asking for this loan to realize her purchase and to reach profitability.

loans.use: to purchase a truckload of firewood

loans.name: Xieng's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Xieng, born in 1971, is a Thai ethnic woman. She currently lives with her husband and her son in Mai Son district, Son La province.
Her family’s main income is from cultivation so the income is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and she saved a small amount. She wants to buy corn seed for the coming season but the saved amount is not enough. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose. 

She hopes the loan amount will help her family invest in cultivation effectively with high productivity, and the coming harvest will bring a bigger yield as half much again as last year. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to buy corn seed with high productivity which will lead to a larger crop than last year

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Agée de 46 ans, Ablavi est une mère de trois qui habite à Adakpamé. Pour exercer une activité, Ablavi vend des charbons de bois et trouve son gain favorable. Ablavi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter des sacs de charbons de bois, Ablavi nécessite ce prêt pour financer sa commande et réaliser plus de gains pour l’épanouissement de son foyer.
